loans.name: Madina

texts.en:
Madina is a single woman with one child who attends school. She rents a house with no electricity but with piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is house rent.

Madina has been operating her business of selling clothes for the last three years, selling from her shop and also selling door-to-door to her neighboring community and to passersby. She has no other source of income. She faces the major challenge of competition as many people sell the same products.

Madina decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation and its easy accessibility to financial services. With the Kshs 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase more clothing materials, shoes and handbags. She hopes to open a wholesale shop in the future.

loans.use: To purchase more clothing materials, shoes and handbags

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou D. is from the village of Lilingayon, Valencia City. She is 28 years-old and married with four school-aged children. To make a living, Marilou owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from selling both food anddaily use products in the local community. Marilou has been engaged in her business for over one year and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month.

In 2010, Marilou joined Kiva partner HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Marilou is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell.

loans.name: Fercelia

texts.en:
Fercelia E. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 29 years-old and married with two school-aged children. To make a living, Fercelia owns and operates a business raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Fercelia has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 3,500 PHP whenever she sells one of her raised animals.

In 2010, Fercelia joined Kiva partner ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Fercelia is requesting a first loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 29 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishers and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase livestock feed & other supplies

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is 32 years-old and a member of the Happy Women group from Kiva partner Faulu Kenya.  

She is a tailor who mainly makes and sells children’s outfits.  Most of her customers are her neighbors and friends.  Her husband is a waiter in a restaurant in the city centre.  She has requested a loan of 15, 000 Kes which she will use to buy fabric.  In the future, she hopes to provide a good education for her children.  In ten years, she wants to start a tailoring school.  She describes herself as a hardworking and aggressive business-lady.

loans.use: To buy fabric.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Zuberi

texts.en: Zuberi is a married woman and she has one child who attends school. She has been operating a clothes selling business for the last three years, selling her wares door to door to friends and neighbors. With the KES20,000 requested in this loan Zuberi would like to purchase a fridge to start a soft drink sales business, with hopes to open a retail shop in future. The major challenge she currently faces in her business is seasonality. Zuberi lives in a rented house which has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is rent. Zuberi decided to work with Yehu because of its good reputation from the community.

loans.use: To buy a fridge to start a soft drinks sales business.

loans.name: Sevilla

texts.en:
Sevilla P. is from the village of Soyung Echague. She is 49 years old, married and has three school-aged children. Sevilla sells pork barbecue to the local community, a business she has been engaged in for over two years. She earns approximately 4000 PHP a month.

In 2010 Sevilla joined ASKI to gain access to its financial services. She is requesting a loan of 5000 PHP to be used to purchase the ingredients needed to make her pork barbecue. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Sevilla from ASKI. She plans to use all additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

About ASKI:

Alalay sa Kaunlaran, Inc., or ASKI, is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 25 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fishermen and -women, and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce N. lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (cousin's sisters).

Joyce has a business of selling eggs. She has been in this business for 7 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Joyce sells her products at the shop, by means of wholesale. Joyce has requested a loan of 700,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more trays of eggs. She also generates additional income through a motorcycle for hire. The main business challenge(s) for Joyce include thieves and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start rearing chickens herself and to buy a plot of land. She decided to join MCDT because of low interest rates.  Joyce lives in a home that she rents; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water.  Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent  and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more trays of eggs for resale.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from her business to improve/expand the store.

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman with two children who are both in school. She has a tailor shop. With this 30,000 Kenyan shilling (KES) loan she wants to purchase materials for her shop and a new sewing machine.

Previously she was a housewife before venturing into the business which she has operated for ten years. Apart from her business she gets support from her husband and the rental houses she owns. The mode of distribution used for her products is majorly retail. Her potential customers are neighbours, friends, and students. 

Mwanaisha faces the challenge of lack of enough capital to sustain her business. Mwanaisha decided to work with Yehu since it has a good corporate image. She owns a house thus does not pay rent; the house has electricity and piped water. The greatest expenses she incurs are for electricity and her children's school fees.

loans.use: To purchase sewing materials and a sewing machine.

loans.name: Susan's Group

texts.en:
Susan S. is from the village of Namnama. She is 43 years old. Susan is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Susan S..

Susan is married and has three school-aged children. Susan owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling flowers in the market. Susan has been engaged in her business for over 18 years and earns approximately 2500 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month from it.

In 2010, Susan joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to do business. Susan is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the first loan taken out by Susan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand it.

loans.name: Mwaboya

texts.en: Mwaboya is a married woman with one child who is in school. Her husband is a chef, by profession. She owns a shop and operates public van (matatus) as her other source of income. She has been operating her business as a shopkeeper for five years. Her other source of income is earned from operating a vehicle business. With the KES 40,000 she wants to purchase cereals, beans, maize and rice. Her major challenges are seasonality and high competition, as a result of lots of motor vehicle operators. She hopes to own a van  company in the future. Her major reason for joining Yehu is because of its good reputation. Mwaboya owns a home with electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expense is electricity.

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson Ongaga is 36 years old and is married to Gaudencia Awuor, who has a grocery business. The profits made from both businesses assist in supporting the family. They have five children and live in Suna area, which is in Migori.

Samson has been in the clothing business for the past six years. He is applying for a loan of KES 70,000 that he intends to use to buy more stock of used clothes. His monthly income is KES 50,000 per month. He will use the profits made from his business to cater for the family's needs and to improve their living standards.

His hopes and dreams are to grow his business and to venture into a ready made clothes boutique.

loans.use: Buy more clothes for selling.

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en: Mwanamisi has been operating her business of selling fire wood for the past six years. She is married and has eight children; seven attend school and one is married. She sells firewood from home to her neighbours. She earns her other source of income from her spouse's salary. With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase a lorry of firewood. Previously she was selling flat breads and cooked beans. Mwanamisi faces the major challenge of high transport costs and high competition. She hopes to expand and open a charcoal stall in the future. She decided to work with Yehu because of its simplicity of membership and the fact that it did not require complex collateral. She owns a house that has no electricity but does have piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food.

loans.use: To purchase a lorry of firewood.

loans.name: Peter Wasonga

texts.en:
Peter A. is 28 years old and is married to Hellen Atieno. They have two children: Eugene is three years old and Sheryl is one year old. The wife sells vegetables and uses the profits made to contribute to the upkeep of the family. They live in Suna Migori town.

Peter runs a butchery shop and has been in this business for the past three years. He is applying for his first loan from KADET LTD and wants to use the money to buy a bull that he can slaughter and add meat to his inventory. He earns an income of KES 40,000 monthly. 

He hopes that the profits made will be enough for him to open another butcher shop and be able to employ one person to help him manage it.

loans.use: Buy a bull to slaughter and add meat to stock butcher shop.

loans.name: Huchitbold

texts.en:
Huchitbold S. lives with his wife and seven year old son in a rented house in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. His wife works as a designer in an Etno salon. He operates a cell phone retail business in the biggest market, Narantuul. 

Huchitbold began his business in 2008 and, because of his strong customer service skills and stable business operation, he has become very successful. He purchases CDMA system cellphones from a wholesale supplier and he imports GSM system cellphones from Erlian, a border city of China. He hopes that soon he will be able to expand his business further and buy new house for his family. He is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more cellphones to increase his working capital for the business.

loans.use: To purchase more cellphones.

texts.en:
Rosemary A. is 42 years old. She is married to Charles, a primary school teacher. They have three children: 22 years, 19 years and 14 years old. They live in Migori town.

Rosemary has been in the mining business for the past four years. She is applying for her third loan from KADET LTD., after successfully completing the previous loan. She was introduced to KADET LTD by a friend who is also a client. She intends to use the money to buy mining materials like fuel, mercury and spare parts for her gold crusher. She earns KES 100,000 per month from her business. Most of the profits made are used to pay school fees for her three children.

She hopes to see all her children well-educated and to have her family well-established.

loans.use: Buy materials to use for mining.

loans.name: Marissa

Her major aim of working with Yehu is to get a loan to finance her business. She owns a house with electricity, but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth N.  lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 3 children, two of whom are in school. Ruth has a business of a ladies' salon. She has been in this business for 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Ruth also sells products at the shop, by means of wholesale. Ruth has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and hair relaxers. The main business challenge(s) for Ruth include seasonality and transportation. Her goals and aspirations for business are to own a bridal salon. She joined MCDT because she wanted additional business capital. Ruth lives in a rented home; she has access to electricity but not piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and medication expense(s).

loans.name: Hamisi

texts.en:

He hopes to expand his business and make it completely sustainable in the future.

Hamisi decided to work with Yehu in order to get financial support. He lives at a rental house with electricity but no piped water, and his greatest monthly expenses are food and rent.

loans.use: To purchase equipment for the cafe, a printer, and memory cards for sale.

loans.name: Hameeda

texts.en:
Hameeda is the mother of six daughters. She and her husband, Raed, own a kids’ clothing store in Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She and her husband share working in the store where they sell girls’ and boys’ clothes. The store is located in the heart of the city center and is the only source of living for the family.

As the feast (Eid al Fitr) is around the corner, Hameeda and Raed want to increase the amount of clothes exhibited in their store. Accordingly, Hameeda took a $1,200 loan from FATEN in order to purchase the needed amount of clothes.

In the photo, Hameeda's husband appears in the store as she doesn't wish to have her picture online.

loans.use: To increase the amount of clothes exhibited in their store during Eid al Fitr

loans.name: Hendrich

texts.en:
Hendrich A. lives in Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is widowed and has six children, two of whom are in school.  She also takes care of additional family members (in laws). Hendrich has been in the business of selling fruits and vegetables for over 10 years, and works seven days a week. Hendrich sells her products retail from her home. She has requested a loan of 500,000/= Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO to buy more boxes of apples, fresh beans and peas. She rents rooms and also sells a local brew in the evening to bring in additional income.
The main business challenges for Hendrich are seasonality and transportation. Her goal for her business is to start buying directly from farmers. She lives in a home that she owns without electricity or piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication.

loans.use: To buy more apples, fresh peas and beans

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah K. lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has 7 children, four of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional family members (grandchildren). 

Sarah has a business of selling charcoal. She has been in this business for over 10 years, and she works 7 days out of every week. Sarah sells her products at the market by retail. Sarah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. She owns rental rooms, as an additional source of income. The main business challenge(s) for Sarah include rainy season. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to start going directly to villages for charcoal. Sarah lives in a home that she owns; she doesn't have access to electricity and doesn't have access to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Beyshenbek

texts.en:
Beyshenbek M. is 56 years old, married and has five children. Beyshenbek was born to a low-income farmworker’s family and, from early childhood, had engaged in farming. At his country place, Beyshenbek is known as a cheerful and very positive person. He works as a plumbing specialist in a local school and earns about 1,350 KGS monthly, which does not meet the expenses of his household at all. That’s why, gaining a wide experience in stockmanship, 15 years ago Beyshenbek started his business in cattle breeding. This activity became the main source of income for his family and allowed planning for their future activities.  

Beyshenbek plans to use this loan of 70,000 KGS to buy two cows and 13 sheep for fattening and reselling. With the revenues, Beyshenbek wants to buy a car for his son. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle.

loans.name: Hakima

texts.en: Hakima is a widowed mother of two children. Her fabric-sales business has been a valuable source of income for her and her family over the past four years that she’s been in business. Hakima is a hard-working, polite and communicative entrepreneur. She has an attitude of service and loves being able to help women with their clothing needs. Hakima has requested a loan of $1,500 to purchase new inventory. This loan will help her to continue developing her business and provide a good income for her family. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes being a key post along the Silk Road, and for the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low-income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics for sewing national dresses for women

loans.name: Baatarbold

texts.en: Baatarbold N. is 45 years old and lives with his wife and four children in Baganuur district, one of the remote districts of Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia's capital city. His oldest son currently attends university, and his three teenaged children attend a local secondary school. His wife makes traditional Mongolian boots and sells them to supplement her family's income. He operates a small wooden products production business in his area. Baatarbold started his wood products business in 2001. He received a loan from Xacbank in 2008, and spent it to purchase a saw machine and started to produce home furniture. He has used the success of his business earnings to greatly improve his quality of life. His earnings have also enabled him to pay for his children's tuition fees and school supplies for his children. For the future, Baatarbold hopes to purchase new tools to help him to improve his product quality and to increase the variety of wood products. He is requesting an 800,000 MNT loan to buy a new machine and raw materials for his business.

loans.use: To buy a new machine and raw materials.

loans.name: Rukhsoramo

texts.en:
Rukhsoramo is a widowed mother. She has a daughter. She sells nice, quality fabrics for national dresses in a big local market. She started this business a year ago. Rukhsoramo would like to ask for a loan of $1200 USD to increase her inventory stock. She believes this timely investment will help her generate additional income and increase the family budget. We think Rukhsoramo’s responsibility and strong character will assist her in the current loan repayment.

loans.use: Purchasing new fabrics in order to increase the range of goods for selling.

loans.name: Batbayar

texts.en:
Batbayar B. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two daughters in Bayanhongor province in Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a  traditional Mongolian housing tent at a rented yard. His older daughter attends a local secondary school while the younger daughter goes to the local kindergarten. 

Batbayar operates a machinery parts trading business in his town, with help of his wife. He had been operating a consumer goods selling  business since 2003 after moving from the countryside and being unemployed for two years. He also used to run a transportation business to supplement his earnings. They started their current business in 2010. Batbayar, in the future, plans to focus on expanding his machinery parts trading business. He is a very open-minded and hardworking person. He hopes to grow his current business and to establish his own auto parts trade center. He is requesting a  1,500,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his machinery parts trading business.

loans.use: To establish his own auto parts trade center.

loans.name: Martaba

texts.en:
E. Martaba is 34 years old. She is married and has two children. Martaba has been running a grocery store for the past 2 years. She sells sweets, preserved food, juices, soft drinks, perfumes and many others items in her grocery. The inventory she has for sale is of very good quality and selection. Martaba is respectful and patient with all of her customers, which attracts people and brings them back to her vending facility to buy groceries again. Martaba is seeking to keep her business sustainable and has requested a loan of $3000 USD to increase the inventory she has for sale. We believe this current loan will enhance the potential of her business and help Martaba reach all of her aspirations.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret was born in 1960. And she is not married, but is blessed with five children. She shares two rooms with her five children at Musang, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Margaret has had great difficulties in life ranging from ill-health, the untimely death of relatives, failure to attain a quality education and inadequate capital. Amongst other challenges, she needs more capital to be able to carry on with her projects. With this loan, she plans to buy food items such as rice, beans & corn, which she will sell and make more profit. She thinks her business is an influential one and she has succeeded over the past years. She, as well, regularly undertakes contracts. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford good food items at affordable prices.

She will invest some of her profits into her business and use the rest to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and to upgrade her standard of living. She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up and the low cost in obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE 
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon.  GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach.  Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values.  Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement.  GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To purchase rice, corn, salt and beans.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary J. is a lady who is married to Mr. Michael Ochuka and they have adult children who are no longer living with them. Mary owns a tree nursery. She purchases, matures and then sells the trees to others so that they can plant them on their farms. She also offers advice on how to better care for the trees, to her clients. She has been doing this for the past 20 years and she takes home a profit of about KES 10,000 per month.

Mary has applied for her first loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to buy more baby trees and later sell to clients when the trees mature. She hopes to earn some profit, which she will use to purchase food for her family.

Her future hopes are to expand her business so that she is able to add on to the family's income and, thus, sustain her family.

loans.use: Purchasing more trees for her tree nursery.

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter O. is a 39 year old gentleman who is married to a primary school teacher by the name of Eunice Oluoch. He buys and sells shoes at a profit in Migori town. He has been in this business for 13 years and he is able to make a profit of about KES 800 per day.

Peter is accessing his first loan with KADET LTD and he plans to use this money to buy more stock of shoes, which he will sell later at a profit.

Peter’s future dream is to buy a plot of land and build his own home.

loans.use: To buy more shoes inventory for resale.

loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Annah K. lives in Katanga Wandegeya neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 4 children, all of whom are in school.  Annah has a business of tailoring. She has been in this business for 6 years, and she works 6 days out of every week. Annah sells her products at the shop, by means of retail.  

Annah has requested a loan of 500,000 Ugandan Shillings (UGX) from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy an overlock machine. The main business challenge(s) for Annah include seasonality and defaulters. Her goals and aspirations for her business are to have more sewing and over locking machines. She decided to join MCDT because of low interest charged.  Annah lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy an overlock sewing machine.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline A. is a 25 year old lady who is married to a gentleman called Tom A.. Caroline and her husband have three children who are all school aged. She has been in the business of selling second-hand clothes to clients within the Kisumu area for seven years. She is able to take home a monthly income of about KES 6,000. Her husband is also employed, by a public transport company, and thus also participates in the family's income and provides for their needs.

Caroline has just requested from her first loan from KADET LTD. She plans to use the amount she gets to buy second hand t-shirts, baby clothes and women's blouses, which she will sell to others at a profit.

He future aspirations are to be able to have a more stable business and to have a well cared-for family.

loans.use: To buy more stock of second hand clothes.

loans.name: Beatrice Dinah

texts.en:
Beatrice Panyako is 33 years old and married to Meshak Otieno. Meshak operates a taxi in Kisumu, to add to her family's income. They have three children: aged 13 years, 11 years, and 5 years, respectively. She manages a retail shop and has been in this business for 16 years, with an income of KES 17, 000 per month.

She is applying for her first loan of KES 30,000 with KADET LTD to purchase more stock for the retail shop, like bread, soap, sugar and others. She intends to use the anticipated income to pay back the loan, and to pay school fees for her children.

Beatrice desires to grow her business to be stable and also to have a good income that can provide the basic needs for the family.

loans.use: To purchase more stock for the retail shop, items like bread, soap, sugar and others.

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha U. lives in Naguru neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has six children, five of whom are in school. She also takes care of additional relatives. Aisha lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees, rent and money for medications. 
She changed her business enterprise from selling crafts to a retail shop selling all merchandise like sugar, salt and soap e.t.c.
Aisha runs a small retail shop where she works seven days a week. She has been in business for less than a year. Aisha has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more merchandise like bags of sugar, cartons of salt, boxes of soap and cooking oil, maize, flour and rice. The main challenges for Aisha’s business include seasonality and defaulters. Her goal is to see her business grow large enough to where she can start selling wholesale only.

loans.use: To buy more products for her shop nlike bags of suagr, cartons of salt and boxes of saop.

loans.name: Faten

texts.en:
Faten and her family are from Rafah city in Gaza Strip. She is the mother of two daughters, Huda and Sahar, and four sons, Ayman, Hussein, Muhammad and Anwar. Her husband has been a taxi driver for ten years, operating between Rafah and Gaza.

Faten's husband needs to perform urgent maintenance on his taxi. Therefore, she came to FATEN and took a $1,500 loan for this purpose. Her husband’s taxi business is the only source of income for the family.

In the near future, Faten's husband wishes to be able to buy a better car than the one he stands next to in the photo.

loans.use: To enable her husband to perform maintenance on his taxi

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane N. lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has nine children, all of whom are in school. Jane lives in a home that she owns; she has access to electricity and piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medical expenses.

Jane sells secondhand clothes seven days a week. She has been in business for eight years. She sells her clothes at retail prices at the market. She also owns a motorcycle which brings in additional income.

Jane has requested a loan of 400,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bales of secondhand clothes. The main business challenges Jane faces include seasonality and transportation. Her goals are to see her business grow larger so she can start selling wholesale only and to also own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bales of secondhand clothes

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Fleria Mutenyo

texts.en:
Fleria Mutenyo M., 49, is married to Geoffrey Moses, a business man. They have three children aged 31, 23 and 18 years old. Fleria’s primary business is a retail shop; she also runs a clothing store. She has been in these businesses for five years and is able to make 8,200 KES a month. She hopes to become a wholesale trader of general items in Bungoma town.

Fleria joined KADET after she attended a World Vision leaders’ meeting and learned more about what KADET offers. She has applied for her first loan which she will use to add more stock to her retail shop like sugar, flour, salt, sweets and others items. She also would like to buy more ready-made clothes for resale. Fleria anticipates increasing profits which she will use to buy more stock for her shop.

loans.use: To buy more stock for her shop and ready-made clothes for resale

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith M., a married lady who supports five people in her family including her two children, aged eight and five years, is in the business of buying cereals in bulk and then selling them in small batches. She is able to make a monthly income of about Kshs 10,000, and her husband contributes to the total family income. She has been selling cereals for nine years.

Judith, a long-time client of KADET, is now applying for her seventh loan which she will use to buy more cereals in bulk for resale. She hopes to make a profit which she will use to buy food and other household items. Judith hopes to become a wholesale cereal trader in the future.

loans.use: Buying cereals in bulk

loans.name: Elizabeth   Auma

texts.en:
Elizabeth O. runs ECD Nursury School in Kisumu. She is 32 years old and married to Amos Mbadi, a taxi driver who provides for most of the family's basic needs. Together they are blessed with two children, 11 and 5 years of age.

Elizabeth has been in this business for two years and her monthly income is Kshs.22,000. She learned about KADET LTD through their marketing awareness and is now applying for her first loan from KADET microfinance to add more small plastic chairs for children and learning charts for teaching. She intends to utilize the income generated to pay back the loan and expand the classroom. In the future she plans to have a big school that will cater to many pupils.

loans.use: To buy small plastic chairs for pupils and charts for teaching

loans.name: Rosebell Anyango

texts.en:
Rosebell K., 34 years old and married to Christopher Atata, is the mother of six children, all in school They live in Migori town.

Rosebell sells used clothing in the open air market in Migori town. In this business for the last 10 years, she has created a huge clientèle, especially among those people who come to shop at the market. She makes an average of Kshs 30,000 per month. Rosebell is now applying for her fourth loan, having repaid her previous ones. She intends to use the money to buy some bales of used clothes to add to her stock.

Her future hopes include building a permanent structure for her business and ensuring that her children get the best education possible.

loans.use: To buy bales of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Mary Opiyo

texts.en:
Mary Opiyo N., 56, is married to Dominic Otieno who is a herbalist. They live in Migori town with their six children. Mary sells secondhand clothes at the open air market and gets many clients who buy from her.

Mary is applying for a loan of 30000 KES which will be her fourth loan after successfully completing the third one. She intends to buy more bails of clothes to add to her business. She hopes to expand the business and build a shelter for her clothes so she can do business during the rainy seasons.

loans.use: Buy bails of clothes to add to her stock

loans.name: Robinah

texts.en:
Robinah N. lives in Bwaise neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is single and has four children, all of whom are in school. She also takes care of some of her in-laws. Robinah lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medical expenses.

Robinah runs a retail shop, working six days a week. She has been in business for over ten years. She sells her wares at retail at the market. She also works as a tailor which acts as an additional source of income. Robinah has requested a loan of 300,000 UGX from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more bags of charcoal. The main business challenges for Robinah include seasonality and transportation. Her goal for her business is to own a delivery van.

loans.use: To buy more bags of charcoal

loans.name: Theresia

texts.en:
Theresia N. is 46 years old, she is married to Nde John; they are blessed with four children. She shares four rooms with her four children and her husband. She lives in Alanbukam mankon, a quarter in Bamenda Northwest Region of Cameroon. Theresia has encountered difficulties in life ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs and the failure to attain a quality education. She reiterates, however, how happy she was when she gave birth to a set of twins. 

With this loan, Theresia plans to clear off weeds from her farm and to buy fertilizer to apply to the soil for a higher yield. She is convinced that the soil does not deceive anyone who works hard. She will also use part of the capital to buy vegetables seeds which she will plant, nurture, harvest and sell while she feeds her family on the surplus. The loan will help her community because she will be able to provide vegetables which are very good for health, and they will not incur transport costs to buy it elsewhere in distant places. 

Theresia will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a portion of the profit to pay for her children’s education and upgrade their standard of living. 

Theresia prefers borrowing from GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives and the follow-up. GHAPE also does not ask for collateral securities, and its loans are low cost with a gradual repayment rate.

About GHAPE:

The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business and financial management, basic health maintenance, life skills and family values. Clients are also required to deposit a small amount of money into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community among its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To enrich her farm and buy vegetable seeds

loans.name: Specioza

texts.en: Specioza B. lives in the Kamwokya Kifumbira neighborhood in the city of Kampala, Uganda. She is married and has 5 children, all of whom are in school.  Specioza has owned and operated a beauty salon for over 10 years, and she works 7 days a week. Specioza also sells beauty products at her shop. She has requested a loan of 300,000 Ugandan Shillings from MCDT SACCO, which she will use to buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids. The main business challenges for Specioza include electricity and transportation. Her business goal is to be able to buy a plot of land. Specioza lives in a home that she rents; she has access to electricity, but not to piped water. Her major monthly expenses include school fees and medication expense(s).

loans.use: To buy more boxes of cosmetics and braids.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Che

texts.en:
Che I. was born in 1969. She is married to Che John and they are blessed with six children. She shares five rooms with her six children and her husband. She lives in Ntamuche Nkwen, a quarter in Bamenda North West Region of Cameroon.

Che I. has encountered difficulties in life ranging from the inability to meet her daily needs, and failure to attain a quality education. With this loan, she plans to use part to clear off unwanted weeds from her farm, buy piglets, and buy fertilizer to apply to the soil for a higher yield. She is convinced that the soil does not deceive anyone who works hard. She will use part of the capital to buy vegetable seeds which she will plant, nurture and harvest. She will sell the excess, while her family uses the surplus. The loan will help her community, because she will be able to provide vegetables which are very good for their health. They will not need to incur transport costs to buy it elsewhere in distant places. She will be able to take care of her children’s education. She will plough back her profit into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. 

She prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow up, that GHAPE does not ask for collateral securities, and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan. And that the payment is gradual.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multi-faceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instils a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: To clear weeds on farm, buy piglets, fertilizer, and vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Ihambiro Women's, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
Hard working Oliver N. has been running a retail shop from Ihambiro trading centre in Ntungamo district, where she sells general merchandise. She belongs to Ihambiro Women's group of Ntungamo, and she has been operating this business for over 20 years down the road. The married mother of 10 children confirms that she has had problems in restocking her business as the stock available is not satisfying her customers' demand.

Therefore, Oliver is seeking a loan to help her buy more goods for resale and profit, with the hope of earning more income as she looks towards an  expansion plan. This will enable her to be in a position to cater for her family's needs and thus improve her standard of living. She belongs to a group of other members who hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: For business restocking.

loans.name: Omungyenyi Tukwatanise Group, Ntungamo

texts.en:
It is now 30 years since Mary O. started up her agriculture enterprise in Omungyenyi, Ntungamo in western Uganda. She belongs to Omungyenyi Tukwatanise group, Ntungamo. With this as her only source of livelihood, she has painstakingly managed to make ends meet, albeit with some long drawn out seasonal income fluctuations and poor road systems to access bigger markets.

With a hard work ethic, the 50 year old widowed mother of 6 children has kept her business on a consolidated growth path. In a month, she makes close to 1800,000 Ugandan shillings. Her business gaining ground over these years has in effect also meant that her family has benefited. Her business plan of action for the future is to be able to purchase beans, groundnuts seeds, and sorghum grains for the coming season. With this loan, she envisages being able to hire manpower for more planting in order to improve on the output for sale.

loans.use: To purchase seeds for planting and to pay for labour.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen tiene 21 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde que era muy niña, los primeros conocimientos que tuvo fue la agricultura, desde entonces trabaja en esta actividad, hoy a lado de su esposo siembra papa y maíz,  pero cuando tienen que esperar para la cosecha, se dedica a vender comida, en este caso trucha frita en las diversas ferias comerciales de su zona. De esta manera es como logra tener ingresos necesarios para mejorar su economía y a la vez cubrir las necesidades de su hogar. Ella considera que la venta de trucha es negocio rentable, por lo que desea intensificar este negocio, es así que cada fin de semana se abastece de truchas en lo criaderos que hay cerca de su casa. Por otro lado desea mejorar su actividad agrícola, así como su producción. Es su tercer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en ambas actividades que realiza, por ello comprará más truchas y una carpa nueva para atender a sus clientes, asimismo desea comprar sacos de abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Carmen is 21 years old and lives with her husband in their own house. When she was very young, one of the first things that she learned was about agriculture and since then, she has worked in agriculture. Today, at her husband’s side, she plants potatoes and corn. However, when they have to wait for the harvest, she sells food – in this case, fried trout in the various markets in the area. This is the way that she is able to meet the necessary income to improve her economy and, at the same time, cover the household needs.

She considers trout sales to be a profitable business, which is why she wants to strengthen this business. Each weekend she stocks up on trout at the trout farms near her house. On the other hand, she wants to improve her agriculture, as well as her production.

This is her third loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support since she has always proven to be responsible in her payments. In addition, she likes being part of her communal bank because all of the members are responsible and very supportive. She is grateful to those people that will fund the loan that she is requesting, which will be very useful for her business’ progress.

With the loan requested, she will invest in both of her businesses – she will purchase more trout and a tent to serve her customers. She also wants to purchase sacks of fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Kathleen O'Connell, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase more trout, as well as sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Ever

texts.es: Ever tiene 22 años, vive en casa de sus padres y sus hermanos. Desde hace 1 año se dedica a ofrecer el servicio de transporte publico, cubriendo toda la ruta de su ciudad, de esta manera saca provecho de la vida generándose ingresos, además la actividad que realiza, es muy escasa por que no todos los transporte que hay recorren caminos inhóspitos como lo hace Ever. Por lo pronto desea tener su propia movilidad, pues el que trabaja pertenece a su padre, su propósito es aumentar su rentabilidad y mantener su vehiculo en buenas condiciones. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en el pago del mantenimiento mecánico que realizará a su carro.
texts.en:
Ever is 22 years old and lives at home with his parents and siblings. He has worked as a taxi driver for 1 year with a city route, and in this way he earns a living. Drivers who cover routes like his are scare, because not everyone will drive the rough roads like he does. Right now he wants to own a car since the one he currently uses belongs to his father. His goal is to increase his earnings and keep his car in good condition.

This is his first loan with MFP and he is very happy to know he has financial support that recognizes that he is a responsible person in making his payments. He is also thankful to be part of a community bank because he knows all the members and they are responsible and very close. He thanks the lenders who will provide the loan he is requesting that will be be very useful for his business. He will use the loan money to pay for vehicle repairs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Nancy Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nancy es una mujer comerciante que ha venido creciendo gracias a su tenacidad de empeño en su negocio un comedor de venta de comida desde once años. El cual inicio con pocos ahorros.
Atreves de los prestamos en Afodenic ha venido dando mantenimiento a su negocio, como las mejoras de vivienda, pues lleva cinco ciclos trabajando el cual está contenta porque ha logrado el objetivo.
Con el crédito anterior era  para la construcción de un baño e inodoro el cual logro mejorar las paredes pero no concluyo por falta de materiales y que lograra terminar con este financiamiento. 
En donde cerrará completamente, y la compra de una puerta.
Su objetivo es seguir invirtiendo en su negocio, aunque las ventas estén bajas en días y eso implica perdidas. El cual tiene que equilibrarse para lograr mantenerse estable y así poder salir adelante para lograr sus pagos y necesidades personales.
texts.en:
Nancy is a saleswoman who, over the past 11 years, has achieved success thanks to her tenacity and work-ethic in her business selling food. She began her business with the small amount she had saved. Through loans from Afodenic she has been able to improve her business and also her home. She has already completed 5 loan cycles and is happy because she is meeting her goals.

Her last loan was to build a bathroom with a toilet, and with the money she was able to improve the walls but she could not finish because she lacked supplies. This loan is to finish the job by completely enclosing the bathroom and buying a door. Her goal is to keep investing in her business even though sales have been down lately and she is not earning as much money. She knows she needs to find balance in her business to be able to get ahead and make her payments and also have money for personal needs.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction materials to finish the bathroom

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Lucia tiene 47 años, vive en compañía de sus dos hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligada a las tareas del campo, cultiva principalmente papa y maíz que después lo lleva a vender directamente a los mercados de la  ciudad o dependiendo de la situación también lo vende por parcela, de esta manera logra tener los ingresos  para su sustento y apoyar a sus hijos que radican en la ciudad por motivo de estudio. Manifiesta que le gusta su trabajo, por que le agrada estar en el campo y disfrutar del paisaje, además que esta actividad le permite  tener siempre disponible los alimentos que necesita y la rentas para sobresalir, por lo que espera más adelante mejorar su producción agrícola. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que conocen de su persona que es responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siembra de maíz.
texts.en:
Lucia is 47 years old and lives with her 2 children in her own home. She has worked in the fields her whole life and mainly cultivates potatoes and corn that she later takes to the city markets to sell. Sometimes she will sell a whole field of crops and in this way she has the income needed to support her children who study in the city.

She says she likes her job and enjoys being in the fields. This activity also provides her with the food she needs and the income to get ahead. In the future she hopes to improve her agricultural production. This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that there is financial support for her as they know her to be a responsible person in making payments. She likes being part of her community bank because she knows all the members and they are responsible and very close. She is also thankful for the lenders who will provide her the loan that will be very useful for her business. She will use the loan money to buy bags of fertilizer for her corn crop.

Translated from Spanish by Emily Meinecke, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizer

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer muy dedicada al trabajo como a su familia, hoy en día tiene un pequeño kiosko donde vende una variedad de golosinas, gaseosas, repostería, tacos, hamburguesa entre otros. 
Vende en una parada de bus muy concurrida lo que es de beneficio para su venta. Iniciando hace tres años con apoyo económico de su esposo el cual se desempeña como conductor. 
Su objetivo es comprar un carrito de hogdog y lograr  captar clientes nuevos ya que por ser ricos y accesibles de precios se venden mucho.
Es por eso hará esta mejora atreves del financiamiento de la institución y lograr una alternativa de venta y de ingresos que falta que le hace a su hogar ya que todo está caro y hay que trabajar mucho para lograr satisfacer las necesidades alimenticias como gastos básicos.
texts.en:
Rosa is very dedicated to her family. She has a small kiosk where she sells a variety of snacks, soft drinks, desserts, tacos, and hamburgers, among other things. She sells at a very well visited bus stop, which benefits her sales. She began the business three years ago, with financial help from her husband who works as a driver. Her goal is to buy a hot dog cart and attract new customers, because hot dogs taste good and are easy to come by and sell well. For this reason she will make this improvement through financing from the institution, and establish and alternative for sales and income, which her household needs, because everything is expensive and one must work very much to be able to satisfy the basic necessities and expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Hot Dog Cart

loans.name: Victor

texts.es: Víctor tiene 35 años, vive con su esposa y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida ha estado ligado a las tareas agrícolas y hoy junto a su esposa desempeñan esta labor diariamente ya que desde las horas de la madrugada salen a ver sus terrenos de cultivo y verificar que todo marche bien, en ocasiones extrae la mala hierba que crecen dentro de sus campos, lo cual perjudican mucho en el crecimiento de sus frutos. Los productos que siembra es la papa, el maíz y la calabaza, que luego de un tiempo cosechan y son llevados a los mercados mayorista de su ciudad, generándole así ganancias. En adelante Víctor esta pensando incrementar su producción y emprender un nuevo negocio en la ciudad. Es su segundo crédito con MFP, esta muy contento de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su negocio. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Víctor is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two children in a home of their own. He's been bound to agriculture all of his life and he and his wife work the fields daily. Beginning at dawn, they go out to check their land and crops to be sure that everything is progressing well. Sometimes they have to pull the weeds which often invade their crops. They raise potatoes, corn, and squash, which they later harvest and take to the city's main market. This is how they generate an income. In the future, Víctor wants to increase his production and begin a new business in the city. This will be his second loan through MFP and he is very happy to know that he has financial backing and that he has always proven himself to be responsible with his payments. He is also happy to be a part of a communal bank because all of its members are very responsible and united people. He appreciates those who will manage the loan he is requesting. It will be very useful toward his business' progress. He will use the money from this loan to buy sacs of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fertilizer

loans.name: Shara Luisa

texts.es: La señora vive en casa propia en la zona de Callampaya de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltera y actualmente estudia la carrera de  Derecho, su actividad es la venta de productos de belleza  Avon, por la misma recibe comisiones por ventas. Por las mañanas trabaja como procuradora en el Edificio Alborada  donde percibe un salario mínimo. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital y poder surtir su mercadería y mantener esta fuente de ingresos estable, es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro y forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
She lives in her own home in La Paz’s Callampaya neighborhood. She is single and is studying Law. She sells Avon beauty products and receives a commission on her sales. During the mornings she works for minimum wage as a Building Representative at the Alborada Building. The requested funds will be to increase her capital to buy stock merchandise so that she can keep this source of income stable. This is the first time that she’s gotten a loan from Impro and been a part of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock inventory items.

loans.name: Eliza María

texts.es: La señora Eliza vive en casa propia en la zona de Callampaya de la ciudad de La Paz,  esta separada de su esposo, tiene un hijo que ya es mayor de edad el cual esta casado por lo tanto la señora Eliza vive sola. La actividad que tiene es la venta de comida en una feria de la ciudad de la paz, donde vende chicharrón y fricasé, con esta actividad ella puede subsistir y también pagar sus estudios. El crédito que solicita es para comprar insumos, es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro y forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
Eliza lives in her own home in La Paz’s Callampaya neighborhood. She is separated from her husband and has an adult son who is married. Therefore, Eliza lives alone. She sells prepared meals in one of the city of La Paz’s markets; she sells chicharrón y fricasé (fried pork rinds and spicy pork stew). This activity helps her support herself and pay for her schooling. The requested loan will be used to buy ingredients. This is the first time she’s gotten a loan from Impro and been a part of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Duxon Heriberto

texts.es:
Duxon de 40 años, tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, vive en una zona periurbana en el Paraíso de Guayaquil zona caracterizada por sus caminos montañosos. 

Hace 7 años atrás comenzó con su tienda de vivieres ya que por su sector no había y necesitaba generar ingresos para su familia, poco a poco vendiendo legumbres y surtiendo con aceites, arroz, bebidas su pequeño local pudo tener su tienda. Ahora trabaja con la ayuda de su esposo atendiendo en las tardes la tienda. 

Para surtir mas su negocio el quiere comprar con el préstamo papelería ya que la quiere variar con las artículos. En el futuro quiere tener bien surtida su tienda con artículos de bazar.
texts.en:
Duxon is 40 years old and has a small store in the front part of his house. He lives in a suburban zone of Paraíso de Guayaquil, a zone characterized by its mountainous roads. He started his store seven years ago because there were no others in his sector and he needed to generate an income for his family. Little by little he began selling beans, and later added cooking oil, rice, and drinks. With this, he was able to establish his store. Now he works with his wife's help, tending the store in the evenings. He wants to buy paper goods with the money from this loan, in order to stock the store with a greater variety of goods. In the future he wants to have his store well stocked with paper goods.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Paper goods

loans.name: Liceth Octaviana

texts.es: La señora vive en casa de su suegra en la zona 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar de 9 y 7 años de edad, actualmente su esposo está trabajando en la Argentina. La señora Liceth se dedica a la venta de ropa de niños de fabricación Chilena, también elabora edredones y otras artesanías. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y mantener estable su negocio, es la primera vez que obtiene crédito en Impro y forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
She lives in her mother-in-law’s house in La Paz’s 14 de Septiembre neighborhood. She is married and has two school age children who are 9 and 7 years of age. Currently her husband is working in Argentina. Liceth sells Chilean made children’s clothes; she also makes comforters and other crafts. The requested funds are to increase working capital to keep her business stable. This is the first time she’s gotten a loan from Impro and been part of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Francisca Salome

texts.es: La señora Francisca vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene tres hijos de 21,17 y16 años, su esposo trabaja como contador en la ciudad de Cochabamba. Francisca se dedica a la venta de artefactos eléctricos de todo tipo. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo y poder abastecer su mercadería y estabilizar su negocio, es cliente nueva de Impro y forma parte de Kiva por primera vez.
texts.en:
Sra. Francisca lives in her own home in the district of Tacagua in the city of La Paz. She is married and has three children (ages 21, 17, and 16). Her husband works as an accountant in the city of Cochabamba. Francisca sells electrical appliances of all kinds.

The loan she is requesting will be used to increase her operating capital so that she can restock with more merchandise and stabilize her business. She is a new client of IMPRO and this is her first loan through Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase electrical appliances

loans.name: Malena

texts.es: La señora vive en alquiler en la zona Gran Poder de la ciudad de La Paz, esta separada de su esposo y tiene una niña de 9 años de edad que cursa el 4to año del nivel primario, es de profesión dentista y trabaja en su domicilio atendiendo clientes en un pequeño consultorio. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material para mantener su negocio estable, es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en Impro y forma parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
Malena lives in a rental property in the Gran Poder District of the city of La Paz. She is separated from her husband and has a nine year old daughter in the fourth grade. Malena is a dentist by profession and attends to her patients from a small office in her home.

The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies to keep her business stable. This is her first loan she has received through IMPRO and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her dental office

loans.name: Sandra Veronica

texts.es: La señora vive con sus padres en alquiler en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, esta soltera y estudia en la universidad la carrera de Auditoría, en su tiempo libre se dedica a la confección de mantas  y las comercializa en los mercados con la ayuda de su mamá. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder estabilizar su negocio debido a que tiene varios clientes. Es parte de KIVA e IMPRO por primera vez.
texts.en:
She lives with her parents in a rented house in La Paz’s Tembladerani neighborhood. She is single and is studying Accounting at the university. During her free time she makes blankets that her mother helps her sell at market. The loan will be used to buy fabric so that she can stabilize the business since she has several customers. She is part of KIVA and IMPRO for the first time.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida es una mujer trabajadora, docente y pequeña comerciante de cosméticos, pues ha logrado obtener otros ingresos mediante a sus ventas, durante su trayecto de vida, lleva trabajando como docente veintiún años, y cinco años en ventas. 
Aun con deseo de trabajar  a pesar que esta avanzada de edad, 
Lo  que ha venido a mejorar sus necesidades personales con sus ganancias lo que ha sido de ayuda para su familia.
Lleva seis créditos en Afodenic que han sido para el bienestar de su pequeño negocio ya que atreves de estos préstamo logro aumentar más productos.
Con este financiamiento comprara: perfumes, pinturas, maquillajes, vanidad, crema de cuerpo y ropa interior de dama. Logrando a si mejores colocaciones.
texts.en:
Aida is a hard working, teacher and small businesswoman who sells cosmetics. She's managed to create another income through her sales during this part of her life. She's been teaching for 21 years and has been selling for five years. She still has a desire to work, even though she is older now. Her sales have allowed her to improve her quality of life and that of her family. She's had six loans through Afodenic, which have helped with her small business' well being by allowing her to acquire more products. She will use the money from this loan to buy perfumes, makeup, vanity items, body creams, and ladies' undergarments. This will allow her better positioning.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan, de 52 años, separado hace muchos años, vive en su casa propia, tienes 7 hijos de las cuales ahora vive en compañía de su pequeña hija. Hace más de 20 años, se dedica a realizar transporte de taxi; y solo lo realiza por las noches, debido que hay menos trafico que en el día, por otro lado se encarga de llevar y recoger a su pequeña hija del colegio, y así también cuida de su pequeña hija, quien es su mayor adoración y siempre esta pendiente de ella. En todos estos años de trabajo, aprendió a conocer a sus pasajeros y sabe que así se evitaría menos riesgo de algún asalto o robo de su vehículo. Se siente muy satisfecho con el trabajo que realiza, debido a las rentas que le generan, por ello desea en adelante comprarse un auto, asimismo desea ampliar el nuevo negocio de ferretería  que emprendió con su hermano. Es su 16avo  crédito con MFP, en sus anteriores créditos ha sido muy puntual y espera serlo ahora también, por lo que en su grupo tiene el aprecio de todos. Con el crédito que solicita,  piensa comprar una llanta para su carro y con resto dará como inicial para la compra de una moto, de esa manera trabajará su hijo que se encuentra desempleado.
texts.en:
Juan is 52 years old and has been separated for many years. He lives in a home of his own and has seven children but only his young daughter lives with him. He's been driving a taxi for more than 20 years. He only drives in the evenings, since there is less traffic. He also drops off and picks up his daughter from school and cares for her. She is his main adoration and he is always mindful of her. He has learned to know his passengers over the years and knows that he can reduce the risk of robbery or theft of his vehicle. He is happy with his work, because of the profits that it gives him. In the future he wants to buy a car for himself, and at the same time expand the new hardware business that he and his brother have started. This will be the 16th loan through MFP. He has been very punctual with his previous loans and he expects to be so with this one because he has the admiration of all of the members of his group. He plans to buy a tire for his car with some of the money from this loan and the rest he will use as a down payment for a motorcycle, so that his unemployed son can work.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance

loans.name: Policarpio

texts.es: El señor vive en alquiler en la zona de Villa Nuevo Potosí de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero y chef de profesión, actualmente trabaja en una churrasquería donde percibe el salario mínimo con el cual se mantiene, los fines de semana atiende todo tipo de acontecimientos y también elabora tortas y otras clases masitas. El crédito que solicita es para comprar una computadora y utilizarla para poder hacer sus propuestas con fotos de sus tortas y también poder diseñar algunos modelos. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO y también es parte de Kiva.
texts.en:
This gentleman lives in the Villa Nuevo Potosí zone of the city of La Paz. He is single and a chef by trade. He currently works at a barbeque shack where he receives a minimal salary from which he supports himself. On the weekends he works all kinds of gatherings and also makes "tortas" (similar to sandwiches) and other foods. He will use the money from this loan to buy a computer that he can use to do his proposals and include pictures of his tortas. He also wants to be able to design some models. This will be his first loan through IMPRO and Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es: El señor vive en casa propia en la zona de Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casado y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar, su esposa trabaja en un punto de atención de llamadas, la actividad a la que se dedica el señor Benjamín es  de restaurar cuadros de pintores que se encuentran deteriorados, trabaja mas con museos y con gente que es coleccionista. El crédito que solicita es para comprar material y poder de esta manera mantener su fuente de ingresos y así mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
He lives in his own house in La Paz’s Tacagua area. He’s married and has two school age children. His wife works at a call center. Benjamín is an art restorer; he restores paintings that are deteriorated. He works mostly with museums and art collectors. He is requesting funds to buy supplies he needs to keep working thus earning income and supporting his family.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies.

loans.name: David Edison's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva, working in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is pleased to present to you teachers of the D.E.C Baptist Model School, Mabanta village, Makeni. D.E.C Baptist Model School was founded in September, 1984. This school came about as a result of the community’s dire need and the Baptist mission’s desire to propagate the Gospel of Christ to the children of the community, especially to the girls. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational area, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. With the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is responsible for deducting the repayments and pays SMT on their behalf.

David E. T. (on the left in the photo) is the leader of this group and headmaster at the school. David is 54 years old and was born in Makama village. He has been in the teaching profession for 29 years now. He is married to a businesswoman and the couple has seven children:  two in primary school, three in secondary school, one in college and another who is now an adult. Mr. T. will be using his share of the loan to pay school and college fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school and college fees for his children

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es: El señor Jaime vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz, quedo viudo hace un año y no tiene hijos, es carpintero y trabaja en una carpintería donde percibe un sueldo mínimo. En la casa de sus padres utilizó una habitación para instalar una tienda de abarrotes. El crédito que solicita es para abastecer la tienda, debido a  que es la única del barrio tiene mucha demanda de clientes, de esta manera el mejorará sus ingresos y mejorará su nivel de vida. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito y por el carácter social se sugiere otorgárselo.
texts.en:
Jaime lives in his parents’ house in La Paz’s Tembladerani neighborhood. He was widowed a year ago and has no children. He’s a carpenter employed at a carpentry shop where he is paid the minimum wage. He set up a grocery store in one of the rooms in his parents’ house. The loan he is asking for is to stock the store. Because it’s the only one in the neighborhood customer demand is high. He hopes thus to increase income and improve his standard of living. This is the first time he’s requested a loan and his social characteristics suggest it be granted.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for his store.

loans.name: Fatima Petrona

texts.es:
Fátima tiene la edad de 35 años, madre soltera de un hijo que ha salido  adelante para lograr solventar sus alimentos y estudio del mismo.
Se gana la vida vendiendo ropa, y trabaja en un pequeño taller de costura que ha venido a mejorar sus ingresos ya que cuenta con un salario fijo.
Como meta es poder ahorrar dinero para comprar una máquina de coser plana y poder hacer sus trabajos en casa, logrando a si cuidar de la misma como trabajar mucho.
Su casa la ha construido poco a poco, es minifalda de bloques y madera, y con este financiamiento que está logrando es para la construcción de un baño y inodoro que tiene la necesidad ya que no cuentan con agua negras y en tiempo de invierno lleden mucho los baños. Es por eso comprara materiales de construcción como bloques, arena, cemento, hierro para cerrar el baño y comprar el inodoro.
Logrando a si una mejor higiene. Lo que está feliz por lograr esta mejora.
texts.en:
Fátima is 35 years old and a single mother. She has worked hard to provide for her son's everyday needs and education. She makes a living selling clothing, and also works in a small tailoring workshop which increases her income by providing a fixed salary. Her goal is to save money to buy a sewing machine so she can work from home. She works a lot, and this will allow her to better manage housework. Fátima has built her house bit by bit; it's a small house built with cement blocks and wood. With this financing, she will build a bathroom. Her house doesn't currently have a bathroom and in the winter the public bathrooms are very full. Thus, Fátima will buy construction materials such as concrete blocks, sand, cement, and iron rods to finish the bathroom and purchase a toilet. She would be happy to achieve her goal of better hygiene.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of stone, sand, cement, and iron rods for construction of the bathroom and plumbing, and purchase of toilet for improved hygiene.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, de 41 años, es una mujer emprendedora, vive junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa heredada en el cono sur de Lima. Trabaja como enfermera 4 veces por semana y desde el jueves a viernes de dedica a la  organización de eventos para presentaciones de nuevos artistas en música folklórica, en donde se encarga de la gestión y tramitación de permisos a las municipalidades, recibiendo buenas rentas de este trabajo. De estas ganancias lo invierte en la construcción de habitaciones en su inmueble, puesto que en un futuro desea alquilarlos. Se siente muy contenta por el trabajo que realiza, ya que su anhelo es vivir del alquiler, por ello sabe que debe trabajar e invertir bien, porque mas adelante cuando crezcan sus hijos tendrá otros gastos que priorizar. Es su dieciséis crédito con MFP, se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo como en sus anteriores créditos, en su grupo solidario es una socia muy respetada. Yolanda  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado, para comprar cemento y pagar la mano de obra del albañil que revestirá su casa.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 41, is an enterprising woman. She lives with her husband and three children in her inherited house located in Lima’s southern sector. Four days a week she works as a nurse and from Thursday to Friday she organizes events to introduce new folk musicians.
