She is in charge of securing the required municipal permits and earns good profits from this work. She uses profits to build rooms onto her home because she plans to rent them out in the future. She is very happy with the work she does because her dream is to live off her rents so she’s aware that she has to work and invest well because later on when her children get older she’ll have to prioritize other expenses. This is her 16th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments in a timely fashion as she has always done to date. She is highly respected by her fellow group members. She plans to use the requested funds to buy cement and pay the bricklayer, who’ll do the home refurbishing, for his labor.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy cement and pay the bricklayer's labor costs.

loans.name: Raúl

texts.es: El señor Raúl vive en alquiler en la zona Central de la ciudad de La Paz, actualmente esta separado de su esposa y tiene dos hijos en edad escolar. La actividad que realiza es la venta de películas, música, etc., en  CDs., con esta actividad el mantiene a su familia y es su única fuente de ingresos. Es cliente de Impro y es la cuarta vez que solicita un crédito, el esta satisfecho con la tasa de interés, y es la primera vez que forma parte de kiva
texts.en:
Raúl rents in downtown La Paz. He is currently separated from his wife and he has two school age children. He sells movies and music, etc., on CDs. This is how he supports his family and it’s his only source of income. He is an Impro client and this is his fourth loan request. He is satisfied with the interest rate and it’s the first time he’s been art of Kiva.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Marisa Nely

texts.es: La señora vive en casa de sus suegros en la zona de Las Lomas de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada y tiene un niño pequeño que todavía no va al colegio, su esposo trabaja como chofer de minibús. Su actividad es la de venta de buzos deportivos sueltos y conjuntos de niños. El crédito que solicita es para aumentar su capital de trabajo, para comprar mas mercadería y abastecerse para poder tener mas clientes y de esta manera su negocio crezca,  es la sexta vez que obtiene un crédito con la Institución y ya fue parte de Kiva en tres oportunidades.
texts.en:
She lives in her in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Las Lomas neighborhood. She’s married and has a young son who doesn’t go to school yet. Her husband is a minibus driver. She sells athletic sweatshirts and children’s dress sets. She is asking for funds to increase working capital to buy more merchandise and to increase stock in order to have more customers so her business can grow. This is the 6th time she’s gotten a loan with the Institution and she’s been part of Kiva on three occasions.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Lesbia De Los Angeles

texts.es:
Doña Lesbia se dedica  a la venta de comida, pues su negocio es un pequeño comedor que desde hace seis año logro tener ya que su mama dejo para que se ayudara. Cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo el trabaja de electricista. Y juntos se esfuerzan para tener un techo digno para sus dos hijos.

Gracias a los préstamos de Afodenic ha logrado las mejoras la construcción de su casa que con cada préstamo logro hacer algo como: construcción de paredes, y con este último término de cerrar su techo de perlines.
Y ahora hará un sumidero en el fondo del patio logrando a si la instalación de un inodoro para mejor higiene de su familia.
Ya que no cuentan con las aguas negras y que le es de gran necesidad.
texts.en:
Lesbia has sold prepared meals in a small eatery that her mother left her six years ago so that she’d have a way to support herself. Her husband, who works as an electrician, contributes to the household. Together they struggle to provide a proper home for their children. Thanks to loans from Afodenic she has made some home improvements. Each loan has been for a specific project like erecting walls and the last one was to finish sealing the roof with metal tubing. Now she will dig a septic tank in the rear of the yard so that she can install a toilet for better hygiene for her family since they don’t have a sewerage system and this is a great need.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy a toilet and dig a septic tanc in order to build a bathroom and have better hygiene conditions.

loans.name: Percy José

texts.es:
Percy vive la zona de Pampahasi de la ciudad de La Paz.
No esta casado pero vive con su compañera y no tienen hijos.
El cliente trabaja en una mina y también es agricultor, debido al trabajo pesado en la mina, el señor compró un vehiculo, con el cual  trabajará como chofer en un sindicato de trufis, por lo cual el monto solicitado será para el pago de ingreso, derecho de sindicato, y línea de trufis.
Es la primera vez que solicita el crédito y la primera que requiere el apoyo de kiva.
texts.en:
Percy lives in La Paz’s Pampahasi neighborhood. He isn’t married but lives with his partner. They have no children. He works in a mine and is also a farmer. Due to the hard work in the mine, he bought a vehicle with which he works as a driver for a transportation cooperative. He needs the loan to pay the various entry fees, union dues, etc. associated with this cooperative. This is the first time he’s asked for a loan and the first needing Kiva support.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To pay transportation cooperative dues and fees.

loans.name: Godfry

texts.en: Godfry L. is a 55 year old married man with 8 school-going kids. For a year, Godfry has been operating a farming and piggery business in the Kyamulinga- Mityana district. He started off with goat and cattle rearing and says that in a month his businesses generate him close to 1,250,000 shillings. He also sells milk and bananas. His hard work has brought him this far, despite the fact that he has faced some inevitable operational financial problems since his business is only one year old. Also, demands on him from family and friends have at times inundated him and in a way slowed the progress of his businesses. That said, he is very optimistic that he will be able to improve his business situation once he receives this kiva loan. He says the loan will give him the ability to buy more piglets, feed, drugs and pesticides.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets, feed, drugs and pesticides for his businesses.

loans.name: Zayra Del Socorro

texts.es:
Zayra es una mujer muy trabajadora, de pocos recursos económicos, su negocio es la venta de tortilla que vende hace mucho para lograr el sustento de cada día.
Su casa es de madera y deseado mejorar la infraestructura con las divisiones de los cuartos para lograr mejor privacidad la cual no la tenía.
Este cambio lo logra a través de un financiamiento que Afodenic otorgo en donde comenzó pero no logro terminar ya que contaba con poco financiamiento por su condición.
Ya es su segundo ciclo en donde lograra el objetivo de cerrar completamente su cuarto.
Para esto comprara: bloques, cemento, puertas para concluir la mejora.
texts.en:
Zayra is a very hard working woman with few economic resources. She has sold tortillas for a long time to earn her daily support. Her house is wood and she wants to improve its infrastructure by dividing the rooms for more privacy, which she currently lacks. This change was made possible thanks to a loan that Afodenic granted to start the work but she wasn’t able to finish it because she only got a little financing due to her condition. This is her second cycle where she hopes to finish closing off the room. To do this she will buy: concrete blocks, cement and doors to finish the improvement.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy concrete blocks, cement and doors to finish the improvement and complete closing off the room.

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa, de 56 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 3 hijos mas sus 2 nietas, que son su adoración. Por las mañana trabaja pelando pollos y por las tardes se dedica a la preparación y venta de salchipapas  (platillos compuestos entre papas y pollo fritos). Es así que atiende todos los días en la puerta del colegio más prestigioso de su barrio, que queda cerca de su casa, siendo sus clientes los alumnos y algunas madres de familia que vistan el colegio. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo, es la tranquilidad que le otorga, además que lo realiza en compañía de esposo, de ese modo no se siente cansada de esta actividad. Lleva 9 años realizando esta labor, por lo que se siente contenta por las ganancias que recibe, además siempre procura atender bien a sus clientes y presentar de manera muy saludable sus alimentos. En adelante piensa poner una bodega en su casa, con el fin de dejar de trabajar. Es la primera vez que saca individualmente un crédito con MFP,  y se compromete pagar todas sus cuotas como lo estuvo haciendo en los préstamos grupales, puesto que sabe que es de mucha utilidad para el incremento de su negocio. Con este crédito que solicita comprará una vitrina, gaseosas y demás insumos, para abastecer su negocio para que siga trabajando.
texts.en:
Rosa, 56, is a hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and three children plus two granddaughters who are her great loves. During the morning she works plucking chickens and in the afternoon she makes Salchipapas (dishes composed of friend potatoes and fried chicken) to sell. She sets up her stand daily in front of the neighborhood’s most prestigious school, which is near her home; her customers are students and some mothers who visit the school. What she most enjoys about her work is the tranquility it provides her. She has been in this line of work for 9 years and is happy with the profits she makes. Besides, she always does her best to provide good customer service and present her food in the healthiest way. In the future she’d like to set up a grocery store in her home so that she can stop working. This is her first individual loan with MFP and she pledges to repay punctually as she’s done in all the group loans to date because she knows that this is of great use for her business. This requested loan will be used to buy a display case, soft drinks and other ingredients to stock her business so that she can continue working

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a display case and soft-drinks to better equip her food stand.

loans.name: Las Rosas De Maria Group

texts.es:
ALCOM“LAS ROSA D. MARIA”
Isabel Peña C. tiene 36 años vive en el distrito D. san juan D. Lurigancho anexo Huáscar es una mujer emprendedora y luchadora madre D. 2 hijos por los cuales lucha día a día por darles una mejor educación a sus dos pequeños hijos el primero D. 9 años y el segundo D. 7 años, Isabel es separada del padre D. sus dos hijos pero El como buen padre responsable lo apoya en los gastos y estudios D. sus hijos.
 L. alcancía  esta formada por seis entusiastas y comprometidas socias y un socio en L. cual Isabel ejerce el cargo D. presidenta es una alcancía"LAS ROSAS D. MARIA", es uan alcancia nueva recién formada que encontraron en EDAPROSPO–PROSPERIDAD L. oportunidad D. crecer y tener una mejor calidad D. vida.
 Hace tres años que Isabel se dedica a L. venta D. DVD en L. casa D. sus pedrés donD. vive; por las mañanas trabaja vendiendo gelatinas,tortas,bocaditos en L. puerta D. un colegio cercano donD. vive, como un pequeño ingreso más a su canasta familiar,porque tiene tambien L. responsabilidad D. pagar todo los fines D. mes luz y agua D. L. casa doD. vive.      
 Isabel sueña con tener su casa propia y dentro D. elL. abrir una tienda D. repuestos D. motos y autos pero sabe que para dicho negocio necesita un capital mucho mayor para ello el préstamo actual lo volvera a usar como capital D. trabajo porque desea implementar más el negocio D. L. venta D. DVD comprando lo último y novedoso D. L. cartelera y así obtener mejores ganancias,D. esa manera ver lo más pronto realizado su sueño.
texts.en:
“LAS ROSA D. MARIA” (MARY’S ROSES) COMMUNAL BANK Isabel Peña C., 36, lives in Huáscar Annex, San Juan D. Lurigancho district. She is an enterprising and tenacious mother of two children for whom she struggles daily to proviD. a better education. Her first is 9 years old and the second is 7. Isabel is separated from the father of her children but, since he is a good, responsible father, he helps with educational and other expenses. The communal bank has six enthusiastic, committed women members and one male member. Isabel is the group President. This is a recently formed communal bank that found in EDAPROSPO-PROSPERIDAD the opportunity to grow and have a better quality of life. Isabel has sold DVDs for the last three years from her parents’ house which is where she lives. In the morning she sells gelatin treats and other snacks at the entrance to a nearby school. This provides a little extra income for the basic family needs since she also has to pay the monthly water and gas bills where she lives. Isabel dreams with owning her own house and to set up spare parts store for cars and motorcycles but she knows that such a business requires a much larger amount of capital. The current loan will be used once again as working capital. She wants to better stock her DVD business buying the latest movies so that profits will improve and thus get closer to seeing her dream come true.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy the most current DVDs.

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 44 años, es una madre de familia muy jovial y risueña, vive en casa de sus suegros, en compañía de su esposo y sus 3 hijos, quienes son su adoración. Su actividad cotidiana de Ana, es el corte de cabello, peinados y tratamientos de belleza en general. Se esmera en hacer un buen trabajo y sobre todo con mucho cuidado a cada uno de sus clientes, ya que valora la preferencia que le dan. Su salón de belleza es un local alquilado, ubicado en una avenida céntrica de su distrito, a media hora en carro de donde vive. Ella disfruta su labor; por ello lleva 18 años trabajando en este rubro, aunque recuerda que en un inicio le era difícil, porque no tenía con quien dejar a sus hijas y trabajaba sola, al final terminaba muy agotada, ya con el tiempo sus hijas crecieron y contrata a una señora para que le que  ayude a cuidarlas. Su mayor anhelo en adelante es comprarse un terreno y construir su casa, para brindarle una calidad de vida a su familia. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que anhela contar con posteriores ayudas para seguir progresando. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa comprarse tintes, oxigentas, líquidos y cremas al por mayor, para que siga trabajando de manera eficiente.
texts.en:
Ana, 44, is a jovial and cheerful mother. She lives in her in-laws’ house with her husband and three children who are her adoration. Ana’s daily work is haircuts, styling and beauty treatments in general. She takes great pains to do a good job and above all to be very careful with each one of her customers because she values the preference they have for her. Her beauty salon is in a rented locale on a centrally located avenue in her district a half hour from home. She enjoys her work; she’s been doing it for 18 years although she remembers how difficult it was at the beginning because she didn’t have anyone to care for her daughters and she worked by herself. At the end of the day she was exhausted. In time, as her daughters grew, she was able to hire a woman to help care for them. Her greatest wish for the future is to buy a lot on which to build her house in order to improve her family’s quality of life. This is her 12th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay in a timely fashion because she hopes to be able to have future loans to continue progressing. The requested loan will be used to buy dyes, hair oxygenators, liquids and creams at wholesale so that she can continue to work efficiently.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beauty supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Llinset Del Carmen

texts.es:
Linsset es madre de dos hijos, dedicada al trabajo, casada, hoy en día labora como responsable de compra en una distribuidora, siendo su esposo contador.
Su meta a largo plazo ha sido la construcción de su vivienda, pues poco a poco han ido construyendo toda la casa de concreto. Siendo Afodenic una puerta de financiamiento para lograr esta mejora, este es su quinto ciclo el cual comprara materiales de construcción para cerrar el techo y puertas para poder pasarse. Comprara: doce laminas de zinc, diez perlines, cuatro láminas de zinc lisa, tubos, así como comprar las puertas  y ventana y cerrar completamente su casa.
texts.en:
Linsset is the mother of two children. She is married and devoted to work. She works as a Buyer for a distributor and her husband is an Accountant. Her long term goal has been the construction of her house since it has been built of concrete bit by bit. Afodenic has been the pathway to financing to accomplish this improvement. This is her 5th cycle and it will be used to buy building materials and supplies to finish the roof and to buy doors and windows so that she can move in. She will buy twelve zinc metal sheets, ten metal gutters, four smooth zinc metal sheets, tubing, doors and windows so that the house will be completely closed off

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To finish roofing her house, to buy zinc metal sheeting and tubing, and doors and windows so that she can move in soon.

loans.name: Fe Group

texts.es:
El grupo Fe está conformado por tres féminas trabajadoras una de ellas es  Hazel C. J. (quien se encuentra en la foto con su hijo), coordinadora del grupo, comercializa desde hace 2 años productos Avon y Zermat marcas reconocidas por sus ventas vía catalogo. Ella con el préstamo piensa invertir en la compra de ropa para seguir progresando y proporcionarles a sus dos hijos de 4 años y 7 meses lo mejor posible. 

Las otras dos integrantes del grupo son Norma Amparo P. desde hace seis años vende prendas de plata y ropa intima de manera ambulante y Ligia Vanesa Ortes P. en el 2006 se afilio a las empresas Avon y Zermat reconocidas por sus ventas vía catalogo y empezó a comercializar dichos productos.
texts.en:
Three hard working women make up the Fe (Faith) group. One of them is Hazel C. J. (who appears in the photo with her son), group Coordinator. She has sold Avon and Zermat products for two years now; these are well known catalogue based sales. She will use the loan to buy clothes to continue progressing and providing her two children, who are 4 years and 7 months old respectively, with the best possible. The other two group members are: Norma Amparo P. who has sold silver items and underwear itinerantly for the last six years and Ligia Vanesa Ortes P. who became associated with Avon and Zermat, known for catalogue sales, in 2006 and started selling said products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes.

loans.name: Las Hijas Del Rey Group

texts.es:
Este comité se encuentra trabajando entre sus 18 integrantes cada una con su actividad y muy satisfechas ya que pueden ayudar a sus familias.
Cada una cuenta con actividades diferente pero sin perder en sentido de responsabilidad que tienen como grupo con relación al crédito que han recibido.
El presente comité se encuentra, en su 6to ciclo. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Norma A. de 36  años de edad, tiene una hija de 12 años es madre soltera de profesión peluquera, tiene su peluquería en su casa con clientela formada es una persona muy activa y también hace comestible los fines de semanas para tener más ingresos, para poder cubrir los gastos de la casa y del colegio de la hija. 
Ella dice que si uno se propone metas todo se puede lograr con un poco de sacrificio. 
Solicito el préstamo para la compra de productos que ella utiliza en salón de belleza como cremas y aceites para cabellos, asi como shampoo y acondicionadores.
texts.en:
This committee is now in its sixth cycle. It is made up of 18 members who each carry out their own work and feel very satisfied doing so as they are able to help their families. Even though they are involved in different lines of work, they all feel a shared sense of responsibility to each other to repay the loan they have received as a group. One of the committee's members is Norma A.. She is 36 years of age and is a single mother to a 12 year old daughter. She is a hairdresser and runs a salon from her house. She is a very active person and also works weekends to generate more income so she can cover the costs of running her house and pay for her daughter’s school fees. Norma believes that if you set yourself a goal, you can achieve anything if you are prepared to sacrifice a little. She is requesting a loan to purchase products such as shampoo and conditioner for her beauty salon.

Translated from Spanish by Suzanne Grasso, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of hair salon products

loans.name: Benita

texts.es: Benita, de 36 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos, Javier y Roxana de 14 y 12 años. Juntos residen en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propia casa. A pesar de tener primaria incompleta, eso no lo incomodó a que siga luchando por la satisfacción personal y familiar. Benita, le gusta sobresalir y conjuntamente con su esposo abrieron una mecánica, específicamente elaborar puertas y ventanas de metal, en donde repara, suelda, con el fin de obtener un mejor resultado de calidad. Asimismo sus clientes se sienten satisfechos por el buen acabado que les brinda, incluso la buena crítica o comentarios de su trabajo, hacen que Benita se esmere más en su trabajo. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, y juntos le dan mucho amor y dedicación a su trabajo, pero además tiene a cargo de sus colaboradores, de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en cualquier tarea que se les encomiende. Por lo general su taller está ubicado en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad, de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 8:00 de la noche. Su plan a futuro es abrir una tienda con el propósito de que pueda diversificar su cartera de clientes y elevar su calidad de vida. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se asegura cumplir fielmente con su cronograma de pagos, además agradece a su banco comunal, ya que obtiene buenos beneficios económicos. Con el crédito que solicita le servirá para que pueda comprar la materia prima, de esa menara pueda elaborar eficiente los servicios que requieren sus clientes.
texts.en:
Benita, 36 years old, is married and has two children, Javier and Roxana who are 14 and 12 years old. Together they live on the outskirts of the Peruvian jungle, in the town of Santa Rosa where they own their own home. She carries on fighting for her personal and family's satisfaction, despite not having completed elementary school. Benita likes to improve herself and along with her husband she has opened a shop in which they manufacture metal doors and windows. and where they also fix and mend in order to obtain better quality results. Their customers are pleased with the finished product and their compliments on her work makes Benita want to work even harder. She normally works alongside her husband and together they put a lot of love and dedication in their work. They also have assistants and that allows them to make any order easier to accomplish. The shop is located in the same neighborhood they live in. They work Mondays through Saturdays, from 7am to 8pm. Her plan for the future is tu open a shop to diversify her customer base and improve her quality of life. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she commits to comply with her schedule of payments. She also thanks her community bank for making good economic benefits available. She will buy raw materials with the loan to be able to efficiently fill her customers' orders.

Translated from Spanish by Betyna Almeida-Covarrubias, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase metal to manufacture door and windows

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Magdalena; ella tiene 62 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 5 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de  productos remojados como trigo, quinua y moraya, ella tiene un puesto  en el mercado del distrito de Wanchaq desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 4:00 p.m, su esposo es carpintero hace trabajos en madera como muebles, sillas y camas, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos remojados y aumentar su mercadería. 

  La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Magdalena, 62, is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco” (Our Lady of the Rosary of Cusco) communal bank located in Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. She is married and has 5 children. She combines her household chores with sales of grains like wheat, Quinoa and moraya (dehydrated potato) in a stand she has in the Wanchaq district market from 6am until 4pm. Her husband is a carpenter who makes wood articles like furniture, chairs and beds. She’d like to improve her business and is asking for funds to buy grains to increase her stock. She uses this forum to thank all those who participate in her dream and pledges to repay in a timely fashion.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grains to increase her stock.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es: Bertha, de 34 años de edad, es divorciada y tiene cuatro hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, donde tienen su propia casa. Para Bertha lo que prevalece es la realización personal, es así que logró tener su tienda de abarrotes, negocio del cual tenía mucha demanda en su localidad, hoy la competencia ha aumentado, por ello debe mejorar cada día para seguir siendo la preferida de sus clientes. Se siente muy contenta con el trabajo que tiene, además recibe buenas rentas por lo que le da seguridad económica. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero en tiempo de vacaciones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su rutina es de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche. Su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad, no obstante en un futuro no muy lejano, ella piensa ampliar su negocio de abarrotes con la necesidad de atraer mayor clientela y en efecto mejorar sus ventas considerablemente. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además está satisfecho con su banco su banco comunal, ya que todos están comprometidos en sus pagos. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías, con la finalidad de que su tienda esté bien surtida.
texts.en:
Bertha, 34, is divorced and has four school aged children. They live in Santa Rosa located in the beautiful Peruvian tropical jungle in their own house. Personal fulfillment is an important goal for Bertha and this is why she managed to have her own grocery store, a business that is in high demand in her location. Today, competition has increased so she must improve daily in order to continue to be the one preferred by her customers. She is happy with her work and it produces good profits which gives her economic security. She normally works by herself but during school vacation periods her children help her. She is open for business Monday through Sunday from 6am until 10pm. Her sales point is in her own neighborhood. Notwithstanding, in the not so distant future she plans to expand her grocery business in order to attract more customers and improve her sales considerably. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue repaying. Besides, she is satisfied with her communal bank because everyone is committed to their payments. The requested funds will be used to buy merchandise in order to have her store well stocked.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Amor Y Paz 1, 2 & 5 Group

texts.en:
Iluminada is the coordinator of her group Amor y Paz 1, 2 & 5 (Love and Peace). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and a child. She says that her most difficult challenge is to overcome their economic situation. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to play Domino and decorate.

Iluminida is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for three years, starting with some savings. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying home products. She will use the profits to buy her child school supplies and to invest in her business. She is dreaming to have her own house and she also wants her family to join her to improve her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican cleints, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production and the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water, none of which is potable, and electricity.

loans.use: To buy liquid soap, detergent, etc.

loans.name: Jazmina Amalia

texts.es:
Jazmina tiene la edad de 30 años, madre de tres hijos, casada, siendo su esposo mecánico. 
Ella se desempeña como promotora de ventas para el inss. Ambos trabajando para lograr mejores condiciones de vivienda. Ya que la parte de atrás de los baños esta forrada de plástico lo que desea mejorar para lograr tener mejor higiene como privacidad en sus necesidades.

Para esto comprara materiales de construcción como: bloques, arena, cemento, hierro y así poder hacer esta obra. Siendo Afodenic un apoyo mediante el financiamiento.
texts.en:
Jazmina, 30, is married and has three children; her husband is a mechanic. She works as a sales promoter for INSS (Nicaraguan Social Security Institute). Both work to attain better living conditions. The rear of their bathroom is made of plastic sheeting and she wants to have better hygienic conditions and privacy. To do so, she will buy concrete blocks, sand, cement and iron rods. Afodenic is a source of support through the financing.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Will buy sand, cement, iron rods in order to build a bathroom and have better hygienic conditions.

loans.name: Dionisia

texts.es: Dionisia, de 52 años de edad, está casada y tiene dos hijos en su haber. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. Para tener su propia heladería, no fue tan fácil como ella lo esperaba, le fue difícil, ya que el primer mes de funcionamiento solo tuvo contados clientes que se acercaban a su heladería, y lo que percibía solo le alcanzaba para su canasta familiar. Dionisia hizo hincapié en mejorar en la elaboración de sus helados, en donde introdujo nuevos sabores con la finalidad de que sus clientes estén más que satisfechos, desde luego que lo consiguió, con el transcurrir de los años perfeccionó su producto. Hoy tiene un posicionamiento considerable en su localidad y reconoce que la clave de su éxito radicó en la innovación de sus sabores, además utilizó frutas netamente de su valle, es por ello que siente contenta con su negocio, sin embargo reconoce que el mundo cambia y requiere de creatividad continua, es por ello que trata de sacar nuevos productos lo mas que pueda. Dionisia anhela  ampliar su heladería, de esa manera pueda introducir maquinas para la elaboración de helados, con la finalidad de que pueda producir en cantidad. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo e hijos y juntos hacen un buen equipo, además tiene el apoyo de sus hijos y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia localidad. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus obligaciones de pago, además está satisfecha por el buen trabajo de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo servirá para que compre frutas de toda variedad, como también insumos para su respectiva elaboración de helados típicos de su zona.
texts.en:
Dionisia, 52, is married and has two children under her care. They live in Santa Rosa located in the beautiful Ayacucho backcountry in their own home. Having her own ice cream shop wasn’t as easy as she thought it would be at first. It was very difficult and during her first month of operations she had just a few customers show up; she barely made enough to afford the most basic food items for her home. Dionisia concentrated on improving her ice cream introducing new flavors so that her customers would be more satisfied. As expected, this did the trick and she has continued to improve her product over the years. Today she is well positioned in the marketplace in her location and she considers that the key to her success lay in her innovative flavors using fruit strictly indigenous to her valley. For this reason she is very happy with her business. However, she is aware that the world changes and requires continuous creativity so she tries to bring out new products as much as possible. Dionisia wants to expand her ice cream shop and install new ice cream making machines in order to produce larger quantities. She usually works together with her husband and children and they make a good team. Besides, her children help out. Her sales point is in her own location. This is her 5th loan with MFP which she pledges to repay on time. She is satisfied with the good treatment she receives in her communal bank. The requested funds will be used to buy a large variety of fruit as well as other ingredients to make ice cream typical of her area.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruit and ingredients to make ice cream.

loans.name: Hazel Ivania

texts.es:
Hazel es una joven, trabajadora, madre de una niña, casada. Como objetivo es poder terminar de reparar su pequeña casa.
Trabaja como asistente logrando obtener ingresos y venta de ropa, para poder apoyar a su esposo y lograr mejores condiciones de vivienda. Ya que atraves de los préstamos ha venido mejorando su casa, con el crédito anterior logro poner cerámica y con este podrá cerrar el cuarto de baldosa ya que es bajo y no tiene privacidad lo que es de gran relevancia para lograr satisfacer esta necesidad.
Todo ha incrementado y es difícil la construcción en estos días, pero atreves del financiamiento se logra por sus plazos, lo que está contenta porque así ha mejorado su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hazel is a young, hard working mother. She is married and has a daughter. Her objective is to finish repairing her small house. She works as an Assistant earning a salary and sells clothes to help her husband and manage to improve the conditions of her house. Through loans she has been making improvements to the house. The previous loan allowed her to install tile and this one will be used to close off the bedroom with paving stones because it lacks privacy due to the wall being so low. This will meet this need. Everything has gotten more expensive and construction is difficult these days but through financing it can be done in stages. She is happy because she has been improving her home.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy tile and cement and will raise her bedroom walls because she lack personal privacy and she wants to improve this condition.

loans.name: Grimalda

texts.es: Grimalda, de 33 años de edad, está divorciada y tiene dos hijos, Zaida y Jhuliño de 16 y 13 años. Juntos viven en la ceja de la selva peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propia casa  a base de adobe. Posee una negocio de venta de combustible, del cual tiene pocos años de funcionamiento, ya que se aventuró en este proyecto por que le pareció una necesidad primordial, para su localidad, desde luego que empezó con un pequeño establecimiento. Hoy tiene un local mediano para su respectiva venta gasolina, kerosene y otros, además  siente que está mejorando sus ventas con el pasar de los meses, por el cual trata de darle mayor importancia a su establecimiento, de esa manera pueda captar mayor clientela. Por lo general trabaja con un ayudante, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos, de esa manera puedan agilizar en la atención de sus clientes. Su rutina de trabajo es de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 5:00 de la mañana hasta las 11:00 de la noche. Grimalda anhela en un futuro cercano, abrir su propia tienda de abarrotes con la necesidad de diversificar su cartera de clientes, además esto permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a cumplir con sus respectivos pagos, además tiene un buen concepto de su banco comunal, ya que todos los socios son solidarios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en darle un buen acondicionamiento a su establecimiento y el resto le servirá para que cumpla los pagos pendientes de su personal.
texts.en:
Grimalda, 33, is divorced and has two children, Saida, 16, and Jhuliño, 13. They live together in the Peruvian highland jungle in Santa Rosa in an adobe house. She sells fuel. She’s been in business for just a few years since she ventured to go into it noting that it was a primary need in her location. Needless to say, she started out with a small establishment. Today it’s medium size and she sells gasoline, kerosene and others. She feels that sales have improved as the months have passed so she tries to focus more attention on the establishment in order to get more customers. Usually she works with an assistant but sometimes her children help out so that they can provide quicker service to her customers. She is open for business from Monday through Saturday from 5am until 11pm. Grimalda would like to open a grocery store in the near future to diversify her customer base; besides, this would allow her to improve her and her family’s quality of life. This is her first loan with MFP and she pledges to make her respective payments dutifully. She has a good concept of her communal bank because all the members are mutually supportive. She will use the requested funds to do a good refurbishing of her locale and the rest will be used to pay some pending employee salaries.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To equip her fuel selling locale and pay staff salaries.

loans.name: Franklin

texts.es:
Don Franklin es  padre de familia de dos hijos, casado. Tiene dos trabajos hoy en día. Taxista y una barbería que puso en su casa y la tiene ubicada en una parte de la sala.
Esto lo logra a través de las ganancias del taxi. Y nace la idea para lograr ganar dinero ya que abeces las corridas están malas, y con su barbería logra equilibrar sus gastos.
Lleva siete ciclos en Afodenic en donde ha logrado dar mantenimiento a su vehículo, hacer pequeñas mejoras a su vivienda. Y con este préstamo lograra comprar equipos para seguir dando un mejor servicio en su barbería.
Comprara: una silla de barbería para adulto, una silla para niño, maquinas pequeña para pulir, cepillo, gelatina, guillet. Talco, colonia y otros. Logrando a si dar un giro diferente en atención. Tiene planes a largo plazo para hacer independiente el negocio una construcción. Es por eso desea captar clientes y ganar mejor.
texts.en:
Franklin is married and has two children. He has two jobs. He’s a taxi driver and a barber. His barber shop is set up in part of his living room. Profits from the taxi made the shop possible. He got the idea for the shop because sometimes fares in the taxi aren’t all that good and the barber shop allows him to even out his expenses. He has been in seven Afodenic cycles which have allowed him to service his car and make small home improvements. This loan will be used to buy equipment and supplies to provide better service in his barber shop. He will buy the following: a barber chair for adults, a child’s barber chair, trimmers, a brush, gel, Gillette blades, talcum powder, cologne and others thereby modifying the attention he can provide. His long range plan is to build a structure to make the barber shop independent from the house. This is why he wants to get more customers and earn more.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: He will buy supplies for his barber shop like: a barber chair for adults, a child’s barber chair, small hair trimmers, brush, gel, Gillette blades, talcum powder, cologne and others.

loans.name: Las Trabajadoras Group

texts.es:
Las integrantes de este comité  se dedican a variadas actividades entre las que se puede destacar  la venta de ropas, minutas, como empanadas, tortillas, croquetas, asaditos de carne etc.
 La  mayoría  son madres de familia y  cabezas de hogar por lo que día a día se sacrifican mucho para salir adelante. 
 Actualmente este comité se encuentra en su primer ciclo en donde se puede mencionar la responsabilidad y unión entre ellas. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Amandine, ella trabaja como recepcionista en una empresa y se unió a la grupo de mujeres ya también quiere invertir en un negocio con el que pueda obtener ingresos adicionales a su trabajo. 
La señora Amandine solicita el préstamo para la compra de  ingredientes como carne, verduras, harinas, condimentos y otros, para comestibles ya que los fines de semana elabora varios tipos para vender en su barrio en las actividades que el comité realiza como por ejemplo ferias de comidas y otros.
texts.en:
The members of this committee are involved in a variety of activities among which we can mention: sale of clothes, snacks like turnovers, tortillas, croquettes, roasted meats, etc. Most are mothers and heads of household who sacrifice daily to get ahead. The committee is in its first cycle and they show responsibility and unity among themselves. One of the members is Amandine. She works as a Receptionist at a firm and joined this group of women because she wants to invest in a business to earn extra income besides her salary. Amandine is asking for a loan to buy ingredients like meat, vegetables, flours, condiments and others for food items that she makes on weekends to sell in her neighborhood during activities the committee undertakes like food fairs and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy meat, vegetables, cooking oil and condiments.

loans.name: Maria Marcela

texts.es:
María es una mujer trabajadora, dedicada al trabajo, pequeña comerciante que atreves de los años ha logrado captar sus clientes.
Se dedica a la venta de comida en frente de su casa, fritanga variada, golosinas, gaseosas, jugos, frescos, frutas, ahora tiene más producto que ante ya que solo vendía comida anteriormente,  los financiamiento han venido hacer una puerta de alternativa para mejorar sus ingresos que atreves de los cuales logra cubrir sus necesidades personales como pagos básicos, pagos del financiamiento.
Con este préstamo invertirá en productos de alimentos como: carne, pollo, quintal de maíz, bidón de aceite, manteca, frutas, verduras, golosinas entre otros para comenzar hacer mas comida esperando vender más,  para una mejor economía familiar.
texts.en:
María is a hard working woman who is devoted to work. She’s a small merchant who has secured a good customer base over the years. She sells prepared meals, various fried foods, sweets, soft drinks, juices, smoothies, fruits in front of her house. She now stocks more items; she used to just sell prepared food. The loans have been an alternative pathway to improve income in that they allow her to meet her personal expenses like utility payments and loan repayments. This loan will be used to buy food items like: meat, chicken, a quintal (equal to 46 kilos) of corn, a large container of cooking oil, lard, fruit, vegetables, sweets among others to start making more food and selling more to improve her family’s economy.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy: chicken, a quintal (equivalent to 46 kilos) of corn, fruits and vegetables, sweets and others to increase sales.

loans.name: Caminando Con Jesus 2 Group

texts.en:
Yamiris is the coordinator of her group Caminando con Jesus 2 (Walking with Jesus). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long term partner and two children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to have her own home. In the meantime she plans to continue enjoying listening to music.

Yamiris is excited to be taking her second loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for 6 months, starting with her first Esperanza loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying underwear and silver jewelry. She will use the profits to buy some school supplies, and invest in her business. She dreams of having her own home, where they can live safely and comfortably, and to give her children a good education so that they can be professionals when they have grown up.  

This Esperanza associate began with us because she found in Esperanza a way to work and be at home, with great facilities and her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. Her group is located in Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy underwear and silver jewelry to sell.

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas De Fernando Group

texts.es:
El comité “tiene 3 años de formación y trabaja con la Fundación Paraguaya”,  la mayoría de sus integrantes ya  realiza actividades productivas, pero incluyen entre sus integrantes a  señoras que emprenderán actividades.
Incluyen entre las actividades realizadas la venta de frutas y verduras, venta de comestibles artesanales como empanadas de carne, empanadas de pollo, empanadas de jamón y queso, venta de mercaderías varias como: fideo, azúcar, harina, aceite, jabón, entre otros artículos, venta de ropas, venta de remedios etc.
 Anhelan un futuro mejor para sus hijos es por eso que se esfuerzan el doble para facilitarles los materiales para su desarrollo y formación.  
Una de las integrantes es la señora Angélica quien se dedica a la venta de ropas, esta es la actividad que ella realiza para ayudar con los ingresos de su casa. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de ropas de manera a contar con mas variedades de ropas para sus clientes, entre las prendas que ella quiere adquirir como remeras, camisas, pantalones, vestidos, blusas y otros.
texts.en:
The committee “has been in operation for three years and works with Fundación Paraguaya.” Most of its members are involved in productive activities but include among its members women who are about to start activities. Among their activities are: fruit and vegetable sales, artisanal food sales like meat and chicken turnovers, ham and cheese turnovers; sale of various merchandise like: pasta, sugar, flour, cooking oil, soap, etc., clothing sales, health remedies, etc. They all hope for better futures for their children and that’s why they double their efforts to provide them with tools to develop. One of the members is Angélica who sells clothes to help generate family income. She is asking for funds to buy clothes in order to have a wider variety of stock for her customers. She wants to buy t-shirts, shirts, pants, dresses, blouses and others.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted clothing.

loans.name: Alba Luz

texts.es:
Alba Luz es una pequeña comerciante, madre de cuatro hijos, casada siendo su esposo mecánico.
Es un mujer dedicada al trabajo, vende comida en su especialidad es el vahó. Venta de ropa lo que lo hace ambulante en un mercado. Son quince años en las ventas pues ha hecho su medio de sobrevivencia, ya que todo está ah altos costos.
 Ambos se esfuerzan para logra equilibrar los gastos de consumo de alimentos como gastos básicos, estudios y otros. Día a día hace su comida y viaja hasta su puesto que vende que tiene forrado de plástico el techo y no lograr quemarse tanto del sol, como cuidar los alimentos.
Con este préstamo comprara: granos básicos, carne, pollo, frutas y verduras para lograr la producción de mas alimentos y poder aumentar  las venta para mejorar su economía, ya que muchas veces vende poco y pierde lo que se descapitaliza, y no cuenta con dinero para invertir más, es por este medio viable de los financiamiento que hace posible la inversión.
texts.en:
Alba Luz is a small shopkeeper, mother of four, and married to a mechanic. She is a woman who is very dedicated to her work. She sells food, and her specialty is vahó [a traditional meal of steamed meat and vegetables]. She also sells clothing as a street vendor. Working in sales has been her livelihood for 15 years since everything is very expensive. Both Alba and her husband strive to cover the expenses for food and other basic needs like school. Day after day, Alba makes her food and travels to her stall where she sells it. The stall has a plastic roof that protects the foods and keeps her from being sunburned so much. With this loan she will purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, and vegetables to produce more foods and increase sales to improve her finances. Many times she sells little and loses capital and doesn’t have money to invest more. Thanks to the the loan, she is able to make the investment.

Translated from Spanish by Rachael Mossey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase basic grains, meat, chicken, fruits, and vegetables to make more foods and earn more money

loans.name: Familia Unida De Inversion 4 Group

texts.en:
Justino is the coordinator of his group Familia unida D. inversion 4  "United Family of Investments". He makes his home here in a simple structure with his long term partner. He says that his most difficult challenge is having a successful business. In the meantime, he plans to continue enjoy sharing with his friends.

Justino is excited to be taking his 4th loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid his previous loan and grown his business. He has had his business for almost 6 years, starting with loans he took from other lenders. He plans to use this loan to invest in his business by buying rice, beans, sugar, oil, flour, and other goods. His business is a Colmado, a place where you can find all the ingredients to make your daily food; normally colmados are in the same neighborhood so they are a short walk from any home. He will use the profits to invest in his business, to buy some stuff they need at home and save, because in the future he would like to own a supermarket. 

This Esperanza associate began with us because he received a better interest rate and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural area surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity shortages.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, pasta, beans, etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge, de 20 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijo alguno. Vive en casa de sus padres, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, específicamente en la localidad de Santa Rosa. Jorge se caracteriza por ser creativo y trabajador, pese que solo tiene secundaria completa, no pierde las esperanzas de estudiar una carrera como ingeniería de sistemas, con el propósito de que pueda tener su propio empresa y pueda ofrecer sus servicios. Es por ello que lo ve como un negocio rentable, además en su localidad no servicio alguno, pero es consciente que debe ir paso a paso. Hoy se esta dedicando a la heladería que tiene sus padres, en donde está laborando de manera constante, fruto de su esfuerzo percibe un pago justo, su rutina diaria es de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 4:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde y su punto de venta lo realiza en su propia localidad a un precio competitivo.  En un futuro próximo anhela tener su propio tienda de venta de computadoras, repuestos, servicios de reparación y demás accesorios, con la finalidad de que tome un posicionamiento agresivo en su localidad. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir de manera puntual con sus respectivos pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, debido a las buenas decisiones que se llegan a dar. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en adquirir frutas e insumos, para su respectiva elaboración de helados tropicales de la zona.
texts.en:
Jorge is 20 years old, single, and doesn't have any children. He lives in his parents house, which is located in the beautiful Ayacuchana jungle, specifically in the town of Santa Rosa. Jorge is known for being creative and hard-working. Even though he only has completed his secondary education, he doesn't lose the hope of studying for a career as a systems engineer, with the intention of being able to have his own business and to offer his services. In his town there aren't any services of this type, and he sees it as a profitable business, but he is conscious that he must go step by step.

Today, he is working in the ice cream shop that his parents own, where he is constantly working. The fruit of his effort is a fair pay. He works daily from Monday to Saturday, from 4am until 6pm, and his shop is in his own town nd he offers a competitive price. In the near future, he hopes to have his own shop selling computers, spare parts, repair services and other accessories, with the aim to take an aggressive position in his town.

This is his first loan with MFP, and therefore he assures he will pay it back in a punctual manner with his respective payments. Additionally, he is happy with his community bank, due to the good decisions that they give him. With the loan he is requesting, he is thinking to invest it in buying fruits and supplies to make tropical ice cereams of the region.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and supplies to make ice cream

loans.name: Justina

texts.es: Justina, de 43 años de edad, está casada y tiene una hija, Flor de 6 años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. A pesar de no tener estudios, debido al factor económico, no fue una excusa para no hacer nada, desde entonces se dedico en la venta de cacao, con el tiempo este producto tuvo mucha demanda a nivel nacional y extranjero. Hoy vende a los grandes mayoristas y se siente contenta por lo que viene atravesando y no se arrepiente por haber apostado por la actividad agrícola, además asegura que la hace un bien al medio ambiente, ya que sus productos son netamente orgánicos. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su esposo, pero en temporada de cosecha necesita de sus peones para que le ayuden a extraer sus frutos. Normalmente su producto lo vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio competitivo. Su plan a futuro es seguir ampliando su producción agrícola de cacao, para ello adquirirá varias hectáreas, con la finalidad de que pueda sembrar su producto y de esa manera mejorar su nivel socioeconómico. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual  asegura cumplir  fielmente con sus obligaciones de pago, además se siente cómoda con su banco comunal, debido a la transparencia que transmiten los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de abono para que de esa manera le brinde un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, con la finalidad de evitar que se perjudiquen dichas plantaciones.
texts.en:
Justina is 43 years old, married, and has one daughter, Flor, who is 6 years old. They live together in the town of Santa Rosa, located in the beautiful Ayacuchan jungle, where they have their own adobe house. In spite of not having gone to school due to her economic situation, this was not an excuse to not do anything. Since then she sells cocoa, and with time this product had a lot of demand on the national and international level. Today she sells to big wholesalers, and she feels happy because she comes crossing and doesn't regret for having bet on agricultural activity. Also she is sure that she is doing well for the environment since her products are net organics.

Generally she works together with her husband, but in the sowing season, she needs her farm workers to help her extract her fruits. Normally she sells her product in the wholesale centers of her town, for a competitive price. Her future plan is to continue growing her agricultural production of cocoa, and for that she will buy more hectares, with the aim to be able to plant her product, and in this way improve her socioeconomic level.

This is her fifth loan with MFP, and she therefore assures that she will faithfully complete her payment obligations. Also, she feels comfortable with her community bank, due to the transparency that the members offer. With the loan she is requesting, she is thinking to invest in the purchase of fertilizer so that in this way, she can offer the proper maintenance to her cocoa plantations, with the aim to avoid damaging them.

Translated from Spanish by Amy McGinty, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: María, de 38 años edad, está divorciada y tiene tres hijos en su haber, Yasmin, Kare y Elver de 9, 8 y 4 años. Reside en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tienen su propia casa. El negocio al que se dedica es la venta de productos de primera necesidad, en donde le está yendo de la mejor manera, además sus ventas vienen mejorando con respecto a los anteriores, incluso cuenta con clientes que siempre va a su establecimiento. Sin embargo es consciente  de la dura competencia, a pesar de ello trata de mejorar cada día. Usualmente trabaja por cuenta propia, de lunes a domingo, a partir de las 5:30 de la mañana hasta las 10:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su mismo barrio de su propia localidad. Su plan a futuro es tener una granja avícola y de porcinos con el fin de que pueda diversificar su cartera de clientes y de esa forma pueda mejorar su calidad de vida. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además esta conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos son solidarios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercadería con el propósito de que pueda abastecer su negocio de abarrotes.
texts.en:
María, 38, is divorced and has three children to support: Yasmin, Kare and Elver who are 9, 8, and 4 years of age. She lives in Santa Rosa located in the beautiful Ayacuco jungle where she has her own house. Her business is selling basic needs items. She is doing quite well. Her sales have improved over the previous ones. In fact, she has regular customers that always come to her establishment. However, she is aware that competition is fierce so she gives her best every day. She usually works by herself from Monday to Sunday from 5:30am until 10pm. Her sales point is in her own neighborhood. Her future plan is to have a poultry and pig ranch in order to diversify her customer base and improve her quality of life. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she commits to continue to repay in a timely fashion. Besides, she is very satisfied with her communal bank because everyone is very mutually supportive. She will use the requested funds to buy stock items for her grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Fe Y Amor 5 Group

texts.en:
Claudio is the coordinator of his group Fe y Amor 2 (Faith and Love). He makes his home here in a simple structure with his two children. He says that his most difficult challenge is 'to improve my business'.  In the meantime, he plans to continue to enjoy driving.

Claudio is excited to be taking his first loan with Esperanza. He is starting his business with this loan and he is planning to use it to invest in sport shoes, for men and women.  He will use the profits to invest in his business, which he wants to see improve in a short time.
 
This Esperanza associate began with us, because the facilities in Esperanza are better than other places where he can get a loan and his story is representative of his group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) clients generally. His group is located in the rural area surrounding Santiago, an area famous for tobacco and beef production, the second biggest city in the Dominican Republic. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity shortages.

loans.use: To buy sports shoes.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: Mery, de 30 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijo alguno. Reside en la hermosa selva tropical peruana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa. Para María, llevar una carrera a consciencia es una gran inversión; desde luego que su carrera de enfermería lo está aplicando en el campo, ya que tiene su propio botica en donde expende medicinas para todo el público en general, ella recalca que siempre trata de cumplir con la calidad y los precios de sus productos medicinales, es por ello que sus clientes recurrentes confían en su persona, por lo que le genera además buenas ganancias, logrando tomar posicionamiento dentro de su localidad. Por lo general trabaja por cuenta propia y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 9:00 de la noche y su punto de venta lo realiza en su barrio de su propia localidad. Sus planes a futuro es ampliar su botica con la finalidad de introducir productos nuevos y de primera necesidad para el hogar familiar, de esa manera pueda retener a sus clientes, además piensa actualizarse continuamente, mediante cursos de capacitación, para que así sea una enfermera competitiva. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además hace referencia al buen funcionamiento de su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la comprar productos medicinales que tengan mucha demanda, con la necesidad de que los pueda atender a sus clientes más exigentes.
texts.en:
Mery, 30, is single and has no children. She lives in the beautiful Peruvian jungle in Santa Rosa where she has her own house. For María, exercising her profession in a conscientious way is a great investment. She is applying her nursing career in the countryside for she owns a drug store where she dispenses medicine to the general public. She stresses that she always tries to provide high quality products at affordable prices. For this reason, recurring customers trust her and this leads to better profits positioning her very well in her community. She generally works by herself and is open from 7am until 9pm. Her sales point is in her own neighborhood. Her plan for the future is to expand the drug store introducing new products and basic items for home use so that she can keep her customers. She also intends to always update herself through courses and workshops so that she can be a competitive nurse. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. She also mentions the good functioning of her communal bank. She plans to use the requested funds to buy medicines that are in high demand so that she can have them available for her most demanding customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock medicines for her drug store.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es casada y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de emolientes (mates), huevos sancochados y sándwich, ella vende desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 11:00 a.m, ella vende en el mercado de Vinocanchon de forma independiente que está ubicado en San Jeronimo, su esposo es maestro de construcción y juntos sacan adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere mejorar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar los emolientes y sándwich. 

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the Communal Bank “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”, which is located in the District of Wanchaq, Province and Department of Cusco.

She is 43 years old, married, and has two children. Sonia divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling herbal tonics, deviled eggs, and sandwiches. She sells her products from 5am until 11am as an independent merchant at the Vinocanchon Market, which is located in San Jeronimo. Her husband is a master builder and they both work together so that their children can get ahead. Sonia wants to improve her business, so she is requesting this loan so that she can buy ingredients for preparing herbal tonics and sandwiches.

She is grateful to everyone who helped make this dream possible. Therefore, she promises to complete her payments by the established deadlines.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase ingredients for preparing herbal tonics and sandwiches

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresa es una mujer trabajadora, siendo su medio de trabajo la venta de ropa, zapatos, y costura. Lo que para ella ha sido de mucho apoyar  a su esposo e hijos.
Anteriormente solo se dedicaba a la costura, pero como hay meses que nadie llega a coser. Nace la iniciativa de comprar ropa nueva y hacer ropa de telas que ella cose,   compra así como encargos que le hacen los clientes en zapatos. Con las ganancias compra parte de los alimentos, abarca gastos básicos lo que está contenta por poder apoyar a su familia.
Con este financiamiento comprara: telas en cantidad y de diferente colores, hilos, bordados, así como ropa nueva y zapatos así  mejorando  las ventas.
texts.en:
Teresa is a hardworking woman who earns her living by sewing and selling clothing and shoes. She has tremendous support from her husband and children.

Teresa previously devoted herself to sewing alone, but after several months she was no longer receiving orders. She took the initiative to buy new clothing in addition to the garments that she sews. Teresa buys merchandise based on her customers’ orders, which also includes shoes. She is pleased with her earnings because she is able to buy food and pay for basic expenses to support her family.

This loan will be used to buy fabrics in quantity and of different colors, thread, embroideries, as well as new clothing and shoes to increase her sales.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase new clothing, shoes, fabrics, thread, and embroideries

loans.name: Nery

texts.es: Nery, de 38 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene dos hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, ubicada en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, donde tiene su propia casa. Nery, recalca que la venta de cacao es bastante rentable, por ello trata de darle el mejor cuidado respectivo a sus plantaciones de cacao, y bajo esa premisa es que muchos de sus compradores se han  sentido satisfechos  por la calidad de su producto agrícola, sin embargo ella trata de esmerarse lo mas posible que pueda. Es por ello que le dedica mucho tiempo a su producto de cacao, conjuntamente con la ayuda de su pareja, sin embargo en tiempo de cosecha necesita de sus peones, para que de esa manera lo puedan facilitar en la extracción de su producto final y fruto del esfuerzo está obteniendo buenos ganancias económicas. Normalmente su producto de cacao los vende en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y a un precio razonable; su rutina laboral lo realiza de lunes a sábado, a partir de las 6:00 de la mañana hasta las 6.00 de la tarde. Ella anhela en un futuro próximo, tener su propio grifo con la necesidad de diferenciarse ante sus demás competencias, a la vez obtener nuevos ingresos. Este es su cuarto crédito con MFP, por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus respectivos pagos, además augura en que tendrá mucho éxito en su banco comunal, ya que existe armonía en cada unos de los socios. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono para que lo dé un mantenimiento adecuado a sus plantaciones de cacao, por ende mejorar en la calidad y cantidad de su producción agrícola.
texts.en:
Nery is 38 years old and lives with her husband and two school age children. They reside in their own home in the town of Santa Rosa, which is located in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle. Nery says she sells cacao because it is quite profitable, so she tries to provide her crops the best care. She has many buyers who are satisfied with the quality of her product, so she strives to achieve this result as often as possible. Nery devotes much of her time to growing cacao and has the help of her husband. During the harvest season, she needs to hire laborers to facilitate the extraction of the cacao beans from the pods so that she can sell the final product. Her efforts result in a good financial income. Normally her products are sold at the local collection centers for a reasonable price. Her work routine is from Monday to Saturday, beginning at 6am and lasting until 6pm. Nery’s wish for the near future is to have her own source of water in order to differentiate herself from the competition and create a new source of income.

This is her fourth loan with MFP. Nery plans to complete her payments faithfully. She predicts that she will have much success with her Communal Bank since the members get along with one another. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy supplies and compost in order to provide adequate maintenance for her cacao crops. This will improve the quality and quantity of her production.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase compost & supplies for her cacao crop

loans.name: Daysy

texts.es:
Daysy tiene la edad de 46 años, madre de dos hijos, casada siendo su esposo sastre.
Su profesión es la costura con veinte años en su trabajo que ambos se han  ayudado conociendo el mismo trabajo y han podido unirse para salir adelante, hacen todo tipo de traje, para dama, caballero, niños, reparan ropa que los clientes llevan.
También doña Daysy vende bebidas de coca cola, repostería, jugos, para lograr aumentar su economía, 
Para lograr aumentar de producción de ropa, accedió al financiamiento  ya que requería, de más telas y no contaba con el capital. Lo que ha venido hacer de gran  beneficio por que invirtió también en venta de coca cola.
Con este financiamiento comprara dos rollos de tela sincatex que abarca cincuenta yardas, un rollo de dacron, y otras para lograr hacer sus trajes y vestido y poder vender.
texts.en:
Daysy, 46, is married and has two children. Her husband is a tailor. She has been a dressmaker for 20 years. Since both she and her husband are in the same profession they have been able to help each other and have gotten ahead together. They make all kinds of clothes for women, men and children. They also repair clothing that their customers bring them. Daysy also sells Coca-Cola, pasties and juices to earn extra income. In order to increase clothing production she requested funding because she needed more fabric but lacked funds to purchase it. The funds were a great help; they even made it possible for her to invest in more Coca-Cola. This loan will be used to buy two bolts of Sincatex (a brand of polyester) that will be 50 yards and one bolt of Dacron as well as others to make her suits and dresses to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: She will buy two volts of Sincatex (a brand of polyester) and Dacron as well as other to make more clothes and thus sell more.

loans.name: María Agusta De La Fé

texts.es:
En las afueras de  Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa con un clima agradable y con una rica variedad de platos típicos. Encontramos el Banco Comunal  Los  Ángeles que se reúnen cada quince días.

La señora María esta en en el Banco Comunal desde sus inicios, dice que le gusta porque siempre recibe los créditos a tiempo y sin ningún problema. Esta muy agradecida con la Fundación Espoir porque le han ayudado en momentos difíciles. Mantiene una relación de unión libre hace 30 años, de la cual procreo 3 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, pero que aun viven en su casa.

Se dedica al comercio de ropa de todo tipo, además vende sobrecamas ya que según nos cuenta se venden mucho y deja buenas ganancias. Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, pero también vende en su casa. Trabaja  tres o cuatro días a la semana unas cinco horas por día. La mercadería la compra una vez al mes en Guayaquil por que allá salen mas baratas.

Este nuevo credito lo va a utilizar para comprar sabanas y ropa de mujer ya que tiene muchos pedidos.

Su deseo es comprar un carro para ir a comprar y vender su mercadería mucho mas rápido.
texts.en:
In Portoviejo’s outskirts, a beautiful city with a pleasant climate and a rich variety of typical regional dishes, we find the Los Ángeles (Angels) communal bank which meets every two weeks. María has been a member of this communal bank since its inception. She says she enjoys it because she always gets the loans on time and problem-free. She is very grateful to Fundación Espoir because it has helped her in difficult times. She has been in a common law union for 30 years and has three children all of whom are adults but still live at home. She is a clothing merchant but also sells bedspreads because, as she tells us, they sell well and produce good profits. She sells door-to-door but also from home. She works three or four days a week about five hours a day. She buys the merchandise once a month in Guayaquil because it is less expensive there. This new loan will be used to buy bed sheets and women’s clothing because she has a lot of pending orders to fill. Her wish is to buy a car so that she can go buy and sell her merchandise much more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy women's clothing and bed sheets.

loans.name: Prudencio

texts.es: Prudencio, de 38 años de edad, es soltero y tiene dos hijas, Luz  y Madrid de 12 y 8 años. Juntos residen en la hermosa selva ayacuchana, ubicada en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su techo propio. Prudencio es una persona decidida, es por ello que incursionó en la actividad agrícola, específicamente, cultivando y comercializando cacao. Él agradece a sus padres, que le enseñaron las técnicas del cultivo y cosecha. Es por ello que está volcando toda la experiencia vivida en sus campos agrícolas, los resultados se ven cuando su producto tiene mucha demanda en el mercado, ante esto piensa sembrar plátano, por ser un fruto que tiene también más demanda en el mercado. Hoy tiene dos productos en la cual puede sostener a su familia, ya que para clave del éxito está en la diversificación de productos, es por ello que percibe buenos ingresos económicos, en donde sus compradores potenciales se sienten satisfechos por la calidad de los productos. Normalmente trabaja con sus peones, en donde les facilita la extracción de su producto final, y su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Su plan a futuro es ampliar su producción agrícola, para ello adquirirá terrenos de cultivo, con la finalidad de que pueda producir a gran escala. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con sus respectivos pagos, además asevera que existe un buen clima cordial en su banco comunal. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, para que le pueda dar un mantenimiento exhaustivo a sus plantaciones de cacao y plátano.
texts.en:
Prudencio, 38, is single and has two daughters, Luz and Madrid who are 12 and 8 years old. They live together in the beautiful Ayacucho jungle in the town of Santa Rosa where they own their own house. Prudencio is a determined person. This is why he went into farming, specifically cacao farming. He is grateful to his parents who taught him farming and harvesting techniques. For this reason he is putting all his life experience into his fields. The results are made palpable by the high market demand for his crops. In light of this, he plans to plant bananas because it also is in high demand in the marketplace. Today, he has two products with which he can support his family because the key to success is crop diversification. This is why his income is good; his potential customers are satisfied with the quality of his products. He usually works with help from laborers who assist him with the final extraction of product. His point of sale is the local gathering centers and his daily routine starts at 7am and goes until 8pm. His future plan is to expand his agricultural production and for that he needs more farmland in order to produce al a large scale. This is his first loan with MFP and he promises to continue to repay on time. He also states that there is a cordial atmosphere in his communal bank. He will use the requested loan to buy manure and supplies to provide exhaustive maintenance to his cacao and banana plants.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure and supplies to care for his cacao and banana crops.

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es:
