La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Srta. Verónica; ella tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  venta de pantalones y cosméticos, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a las casas de diferentes clientes, ella le gustaría estudiar una carrera profesional y para eso tiene que ahorrar, la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender ropa para adultos y niños. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería como pantalones.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The partner is Miss Verónica, she is 26 years old and single. The partner works daily in her business selling trousers and cosmetics. She is independent taking her merchandise to the houses of different cudstomers. She would like to study a professional carreer and therefore she needs to save. The partner wants to have a store to sell clothes for adults and children. The partner requests a loan to buy merchandise such as trousers.

The partner is grateful to the people being part of her dream through this means and she is committed to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to purchase merchandise such as trousers.

loans.name: Basilia Yamilet

texts.es:
Basilia es una mujer dedicada  al trabajo, de oficio costurera  y venta de cosméticos, negocio el cual lo tiene en su casa, casada, siendo su esposo técnico de audio.
Anteriormente trabajaba en zona franca de operaria, el cual renuncia para comenzar hacer costura propia y lograr mejores ganancias, ya que en zona franca se trabaja mucho y el salario es bajo. 
Con los financiamientos que ha logrado en la institución ha aumentado la venta de productos Avon a si como hacer ropa nueva. El cual está contenta porque ha sido de mucho beneficios.
Hoy con este préstamo comprara telas variadas de colores, productos Avon y así seguir ofreciendo sus productos y lograr mejores venta.
Ya que ha sido de mucho beneficio el trabajar en casa y cuidar más de su esposo,  ya que no tiene hijo , y que espera a futuro ser madre.
texts.en:
Basilia is a lady dedicated to her works as a seamstress and saleswoman of cosmetics, business she manages from her home,she is married and her husband is an audio technician.

Previously she worked in the working zone, but she quit in order to set up her own workshop and increase profits as in the working zone work is much and salary is low.

With the loans from the institution she has increased her sales of Avon products as well as the business of new clothes. She is very happy with the many benefits.

With this loan she will buy material in a variety of colors and Avon products to continue offering her products and improve sales. It has been very beneficial working at home and taking care of her husband as she has no children but expects to be a mother in the future.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase material in a variety of colors and Avon products to increase sales and improve profits.

loans.name: Sadith Nicayla

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sadith Nicayla; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es madre soltera y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos en un paradero final de carros que hacen servicio público y en algunas oportunidades vende comida en las ferias que se realizan en la ciudad de Cusco, la socia quiere ampliar su negocio. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  productos para preparar los desayunos.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The partner belongs to the community bank "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco". The bank is located in the district of Wanchaq, in the province of Cusco and department of Cusco.

The partner is Mrs. Sadith Nicayla, she is 29 years old and a single mother of 1 son. Daily the partner sells breakfasts at a public bus station and eventually she sells food at the fairs in the town of Cusco as well. The partner would like to improve her business. She requests the loan to purchase products for the preparation of breakfasts.

The partner is grateful to the people being part of her dream through this means and she is committed to repay punctually.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: The partner requests the loan to purchase products for preparing breakfasts.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es: Ruth, de 38 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene cinco hijos en etapa escolar. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, específicamente en la ceja de la selva peruana, donde tienen su propio techo a base de adobe. Cuando ella visualizó las tiendas de abarrotes que tenían sus vecinas, anhela con tener uno igual, con el paso del tiempo lo logró, puesto que sus estudios se trucaron debido a la falta económica, por lo que solo se dedicaba en ayudar a sus padres en la chacra, a cambio le daba una propina para sus gastos personales.  Hoy, con una contenta, siente que ha cumplido uno de sus primeros objetivos, incluso cuenta con clientes que van a su establecimiento. Normalmente trabaja por cuenta propia, pero ocasiones recibe la ayuda de sus hijos y su pareja, su punto de venta lo realiza en su hermoso barrio de su propia localidad. Ella anhela en el futuro mejorar su tienda de abarrotes, con la finalidad de que le dé un formato distinto a la competencia, de esa manera cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está conforme con su banco comunal, ya que todos cumplen con sus compromisos de pago. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de mercaderías de primera necesidad, con el propósito de que esté surtido su tienda de abarrotes y así cumplir con las exigencias de sus clientes mas asiduos.
texts.en:
Ruth is 38 years old, she lives with her significant other and has five school-going children. Together they live in the locality of Santa Rosa, specifically on the edge of the Peruvian forest where they have their own adobe made house. When she visualized the general store of her neighbors, she wishes to own one herself and eventually she managed as she did not finish her studies due to economic problems and therefore she only helped her parents with the farm and in exchange they gave her a tip for her personal expenses. Today she is happy as she feels she has succeeded in the first objectives, she even has customers that go to her establishment. Normally she works on her own but ocasionally her children and partner help her. She sells from her beautiful neighborhood. It is her dream for the future to improve her grocery store so it gets a different presentation as the ones of the competition and that way meets the demands of her customers. This is her fifth loan with MFP and she promises to continue to repay punctullay, she is also happy with her community bank as everybody repays accordingly. With the loan requested she will invest in buying essential merchandise to supply her general store and thus meet the needs of her most regular customers.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase supplies for her store.

loans.name: Dativa De La Concepcion

texts.es:
Dativa tiene la edad de 56 años, mujer trabadora, casada, con dos hijos, hoy en día trabaja como técnico quirúrgico, desde hace treinta y cuatro años. Su esposo trabaja en construcción y ambos han logrado hacer la casa, mitad de concreto y mitad de madera.
Sus entradas económicas han sido su fuente de entrada, pues inicio estudiando un técnico, el cual aplico y hasta hoy ha dado sus servicios al pueblo. Como planes es poder poner una pulpería ya que entre poco llegara la jubilizacion y desea poder vender en su casa y así seguir apoyando a sus hijos.
Es su primer ciclo en Afodenic, en donde va invertir en mejoras de vivienda haciendo  un cuarto el cual comprara materiales de construcción como: piedra, arena, cemento, perlines,  zinc, soldadura, clavos, pintura entre otros para construir. Y hace lograr mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
Dativs is 56 years old, a working lady, married with two children. Presently she has been working as a surgical technician for thirty-four years. Her husband works in construction and both have succeeded in building the house, half concrete and half wood.

Their salary has been their source of income as she started to study for becoming a technician and now she offers her services in the village. Her plans are to set up a grocery store as she will retire shortly and wishes to be able to sell from her house and thus continue supporting her children.

It is her first loan with Afodenic, and she will invest in improving her dwelling, building a room and therefore she needs to buy building matieral such as rock, sand, cement, purlins, zinc, welding, nails, paint etc. for the construction, and thus improve the living conditions.,

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase rock, sand, cement, purlins, zinc,welding, nails, paint, etc.to improve her house.

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio pertenece al Banco Comunal Pureza hace 8 meses.
Rocio es soltera, tiene 26 años y 1 hijo, vive en casa alquilada, Rocio tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado, tiene 3 personas que le ayudan en la preparación y atención, actividad que realiza todos los días, negocio que inicio hace 2 años, además Rocio vende salchipapas en la noches.
Rocio necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de ollas y platos.
Los sueños de Rocio son implementar una polleria y abrir una sucursal en la provincia de Huanta.
texts.en:
Roció, 26, has been a member of the Pureza (Purity) communal bank for 8 months. She is single and has a son. She lives in a rented house. Roció has a restaurant in a rented locale. She has three employees that help prepare the food and provide customer service. She is open for business every day. She started the business 2 years ago. In addition, she sells Salchipapas (fried potatoes with fried sausages) at night. Roció needs a 1500 sol loan to buy pots and dishes. Her dream is to open up a poultry shop and a branch in Huanta province.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pots and dishes.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es: Rosa es casada y tiene 4 hijos que estudian, Rosa viaja los días sábados y domingos a la feria del Distrito de Tambo en donde vende frutas, canchas y de allá compra cereales que vende en el mercado de abastos de la ciudad de Ayacucho. Rosa tenia una tienda de lubricantes en local alquilado, negocio que dejo de realizar porque termino el contrato de local, pero aun sigue vendiendo sus productos a pedido, Rosa tiene proyectado construir un local propio para vender sus productos. Rosa solicita un préstamo de 900 soles para la compra de maíz y frutas.
texts.en:
Rosa is married and has 4 children. On Saturdays and Sundays she goes to the Tambo District market to sell fruit and corn nuts (roasted corn kernels). From there she brings back cereals to sell in Ayacucho’s wholesale foodstuffs market. Rosa used to have a vehicle lubricants store in a rented space but she left it when her rental contract for the location expired. However, she continues to sell these products by special order. Rosa plans to build her own structure to sell her products. She needs a 900 sol loan to buy corn and fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and fruit.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es: Sonia, de 27 años de edad, convive con su pareja y tiene una hija; Heyde de 7 años. Juntos residen en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tienen su propio techo a base de adobe. El negocio al que se dedica Sonia, es la venta de ladrillos, por el cual ella misma lo elabora, es un trabajo al que tuvo que esforzarse mucho para sacarlo adelante. Se siente contenta y satisfecha por el proyecto del cual inició, pues tiene mucha presencia en su localidad, debido a la calidad y durabilidad de sus ladrillos, incluso sus clientes mas recurrentes están conformes por el buen servicio y entrega eficiente que les brinda, además sus ventas aumentaron considerablemente con respecto a otros meses. Por lo general trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja y juntos hacen un buen equipo de trabajo, en ocasiones cuando tiene que aumentar su producción, es ese momento que contrata peones para que le pueda facilitar la elaboración de sus ladrillos. Su plan futuro es levantar su casa a base de material noble, con el propósito de que les brinde la seguridad y comodidad a su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además está contenta con su banco comunal, ya que todos están comprometidos con sus obligaciones de pago. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de materia prima e insumos, de esa manera lo facilite en la elaboración de sus ladrillos de forma artesanal.
texts.en:
Sonia, 27, lives with her life partner and their 7-year-old daughter, Hayde. They live in Santa Rosa where they have their own adobe house. Sonia’s business is selling bricks that she herself makes. This is a business that she had to work very hard to get ahead. She is happy and satisfied with the project she started because now she has quite a bit of presence in her area thanks to the quality and durability of her bricks. In fact, her most recurring customers are satisfied with the good service and efficient delivery she provides. Her sales increased significantly compared to other months. Usually she works with her partner and together they make a good working team. Sometimes, when she needs to increase production, she will hire laborers to facilitate brick making. Her future plan is to build her house out of more substantial materials in order to provide her family with more comfort and security. This is her 5th loan with MFP and she pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. She is happy with her communal bank because all the members are committed to pay on time. The requested funds will be used to buy raw materials and supplies that will make artisanal brick making easier.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw brick making raw materials.

loans.name: Ines

texts.es:
Ines es socia del Banco Comunal Pureza.
Ines es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Ines tiene un lavadero de carros en su casa, actividad que inicio hace 2 años, actividad que realiza todos los días. Ines sueña con tener una tienda de lubricantes, lo cual complementaria al negocio que ya tiene.
Ines necesita un préstamo de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de champú y escoba.
Ines sueña que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Inés is a member of the Pureza (Purity) communal bank. She’s married and has 6 children 5 of whom are in school. Inés has a carwash at home, a business she started two years ago. She is open for business every day. She dreams with owning a vehicle lubricant store which would complement her current business. Inés needs a 1000 sol loan to buy shampoo and a broom She dreams with her children becoming professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy shampoo and a broom.

loans.name: Teofilo

texts.es: Teofilo, de 40 años de edad, convive con su pareja y fruto de ellos, tienen tres hijos en etapa escolar. El vive en la localidad de Santa Rosa, donde tiene su propia casa a base de adobe. Teofilo asegura que el producto de cacao se ha convertido en los últimos años en un gran negocio, desde luego que está sacando el máximo provecho a sus plantaciones hasta llegó al punto de comprar productos de cacao de otros productores, con la finalidad de que pueda cumplir con sus compromisos de entrega para sus clientes. Por tal motivo, sus clientes se sienten en confianza, por el buen servicio que les otorga, además percibe buenas ganancias económicas, por lo que siente gran satisfacción por el negocio que realiza. Cada año va tomando presencia en su localidad, de esta manera trata de mejorar en cuanto a la cantidad y calidad de su producto. Normalmente trabaja conjuntamente con su pareja, pero en temporada de sembrío y cosecha necesita la ayuda de sus peones, con la finalidad de que recolecten el producto final. Su punto de venta lo realiza en los centros de acopio de su misma localidad y su rutina diaria es a partir de las 7:00 de la mañana hasta las 6:00 de la tarde. Mas adelante piensa mejorar su casa a base de material noble, con el propósito de brindarle estabilidad a su familia. Este es su quinto crédito con MFP, por el cual se compromete a seguir cumpliendo con su cronograma de pagos, además siente que llegará lo mas lejos posible con su banco comunal, ya que todos están conformen por el buen manejo de su grupo. Con el crédito que solicita lo piensa invertir en la compra de insumos y abono, con la necesidad de prevenir futuras enfermedades a sus plantaciones de cacao, de esa manera no perjudique su productividad.
texts.en:
Teófilo, 40, lives with his life partner; they have three school age children. They live in Santa Rosa in their own adobe house. Teófilo assures us that cacao production has become a very profitable enterprise in the last few years. He is getting the most profit out of his crops and even had to buy from other producers in order to fill all his orders. His customers trust him thanks to the good service he provides and he makes good profits so he is very satisfied with his work. Every year he becomes better positioned in his community and he constantly strives to improve both the quality and quantity of his product. He usually works alongside his partner but during planting and harvesting he needs help from laborers in order to bring in the final harvest. His sales point is the local gathering centers. He works daily from 7am until 6pm. Later on he plans to rebuild his house using substantial materials to provide more stability for his family. This is his 5th loan with MFP and he pledges to continue to repay in a timely fashion. He feels that he will get as far as possible with his communal bank because everyone is very satisfied with the group’s performance. The requested funds will be used to buy manure and supplies to prevent future plant illnesses in his crops so that productivity won’t be adversely affected.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy manure for his cacao crops.

loans.name: Yanet

texts.es:
Yanet es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella y lo que mas le agrada son las charlas de cómo invertir su dinero.
Yanet es conviviente, tiene 1 hijo de 7 años que estudia y vive en casa alquilada, Yanet tiene un restaurante en una avenida transitada, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda de 1 personal, además Yanet vende bebidas.
Yanet solicita un crédito de 1000 soles dinero que será invertido para la decoración del local y la compra de gaseosa.
Yanet sueña con tener una casa y otro restaurante.
texts.en:
Yanet is a member of the Anabella communal bank. What she likes most about it are the talks on how to invest your money. She has a live-in partner and a seven-year-old son who goes to school. She lives in a rented house. Yanet has a restaurant on a busy avenue. She is open for business every day and has one staff person. She also sells beverages. Yanet is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy soft drinks and to decorate the restaurant. She dreams with owning a house and having another restaurant.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To decorate the space and buy soft drinks.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa Amelia L. es socia del banco comunal La Inmaculada, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que  pertenece a la parroquia de Santa Ana, es de  clima frió típico de la región sierra, su población se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y mucha de su gente también trabaja realizando varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

Doña Rosa trabaja realizando los quehaceres domésticos, su horario es de ocho y media de la mañana hasta las cuatro y media de la tarde, de lunes a viernes laborando desde que tenía una muy corta edad ya que solo llego a cursar la escuela. También en su casa se dedica a la cría de animales pequeños como: cuyes, gallinas y chanchos los que vende cuando tiene alguna necesidad.

La Señora. Rosa tiene  33 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos de 12, 10, 8 y 6 años de edad, todos sus hijos estudian en la escuela, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su mamá.
 
Nuestra socia está en su tercer crédito, el dinero de su crédito lo va  a invertir en la compra de pollos y en su alimento.
 
Su meta es ofrecerles a sus hijos la mejor educación para que puedan llegar lejos.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rosa Amelia L. is a member of the La Inmaculada (Immaculate Conception) communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca which is part of Santa Ana parish. Its climate is cold, typical of the mountains. Most of its population raises animals and are farmers. Many of its residents work at various jobs in the city of Cuenca. Rosa works as a domestic employee from 8:30am until 4:30pm, Monday through Friday. She has worked since a very young age because she only went to primary school. She also raises small farm animals, like guinea pigs, chickens and pigs at home that she sells when needs arise. Rosa is 33 years old and a single mother of four children who are 12, 10, 8 and 6 years of age; all are in school. She does not own her own house; she lives in her mother’s house. This is her 3rd loan. She will use it to buy chickens and feed for them. Her goal is to provide her children with an education so they can go far in life.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy chickens and animal feed.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.es:
Gladys junto a su esposo se dedican a L. venta D. bebidas al por mayor y menor, su negocio esta ubicado en local alquilado, sus ventas los realiza en L. tienda y también reparte a negocios con un carro que adquirió hace 3 meses, antes repartía con carros alquilados.
Gladys es socia del Banco Comunal Confianza hace 1 año y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones y L. confianza entre las socias. Gladys es conviviente tiene 3 hijos D. 10, 7, 3 años. Su sueño es tener una distribuidora granD. y tener un local propio.
Gladys solicita un crédito D. 2500 soles para L. compra D. gaseosas y cerveza.
texts.en:
Gladys and her husband are beverage wholesalers and retailers. Their business is located in a rented space. They sell from the store and also deliver to other stores using a car she bought three months ago; she used to make her deliveries using leased cars. Gladys has been a member of the Confianza (Trust) communal bank for a year. What she likes best about it are the meetings and the trust that exists among the members. Gladys is partnered and they have three children who are 10, 7 and 3 years of age. Her dream is to have a large distributorship and to own her own locale. She is asking for a 2500 sol loan to buy soft drinks and beer.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soft drinks and beer.

loans.name: Maria Raquel

texts.es:
Maria es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella hace 4 años y lo que mas le agrada son las reuniones y los prestamos fáciles.
Maria es casada y tiene 6 hijos de los cuales 5 estudian, Maria tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en general, verduras, carnes, además Maria tiene cabinas de Internet en el mismo lugar, la administración de estos negocios los realiza sola. Además Maria prepara chocotejas que vende a pedido.
Maria necesita un préstamo de 1750 soles para la compra de arroz, azúcar.
Maria sueña con tener una bodega grande, ser mayorista y tener capital propio.
texts.en:
María has been a member of the Anabella communal bank for 4 years. What she likes best about it are the meetings and the fuss-free loans. She is married and has 6 children, 5 of whom are students. María has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries, vegetables and meats. In addition, she also has Internet access booths there. She runs both businesses by herself. She also makes "chocotejas" on order [A teja is a candy filled with "manjarblanco" (a sweet, white spread or pastry filling made with milk) and coated with a fondant-like shell. When this shell is made with chocolate, the candy is called chocoteja] María needs a 1750 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. She dreams with having a large store, with being a wholesaler, and with having her own capital.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 38 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su esposo José de 65 años, y de sus 5 hijos, de los cuales 3 ya son mayores e independientes. La vida para esta emprendedora mujer no ha sido fácil, pues desde que se casó muy joven debió cuidar de sus hijos, ahora que están grandes y ya no tiene mucha responsabilidad quiere instalar un negocio para salir adelante. Siempre le ha ayudado a trabajar a su conyugue, y por eso ahora quiere mandar a restaurar su casa y acondicionar una librería, pues por la zona donde vive no hay un negocio de ese rubro. Dice que el trabajo de su esposo, que tiene su taller de renovación de calzados, siempre les ha permitido tener una vida cómoda y brindarles una buena educación a sus hijos, por ello cree que con este nuevo negocio podrá darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida. Es el segundo crédito con MFP, y esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá empezar a concretar sus sueños. Juana  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la instalación de agua y desagüe en su casa, ya que no cuenta con este servicio; además también quiere acondicionar un ambiente para empezar con el negocio de librería, por lo que espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Juana, 38, lives in her own house with her husband, José, 65, and their five children, three of whom are independent adults. Life for this enterprising woman has not been easy because since marrying very young she has had to care for her children. Now that they are grown and she doesn’t have a lot of responsibilities she wants to open a business to get ahead. She has always helped her spouse work but now she wants to refurbish her house and set up a bookstore because in the area where she lives there are no similar businesses. She says that her husband’s work (he has a shoe repair shop) has always provided a comfortable life and a good education for their children so she feels that this new business will provide the family with a better quality of life. This is her second loan with MFP and she is very grateful to all the people who funded the loan that will make it possible to have her dream come true. Juana plans to use the requested funds to install running water and drainage in her house because it currently lacks then both. She also wants to equip a space in it to set up her bookstore with which she hopes to continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy supplies to install running water and drainage in her house as well as to equip a space to install her book store.

loans.name: Mery

texts.es:
Mery pertenece al Banco Comunal Anabella hace 10 años y lo que mas le agrada son las capacitaciones.
Mery es soltera, tiene 1 hija de 3 años que esta en el nido, Mery viaja a las ferias en donde vende abarrotes en general, además Mery vende ropa usada en la feria de San Juan los días domingos, la ropa lo adquiere en la ciudad de Lima.
Mery solicita un crédito de 1250 soles para la compra de ropa, arroz y azúcar.
Los sueños de Mery son comprar una casa porque actualmente vive en la casa de sus padres y que su hija sea profesional.
texts.en:
Mery has been a member of the Anabella communal bank for 10 years. What she enjoys most are the training workshops. Mery is single and has a 3 year old daughter who is in child care. Mery travels to the various markets to sell groceries. She also sells used clothes in the San Juan Market on Sundays. She brings the clothes from Lima. Mery is asking for a 1250 sol loan to buy clothes, rice and sugar. Mery’s dream is to buy a house because she currently lives in her parents’ house and that her daughter becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy clothes, rice and sugar.

loans.name: Donatilda

texts.es:
Donatilda es casada, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia, Donatilda tiene un restaurante en un local alquilado ubicado cerca del cementerio, actividad que realiza todos los días desde la mañana hasta la noche, además en el mismo local tiene su polleria, cuenta con el apoyo de 3 personas, también tiene otro pequeño restaurante en otro lugar que es administrado por su hija.
Dontilda es socia del Banco Comunal Anabella y solicita un crédito de 2000 soles para la compra de cerveza y gaseosa.
Donatilda vive en casa alquilada y su mayor sueño es comprar su casa y que el ultimo de sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Donatilda is married and has four children only one of whom is still in school. She has a restaurant in a rented locale near the cemetery. She is open daily from morning till night. She also has a poultry shop in the same locale. She has three staff persons that help her. She also has another small restaurant that her daughter runs. Donatilda is member of the Anabella communal bank and is asking for a 2000 sol loan to buy beer and soft drinks. Donatilda lives in a rented house and her greatest wish is to buy a house and that the youngest of her children becomes a professional.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy beer and soft drinks.

loans.name: Ker

texts.es: Ker, de 66 años, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía de su hijo mayor de edad y juntos habitan una amplia morada en un populoso barrio al norte de la ciudad. Este simpático caballero se dedica a la preparación de comida típica de la selva peruana en su restaurante, ubicado en el interior de su vivienda. Dice que aprendió desde muy joven a preparar estos deliciosos potajes de la selva del Perú, ya que ahí fue donde nació, y luego le ha transmitido sus conocimientos culinarios a su hijo, quien le ayuda en la atención del negocio. Recuerda como debió migrar a la ciudad, pues allá en su tierra no le iba muy bien, entonces decidió venir y ahora no se arrepiente, pues aunque extraña su tierra, en el negocio le va muy bien, pues las ganancias son regulares y junto con su hijo esta saliendo adelante. Como es un hombre bastante emprendedor para mas adelante tiene planeado ampliar más su negocio, para ofrecer mayor cantidad de platillos a sus comensales. Es el cuarto  crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, pues esta muy agradecida con todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Ker tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de cantidad de ingredientes que necesita para continuar preparando sus platillos de la selva.
texts.en:
Ker, 66, lives in his own house with his oldest son. They have an ample abode in a crowded neighborhood in the north of the city. This likable gentleman prepares typical dishes from the Peruvian jungle in his restaurant located inside his home. He says he learned how to prepare these delicious dishes from the Peruvian jungle, which is where he was born, while still very young. He has since transmitted his culinary knowledge to his son who helps him tend the business. He recalls how he had to migrate to the city because in his place of origin he wasn’t doing too well. He decided to come to the city and he does not regret it because, although he misses his homeland, he does well with his business because profits are steady and he and his son are getting ahead. Because he’s quite an enterprising man he plans to expand his business later on in order to offer a wider variety of dishes to his diners. This is his 4th loan with MFP and he pledges to repay in a timely fashion because he’s very grateful to all those how funded the loan that will allow him to continue in business. Ker plans to use the requested funds to buy quantities of the ingredients he needs to continue to prepare his dishes from the jungle.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients to prepare his typical stews.

loans.name: Musuq Rumi Group

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal Musuq Rumi que significa Nueva piedra en quechua inicia el ciclo 20 con 19 socias.
Como es el caso D. L. señora Esperanza que es socia hace algunos años y actualmente es presidenta D. su Banco Comunal, Esperanza fue presidenta en 3 oportunidades, es casada y tiene 3 hijos que estudian.
Esperanza venD. leña en su casa, negocio que realiza todos los días, L. leña lo compra D. los productores..
Esperanza solicita un préstamo D. 400 soles para L. compra D. leña.
Esperanza sueña con que sus hijos salgan adelante estudiando una profesión.
texts.en:
The Musuq Rumi, which means New Stone in Quechua, communal bank is starting its 20th cycle with 19 members. Esperanza has been a member for several years and now is the group President. She has been President on three occasions. She’s married and has three children who are in school. Esperanza sells firewood at home every day; she buys the firewood from producers. She is asking for a 400 sol loan to buy firewood. Esperanza dreams that her children get ahead studying a profession.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy firewood.

loans.name: Martha Adriana

texts.es:
La Señora. Martha Adriana L. es socia del banco comunal La Inmaculada, vive en la comunidad de Ingapirca que pertenece a la parroquia  Santa Ana, es de  clima frió típico de la región sierra, su población se dedican en su mayor parte a la cría de animales y a la agricultura y mucha de su gente también trabaja realizando varias actividades en la ciudad de Cuenca.

La Señora Martha es muy joven tiene 21 años, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 4 y 3 años de edad, su esposo labora como chofer de un camión, los dos realizan su mayor esfuerzo  ya que se encuentran construyendo  su casa.

Doña Martha se dedica a la limpieza de hogares, trabaja de lunes a viernes, no tiene un horario fijo y lleva realizando esta actividad hace 2 años, en su casa se dedica a la cría de pollos, chanchos y cuyes.
 
Es socia de la banca comunal, los créditos le han beneficiado en su negocio, su nuevo crédito lo va a utilizar en la compra de materiales para la construcción de su casa como: cemento, arena, etc.

Su meta es terminar su casa y ponerse una tienda en ella.
texts.en:
Mrs. Martha Adriana L. is a member of the La Inmaculada (Immaculate Conception) communal bank. She lives in Ingapirca which is part of Santa Ana parish. Its climate is cold, typical of the mountains. Most of the population is into farming and animal raising. Many of its residents work a variety of jobs in the city of Cuenca. Martha, 21, is very young. She’s married and has 2 children who are 4 and 3 years of age. Her husband is a truck driver. Both work hard because they are building their house. Martha works cleaning houses. She works Monday to Friday. She doesn’t have a fixed work schedule and has been in this line of work for 2 years. At home she raises chickens, pigs and guinea pigs. She is a member of the communal bank. The loans have benefited her business. The new loan will be used to buy building materials and supplies for her house construction like: cement, sand, etc. Her goal is to finish building her house and installing a store in it.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sand, iron rods, cement, etc.

loans.name: Santos

texts.es: Santos, de 49 años, vive en su casa que es propia a lado de su esposa Cerila de 44 años, y de sus 3 hijos de los cuales 2 son mayores. Desde hace 4 años se dedica a brindar el servicio de transporte en una combi, negocio en el cual labora a lado de su hijo mayor. Es así que ambos, realizan un mejor servicio de transporte, en donde a veces se turnan, él maneja y su hijo cobra, o al revés. Manifiesta que le va muy bien pues las ganancias les permiten tener una vida cómoda, aunque es un poco tedioso manejar durante casi todo los días, y eso es estresante, pero sabe que solo con el trabajo constante saldrá adelante, además se entretiene. La combi, que es su herramienta de trabajo aún no es de su propiedad, pues un familiar que viajó al extranjero se la vendió, y desde entonces la paga por partes. Como es un hombre muy trabajador para más adelante tiene planeado instalar un negocio que le permita descansar un poco y pasar  más tiempo en su hogar. Es el quinto  crédito con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente ya que no quiere decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Santos tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de 4 llantas para cambiar las que tiene su combi pues están algo  deterioradas, de esta manera espera brindar un mejor servicio.
texts.en:
Santos is 49 years old and lives in his own home with his wife Cerila, age 44, and their three children, two of whom are adults. For the past four years he has been providing transportation services using a minibus. He manages this business with his oldest son. Both of them work together to provide better service. They take turns driving and collecting bus fare. Santos says his business is doing well and the earnings have allowed him to have a comfortable life. However, it is a little bit tedious to be driving almost every day. Even though the work can be stressful, he knows that this is the only way for him to get ahead so he keeps himself entertained. Santos did not originally own the minibus he uses for work. It belonged to a relative who traveled abroad, but was later sold to Santos. Since then, he pays to have the parts replaced. Being a hardworking gentleman who wants to get ahead even further, Santos plans to open a business that will allow him to relax and spend more time at home.

This is his fifth loan with MFP. Santos promises to complete his payments on time because he does not want to disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that he could continue working. He plans to invest this loan in the purchase of four tires to replace the ones on his minibus that are already worn. This will enable him to provide better service.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase four tires

loans.name: Betty

texts.es: Betty, de 32 años, vive en la casa de sus padres en compañía de ellos y de su esposo José de 28 años y de su pequeña hija Abril de 3 años. Esta emprendedora mujer trabaja desde muy joven, cada día se despierta con muchos ánimos de salir adelante. Es así que desde hace 5 años se dedica a la venta ambulatoria de diversos productos para el hogar, como cubrecamas, platos, utensilios de cocina, jarrones, entre otros. Realiza su labor sola, dejando un día, durante las mañanas y tardes, pues no descuida la crianza de su hijo, pero lo que no le gusta es caminar, durante varias horas en busca de clientes, por el centro de la ciudad, que es el lugar por donde trabaja. Pero esta muy satisfecha porque obtiene regulares ganancias que le permiten ayudar a su esposo en los diversos gastos del hogar. Y como es una mujer muy emprendedora para mas adelante tiene planeado instalar un bazar donde pueda ofrecer sus productos con mayor tranquilidad. Es el segundo crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que no quiere atrasarse y decepcionar a todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero que le permitirá continuar trabajando en busca del progreso.  Betty tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de mayor cantidad de mercadería para ofrecer variedad a su clientela a precios cómodos, de esta manera espera continuar adelante.
texts.en:
Betty is 32 years old and lives at her parents’ house with her husband José, age 28, and their three year old daughter Abril. She has been a hard worker ever since she was a young woman. Each day she wakes up with great optimism to get ahead. For the past five years she has been selling different household products as a street vendor. Betty offers bedspreads, dishes, cookware, vases, and other items. She works by herself in the mornings and evenings so that she does not neglect the care of her daughter. However, she does not like walking around for several hours looking for customers within the central part of the city where she works. Betty is very pleased because she generates a steady income that allows her to help her husband with the various household expenses. Since she is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead even further, Betty plans to open a bazaar where she can offer her merchandise in a more peaceful environment.

This is her second loan with MFP. Betty promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to fall behind and disappoint everyone who made this loan possible so that she can continue working and making progress. She plans to invest this loan in a larger quantity of merchandise so that she can offer variety to her customers at affordable prices. In this manner, she hopes to continue moving forward.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of household products

loans.name: Dolores

texts.es: Dolores, vive en su casa que es propia en compañía D. su madre, D. su hijo mayor, su nuera y su nieta, todos muy unidos habitan en un populoso barrio al norte D. la ciudad. DesD. hace 1 año esta emprendedora mujer se dedica a la venta D. mueble D. madera como estantes, vitrinas, camas, y esta ubicado en la parte D. afuera D. su casa. Dice que se le ocurrió instalar este negocio, pues la zona por donD. vive es muy comercial en este rubro, lo que le ha permitido captar buenos clientes en poco tiempo. Le gusta mucho su trabajo, pues lo considera tranquilo y rentable, porque aunque atienD. sola cuenta con la ayuda D. su hijo o nuera. Cada vez tiene mayor variedad D. muebles que ofrecer a su clientela que la visita con frecuencia, por el buen acabado y calidad D. su mercadería. Además como es una mujer emprendedora que tiene muchos planes en mente, para más adelante quiere ampliar y acondicionar un ambiente D.  su casa para tener mayor espacio, D. esta manera espera ofrecer más cantidad D. muebles. Es el noveno crédito que tiene con MFP, y promete pagar sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere defraudar la confianza que depositaron en ella todas las personas que hicieron posible el dinero  que le permitirá continuar trabajando. Dolores tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra D. mayor cantidad D. juegos D. mesas y sillas, ya que tiene varios pedidos por cumplir, y así calcula que  obtendrá mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Dolores lives in her own home with her mother, her oldest son, her daughter-in-law, and her granddaughter. They resiD. together in a very crowded neighborhood located north of the city. For the past year this enterprising woman has been selling wooden furniture such as shelving, cabinets, and beds. Her business is located just outsiD. of her house. Dolores says that since starting her business, the area where she lives has experienced more commercial activity, which has allowed her to attract good customers over time. She greatly enjoys her work because it is peaceful and profitable. Dolores manages the business by herself, but she also has the help of her son and daughter-in-law. She always has a wiD. variety of furniture to offer to her customers who visit her frequently. The merchandise she sells is of good workmanship and high quality. Being an enterprising woman, Dolores has many plans in mind. Later on she wants to expand and equip her house so that she can have more space in hopes of offering more furniture.

This is her ninth loan with MFP. Dolores promises to complete her payments on time because she does not want to lose the trust of everyone who maD. this loan possible so that she can continue working. She has plans to invest the funds in the purchase of a large quantity of dining sets (tables and chairs) since she has several orders to fulfill. This will allow her to generate better earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Ronan Reodica, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase dining sets (tables & chairs) to complete her customers' orders

loans.name: Ursula

texts.es:
Ursula tiene 49 años D. edad, es separada desD. hace 10 años y vive junto a sus hijos en el sector Guaraguaos, una zona rural del distrito D. TambogranD., un distrito agrícola caracterizado por dedicarse principalmente al cultivo D. frutas, las cuales son procesadas para exportarlas. El distrito pertenece a la provincia D. Piura y se encuentra ubicado en la región del mismo nombre, a mas D. tres horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital D. la región Lambayeque.

La necesidad D. sacar adelante a su familia hizo que empezara un negocio D. venta D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes que se encuentra instalado en su propio domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus vecinos todo tipo D. productos D. uso diario por los cuales tendrían que dirigirse hacia el pueblo D. TambogranD. para adquirirlos. Adicionalmente cría y venD. ganado ovino y aves D. corral para venderlas a los negociantes que frecuentan la zona en donD. vive.

Ursula se esfuerza diariamente para sacar adelante a su familia, por ello siempre se esfuerza en brindarles a sus clientes productos D. calidad y un buen trato. Sus esfuerzos están dando resultados y su clientela aumenta cada vez mas. Para satisfacer la creciente demanda por su negocio ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en la compra D. productos para ampliar su negocio.

Ursula es una mujer trabajadora, diariamente se esfuerza por sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. En la zona donD. vive sus vecinos y conocidos le consideran una mujer tranquila y responsable.
texts.en:
Ursula is 49 years old, has been separated for 10 years and lives with her children in Guaraguaos, a rural zone in the district of TambogranD., an agricultural area known for growing fruits for exportation. The district belongs to the province of Piura and is located in the region of Piura, more than three hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Ursula began her business selling basic goods and groceries in order to help her family get ahead. The business is located in her home. Ursula offers her neighbors all types of daily use products which they would ordinarily have to travel to the town of TambogranD. to get. She also raises and sells sheep and poultry to sell to businessmen that are present in the area where she lives. Ursula makes an effort each day to help her family get ahead. For this reason, she also makes an effort to offer her clients high quality products and good service. Her efforts are bringing results and her clientele is increasing more and more. To satisfy the growing demand, she is requesting a loan of 1000 PEN for the first time from Edpyme Alternativa to invest in buying products to expand her business. Ursula is a hardworking woman. Each day she makes an effort to help her children get ahead and to offer them a better quality of life. In the area where she lives, her neighbors and acquaintances consider her to be a calm and responsible woman.

Translated from Spanish by Anne Rodriguez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy basic goods to expand her business

loans.name: Felicitas

texts.es:
Felicitas es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 2 años y lo que mas le agrada son los prestamos fáciles y el incentivo al ahorro.
Felicitas es casada tiene 5 hijos que estudian, Felicitas se dedica a la crianza de animales en su casa como gallina, cuy y lo vende en su misma casa porque ya tiene clientes. Además viaja a las ferias los días sábados en donde compra quesos y cereales. Felicitas también trabaja por las mañanas cuidando una huerta de flores.
Felicitas necesita un préstamo de 1500 soles para la compra de cerdo y gallinas.
Felicitas sueña con que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Felicitas has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, communal bank for two years. What she enjoys most about it are the fuss-free loans and the savings incentives. Felicitas is married and has five children who are in school. She raises small farm animals, like chickens and guinea pigs, at home. She sells them directly from home because she already has customers. She also travels to markets on Saturdays where she buys cheeses and cereals. During the mornings, Felicitas works caring for a flower orchard. She needs a 1500 sol loan to buy a pig and chickens. She dreams with her children becoming professionals and with improving her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a pig and chickens.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria luz es casada y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la universidad, Maria luz tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende abarrotes en  general, verduras, negocio que inicio hace 3 años y realiza con la ayuda de su hija. Además Maria luz trabaja en un hotel haciendo limpieza por las mañanas.
Maria luz es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua y lo que mas le agrada son las charlas sobre familia. Maria luz solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Maria luz sueña con tener una tienda grande en el centro de la ciudad y construir su casa de material noble porque actualmente su casa es de material rustico.
texts.en:
María Luz is married and has two children who are university students. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells assorted groceries and vegetables. She started the business three years ago and her daughter helps her tend to it. In addition, she is employed at a hotel as a cleaning lady during the mornings. María Luz is a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua. What she enjoys most are the chats on the family. María Luz is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy rice and sugar. She dreams with having a large store downtown and with building her house out of substantial materials because it’s currently made of flimsy materials.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar.

loans.name: Silvia Juana

texts.es:
Silvia es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 10 años y lo que mas le agrada son la facilidad de prestamos y el incentivo del ahorro, Silvia con sus ahorros techo su casa y ahora sigue construyendo su casa.
Silvia es separada y tiene 1 hijo que estudia, Silvia compra cereales en el mercado que luego los procesa en su casa y luego lo vende en los mercados de la ciudad. Además los días domingos compra animales que luego comercializa.
Silvia necesita un préstamo de 1200 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de cerdos y cereales.
Los sueños de Silvia son terminar de construir su casa porque ahora vive en la casa de sus suegros.
texts.en:
Silvia has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, communal bank for 10 years. What she enjoys most are the loans and savings incentives. Silvia was able to roof her house with her savings and she is continuing to build her house. Silvia is separated and has a son in school. She buys cereals in the market that she processes at home for later resale in the city’s markets. On Sundays she buys animals that she later resells. Silvia needs a 1200 sol loan to buy pigs and cereals. Her dream is to finish building her house because she currently lives with her in-laws.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pigs and cereals.

loans.name: Catalina

texts.es:
Catalina es socia del Banco Comunal Ccori Ayllu que significa Familia de Oro en quechua hace 14 años y lo que mas le gusta son las capacitaciones y el incentivo al ahorro.
Catalina es conviviente, tiene 3 hijos que estudia, Catalina tiene una tienda en su casa en donde vende verduras, abarrotes en general, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda eventual de su hija.
Catalina solicita un préstamo de 1000 soles para la compra de azúcar, arroz, fideo y leche.
Los sueños de Catalina son que sus hijos sean profesionales y mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Catalina has been a member of the Ccori Ayllu, which means Golden Family in Quechua, for 14 years. What she enjoys most are the training workshops and the savings incentives. Catalina lives with her life partner and she has three children in school. She has a grocery store in her house where she sells vegetables, fruits and assorted groceries every day with occasional help from her daughter. Catalina is asking for a 1000 sol loan to buy sugar, rice, pasta and milk. Her dreams are that her children become professional and to improve her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, pasta and milk.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es:
Guillermo es un padre de familia de 35 años de edad que vive junto a su esposa y a sus dos hijos en el sector Los Higos, una zona rural ubicada en la carretera en San José, un distrito pesquero que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicado a veinte minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace diez años a brindar transporte de carga en un camión. El ofrece sus servicios a sus vecinos agricultores los cuales acuden a el cada vez que necesitan llevar los productos que cosechan a venta. Adicionalmente se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores y aves de corral. Con estas dos actividades se encarga de solventar los gastos de su familia y sacarlos adelante.

Guillermo se encuentra solicitando por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1700 nuevos soles que piensa invertir en el mantenimiento y reparación de su vehículo asimismo en la compra de mas animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversion el piensa ampliar sus negocios para percibir mas ingresos y poder brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.

Guillermo es bastante conocido y estimado en la zona donde vive, sus vecinos le consideran alguien responsable y tranquilo. Su mayor anhelo es ofrecerle a sus hijos la oportunidad de estudiar alguna carrera superior que les garantice un futuro estable.
texts.en:
Guillermo, 35, is a father living with his wife and two children in Los Higos, a rural area along the San José highway. This is a fishing area that is part of Lambayeque province located twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo. For the last 10 years he has provided cargo transportation services in a truck. He offers his services to area farmers who call on him every time they need to move their harvests to market. In addition, he also raises small farm animals and barnyard fowl for sale. These two activities make it possible for him to support his family and get them ahead. Guillermo is asking Edpyme Alternativa for his first, 1700 new sol, loan to invest in vehicle repair and maintenance as well as in the purchase of more animals and feed for them. This investment will expand his business so that he can earn more and provide his family with improved quality of life. Guillermo is quite well known and esteemed in his area. His neighbors consider him to be responsible and level headed. His greatest wish is to offer his children the opportunity to study a career that will guarantee a stable future.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For truck repair and maintenance.

loans.name: Bayarjargal

texts.en: Bayarjargal G., a 41-year-old divorced woman, lives with her three children in their own ger (a traditional nomadic housing tent) in Ulaanbaatar, Mongolia’s capital city. Her middle daughter, Azzaya, attends a university and her youngest daughter studies at a secondary school. Her oldest, a son, works as a dancer for a government organization. Bayarjargal operates a retail clothing business. She began her business in 2003 and operates it out of a stall in Narantuul, Ulaanbaatar’s largest outdoor market. She imports new clothes from Erlian, a border city of China, and from Beejin, China's capital city, once a month. Her business is a popular spot in the market. Bayarjargal plans to expand her business by increasing her working capital for the peak season for sales. She hopes to renovate her house using her business earnings. Bayarjargal is requesting a 2,135,000 tugrik loan to buy more clothes and grow her working capital.

loans.use: To buy more clothes

loans.name: Mela

texts.en: Mela P. owns and operates a sari-sari (variety retail shop) selling both food and daily use products in her community. She is 45 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Kalawaig, Banisilan, Cotabato. Mela has been in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 10,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) a month. In 2009, Mela joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Mela has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI which was used to purchase products to sell. Mela is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. This will be her third loan from HSPFI. She plans to use additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao. Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory and for working capital

loans.name: Emerita's Group

texts.en:
Emerita E. is from the village of Poblacion, Sibutad. She is 57 years old and the group leader of a two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults.

loans.name: Najma

texts.en:
Najma belongs to a small city called Raiwind which is famous for its dairy and agriculture industries. She is 29 years old and married. She has given birth to four-year-old Adiba and one-year-old Mariam, both of whom are very young and have not started to attend school yet. 

Najma is a very hardworking and caring lady. She takes care of her family and manages the household chores. She also handles her clothes sewing business after doing the household chores. She sews clothes for her neighbors. She is good at her work and gets regular orders. She does this work to financially support her family. 

She is married to A. R., who is 34 years old and operates a laundry business in the market. He is renting a shop for that purpose. He has been operating this business for the last ten years. He also sells washing items such as bleach powder, Surf detergents and washing soaps in his shop and also uses them to wash the clothes in his laundry.
 
Naima has applied for a loan from Asasah for her husband’s business. With the loan money her husband will buy the above mentioned laundry items for his laundry shop. Najma has confidence in her husband that he will be able to successfully upgrade his business by making positive use of the loan money. 
She is a regular Asasah loan user and has maintained a good credit record. This is her 4th loan application.

loans.use: Purchase washing items for laundry shop

loans.name: Le

texts.en:
Le L., 54 years old, owns a small shop next to her house along a big road where she sells porridge to people who eat it for breakfast. She typically makes around $2 in profit each day to ensure that her family has a comfortable life. She was married but her husband died of senility. She has four children, all of whom are married and help carry the responsibility for family by working at different occupations. 

Le L. is running her business well because she has skills in public relations which she uses with her customers. However, her income is not very much as her business has reached a low point due to insufficient financial capital. Le L. wishes to have more funds to increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits. This is why she has decided to look for lenders on Kiva.

loans.use: To increase her capital which will allow her to improve her profits.

She has been engaged in her job since 2000 and has a steady salary. She has a life partner in her husband who works as a construction foreman. The couple helps each other to earn money to feed their three kids. All three of the kids are attending school. 

Chin C. also buys clothes that are not export quality from her garment factory to resell in her community. In order to generate additional income for the family, Chin C. is taking out her loan as capital to buy a larger quantity of clothes from the garment industry to resell, which will allow her to improve her profit.

loans.name: Kuljamal

texts.en:
Kuljamal Z. lives in Kok-Tokoy village in the northern region of Kyrgyzstan.  She is 42 years old, married, and has three children. After graduating from medical college in the capital city, she worked in the local hospital.  Her open-hearted personality and attentive attitude to patients helped her to acquire an excellent reputation as a medic.  As salaries in rural areas are low,  people need to find an additional means to lift themselves from the poverty level. For this reason, Kuljamal and her family started their own business in cattle breeding. At present, the farm has 13 sheep and one milch cow.  Kuljamal is also engaged in cultivating apples, pears, raspberries, and currants, all of which were planted 15 years ago.  Today her family works hard to get a good harvest.  These activities allowed Kuljamal to improve her household, but she still needs a loan of 60,000 KGS to buy 10 sheep and one colt. Revenues from this loan will allow Kuljamal to send her children to the capital city of Bishkek in order to get a good education.  

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas leading to increased employment and meeting the needs of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Komiljon

texts.en: H. Komiljon is 35 years old. He has a successful business selling flour at the local market of Penjikent town. Komiljon sells an assortment of good quality and different sorts. Because he buys his goods at wholesale, the price of them is cheaper than the price of his competitors. Thus he has many customers who even make a purchase of his products straight from his house. Today he has a great demand for his goods and that is why he wants to take an individual loan. Komiljon has requested a loan of 7,000 Somoni to add to his working capital and allow him to purchase more inventory. He is ready to work even harder, make sacrifices and push every once in awhile to achieve his goal and become a successful entrepreneur. We believe his perseverance and clear vision will become key factors in the success of his small business. More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium B.C. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. loans.name: Moses

texts.en:
Moses is a married man with one child who is still too young for school. He has been operating a public motor vehicle business for over a year.  His customers are the entire public who uses public transport means. Moses faces major challenges during police crackdown. He hopes to own another motor vehicle in the future.

With the 20,000 KES he wants to open a shop for his wife, purchase wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar.

His major aim of working with Yehu is because it provides sustainable financial services. He rents a house with electricity but no piped water. His greatest monthly expense is food.

loans.name: Tohirboy

texts.en:
K. Tohirboy has worked for many years in the difficult business of raising cattle. He is an exemplary husband in that he always tries his hardest to provide food for his wife and two children in their home. After purchasing his cattle, Iskandar provides them with all the right conditions for their growth: taking care of their food and protection and making sure they don’t get lost. Once they’re fully mature, Iskandar sells them in his area and also provides their milk for sale. 

Currently he needs to purchase cattle to raise and for this reason is turning to IMON International to obtain a loan of $1,000. Iskandar thanks KIVA for the support that KIVA presents to small entrepreneurs.   

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Tajikistan is known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road and the end of Alexander the Great's rule. It has also produced great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets, including Rudaki, Avicenna, Ferdowsi, Omar Khayyam, Jomi, and Rumi. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions.

But Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty.

IMON's History

Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. 

To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.name: Kisakye Women's Group-Mukono

texts.en:
N. Robinah belongs to the Kisakye Women’s Group-Mukono. She is 42 years old, hard working, happily married and blessed with five buoyant children. Taking her family responsibilities in stride, Robinah has for the last 18 years been under the financial auspices of her boutique business in Mpunge-Mukono. This above mentioned coupled with her diary farming enterprise has been her family’s dependable means of livelihood.

She set forth on this business with pep talk ideas from a close friend. Robinah was, prior to this, involved in a fishing business that in retrospect she says gave her some of the financial backup to start up this business.  In a week, Robinah says she can make up to $31. 

The experienced stock in trade, she says she has banked on to achieve longevity in this business, has been her exceptional customer care skills and her high spirited entrepreneurial efficacy. Robinah says her major challenge in the course of doing her business has been the lack of sufficient capital to buy more new clothes to resell in her boutique. This, she says, has in many respects affected the growth of her business. She reckons with this loan she will be able to buy more new clothes to resell and as a result make more profit.

loans.use: The purchase of more new clothes to resell at her bontique

loans.name: Umedjon

texts.en:
F. Umedjon is 33 years old, married, and has three children. All of his life he has devoted to agricultural work, and on market days he brings his products to the market. For Umedjon the harvest is what he enjoys the most and he devotes a lot of time to sorting wheat, onions, watermelon and rice. 

Agriculture is full of satisfaction for him and his family, even more when they sell for a good price at the market. That is the motivation to continue planting. At the same time Umedjon raises cattle. 

This is the 9th loan that Umedjon has with IMON International, making his payments on time. He is very grateful to those who support him, because they allow him to provide well-being to his family. With the money requested, Umedjon will buy seeds, fertilizer, fuels and lubricants, and also cattle.

Thanks to his parents Kamol now has the opportunity to move forward as a farmer and  hopes to increase his agricultural products so that he can provide his loved ones a more promising life. Despite being a good agriculturalist and worker he needs help to move forward and improve his production. This is why he is asking for a loan, so that he can buy more of the seeds and fertilizers he needs, which are very expensive. Without them his production will not improve. You can help Kamol keep moving forward with his development plans.

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Nsasa Development Group-Mukono

texts.en:
L. Derrick, 62, began his dairy farming business in Nsasa-Mukono with much motivation plus help from friends and family. This smile-up-his-sleeve gentleman has a sparky sense of humor, which has struck a chord with many of his customers. His milk is in high favor with many people in his locality
Derrick belongs to Nsasa development group in Mukono. He is a happily married man with nine children. Only one of his children is in school as the majority of his children have chosen to follow him into business. Derrick makes as much as 49,000 UGX per week. With this loan he is anticipating buying cattle feed. He was a government employee before venturing into business, and is a very hardworking and determined man.

loans.use: To purchase more cattle feed

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en:
Mr. Vorn P. is 60 years old and his wife, Mrs. Yorn Yang, is 48 years old. They have been married since 1991 and have two children – a son and a daughter, both of whom are garment factory workers. The family lives in a Phnom Penh suburb. 
Vorn has been a rice farmer for 30 years. His wife sells Akor (a kind of small cupcake, made of sticky rice, coconut cream and sugar cooked in steam) in her village and the nearby village.
Vorn is requesting his first loan of $900 to purchase a motorbike for commuting and a cow to raise and use on his farm.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for commuting and a cow to raise

loans.name: Khanga Group

texts.en:
Havinitishi N., who is in her middle thirties, is married with two sons and two daughters. She has been running a grocery business selling beer, soda and water for two years. She works from 4 p.m. to 12 p.m. and is able to earn a monthly profit of about $92.

This will be Havinitishi’s 3rd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She has successfully paid back her previous loans which she used to increase her stock and bought empty beer crates and chairs.

Havinitishi hopes for this loan so that she can buy a TV and also start selling spirits. Her dream is to buy a car that she can use to carry her grocery products.

Havinitishi will share this loan with her loan group, Khanga, which totals fifteen members. The members of the group hold each other accountable in paying back the loan.

In the photo, Havinitishi is at the back, second from the right.

loans.use: To buy a TV and start selling spirits

loans.name: Nyamutaba 1 Twimutsyane, Ntungamo Group

texts.en:
B. Bernard is a determined and hardworking married father of eight children. He has been operating a local-brew sales business for over twenty-three years in Nyamutaba Trading centre, Ntungamo.

Bernard says he began his business from the small savings he got from group savings that he made in the past with friends. This helped him to begin his first sales of the local brew commonly known as waragi here in Uganda.

Bernard describes his customers as good ones who give him a ready market for his local brew. He sells to bar owners in the area, earning him 320,000 Ugandan shillings.

Bernard is currently faced with the big challenge of finding transport as he looks at ways of supplying an expanded market. Therefore, his motive in requesting this loan is to use it to assist in the purchase of transportation means like a motorcycle or pickup truck for his business so as to improve his sales revenue.

loans.use: To contribute towards the purchase of a vehicle for his business

loans.name: Oliva

texts.en:
Oliva is 34 years old and is married with three children. She owns a restaurant where she sells tea as well as some pastries. She has been in this business for about five years and her business hours are from the morning hours until late in the evening.

Although Oliva has been in this business for about five years, her capital is still too low to expand her business meaningfully. To solve this problem, she is requesting a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company s.a. With the use of this loan, she will hopefully earn more profits which, in turn, will be used for better reinvestment in the future.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida lives in a small city called Riwind, which is located near Lahore and famous for its dairy and farming industries. She is 45 years old and has lived in this area for the last 22 years. She is married to M. H., who is 53 years old and is in the business of selling rice and wheat. 

Farida is a housewife who also owns a buffalo and sells its milk to people who live in her community. She has been in this line of work for the last eight years.

Farida and her husband have seven children, four sons and three daughters, Only four are in school, in part because her older children had to leave school at an early age to support the family financially. Her oldest son is a rickshaw driver and one of her younger sons works in a small hotel in Lahore, where he lives during the work week. Her oldest daughter does embroidery work, taking orders from clients who live nearby. 

Farida has applied for a loan from Asasah to expand her milk-selling business. She plans to use the money to buy another buffalo, which will give her more milk to sell to her clients. She has taken out five previous loans from Asasah and repaid each on time She has also never missed a meeting called by our organization.

loans.use: To buy a buffalo in order to sell its milk in local markets

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 30 years old and is married with 3 children who are 5, 7 and 9 years old. Judith is well-known in the business of selling secondhand clothes in Nyabugogo market. She has been in this business for about ten years and the business hours are from 7 a.m. to 6 p.m. every day.

Judith needs a Kiva loan via Vision Finance Company to purchase different styles of secondhand clothes which will hopefully increase her sales as well as her profits. With these profits, she will keep reinvesting in the same business for better financial stability in the future. In addition to that, she will be able to continue taking care of her children.

loans.use: To purchase diffferent styles of clothes to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
The Kiva borrower is a 25-year-old single man living with his 2 parents. He is an experienced furniture painter with almost 8 years in the business. He’s a new business owner, and has owned his shop since 2009. He works upon request of his customers and also in collaboration with some galleries. He has already received his first kiva loan and he’s very thankful for the results. 

This borrower is the main provider for with parents. His story illustrates the day-to-day challenges many people are facing in trying to take care of household expenses, sick and aging family members while at the same time running a business. Today, he is asking for a loan of $2000 to purchase new tools for his business. In the future, he would like to expand his business and open his own gallery shop.

loans.use: To purchase new tools
