loans.name: Grigor

texts.en: Grigor M. has been managing a trading business since February 2010. He rents a stall at one of the city markets, where he sells women’s and children’s clothing. His wife is a big help in their family business, taking care of it when he is away. Grigor applied for this loan to travel to a neighbouring country to purchase clothing.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is 38 years old and married.  She sells clothes for a living.  She has been in the business for three years, and sees herself owning a wholesale boutique in the future.  She is a member of Rohi, a self-help group registered with Faulu Kenya.  Since she joined the group, her business has really grown.  She has had two previous loans from Faulu Kenya, which were guaranteed by her fellow group members.   She has requested another loan of 80, 000 KES, which she will use to buy dresses, sweaters and skirts.  She hopes to open other outlets for her business in the future.  She describes herself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: to buy dresses, sweaters and skirts for resale

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is 31 years old and married. He sells clothes to earn a living. He is a member of a self-help group called Rohi in Faulu Kenya. He says that his  living standard has improved since he joined Faulu Kenya. So far, he has serviced two loans from Faulu Kenya. He has requested a loan of 50,000 KES, which he will use to buy ladies tops, trousers, skirts, and shirts. He hopes to open a wholesale boutique in five years. He describes himself as hardworking and determined.

loans.use: To buy ladies tops, trousers, skirts, and shirts

loans.name: Karen

texts.en: Karen T. has been in the trading business since 2004. He rents a stall at one of the city markets, selling shoes and sneakers. Karen has applied for this loan to purchase a stock of new shoes.

loans.use: Purchasing new stock

loans.name: Sama

texts.en:
E. was born in 1966. She is married to Sama Aron, and they are blessed with five children. She shares five rooms with her five children and her husband in Musang, a quarter in Bamenda, in the North-West Region of Cameroon.

E. has had great difficulties in life, ranging from ill-health, failure to attain quality education, and inadequate capital to expand her business. Amongst other challenges, she needs more capital to be able to pull ahead with her projects. With this loan, she plans to buy yams seeds, day-old chicks, and piglets, which she will keep and will later on sell to make more profit from them. She thinks her business is an influential one, and she has succeeded over the past years. She, as well, regularly undertakes contracts. The loan will help her community because they will be able to afford good yams, chickens, and pigs for affordable prices.

She will plough her profit back into her business and use part to care for her family. She will use a fraction of the profit to pay for her children's education and upgrade her standard of living. She  prefers GHAPE because of the training she frequently receives, the follow-up, and the low cost of obtaining and paying back a loan.

About GHAPE:
The Grounded and Holistic Approach to People's Empowerment (GHAPE) is a non-profit NGO based in Bamenda, Cameroon. GHAPE works towards the empowerment of the poor and poverty alleviation through a highly multifaceted approach. Every client is trained in business management, basic health, life skills, financial management, profits and losses, and family values. Clients are also required to contribute a small amount into a personal savings account; most clients save much more than the minimum requirement. GHAPE instills a sense of family and community within its clients and staff and has developed a strong bond of trust between the organization and its clients.

loans.use: Purchase yams seeds, poultry and pig farming

loans.name: Aidake

texts.en:
Aidake U. is 58 years old and the mother of five children. She lives in Ozgorush village, which is in northwest Kyrgyzstan.  Sixteen years ago, Aidake bought one cow and five sheep and started her livestock business. Today, she earns 2,200 KGS per month by selling milk to a local diary.  She also earns a small amount of money by farming a plot of land on which she grows kidney beans and potatoes. And, because she is a very energetic woman, she supplements these two sources of income by sewing garments for brides, and is well known locally for her skills in this area. 
 
Aidake has applied for a loan for 60,000 KGS to to buy more milk cows, which will allow her to increase sales and acquire more customers. She plans to use her increased income to build a barn for her cows. In the future, she dreams of buying a sewing machine so she can expand her clothing-making business. 
 
Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target especially vulnerable populations. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading Microfinance Institutions in Kyrgyzstan, and contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment by meeting the needs of clients and investors.

loans.use: to buy more cattle

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married with two sons who are ages 18 and 11. He is a small businessman who makes a living in the town of Ivano-Frankivsk by selling clothing in the central market. He specializes in underwear, caps, socks, pantyhose, and other items. He went into business 11 years ago after resigning from a low-paying job at a local factory. His business has benefited from microloans since he started it, and today his monthly profit comes to 6,000 Grivnyas.   

Andryi is seeking a 7,500 Grivnya loan to buy additional items to sell to his customers. He would like to increase his income because his small company is his family's sole means of support, and his wife actively helps him with it. He promptly repaid a previous loan, and is hoping to use the increased income made possible by this new one to add a second floor to his house.

loans.use: to buy additional products to sell to his customers

loans.name: Andryi

texts.en:
Andryi is married and has two children, a 14-year-old son and a 4-year-old daughter. He is the only breadwinner in his family and has made a living as a taxi driver for the last three years. Currently, he offers transportation services to many parts of the Ukraine. He is a very determined, hard-working man who sometimes puts in a 24-hour day. He currently makes about 4,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Andryi is requesting a loan of 7,500 Grivnyas to remodel his vehicle, improve its efficiency and allow it to run more smoothly and quietly. This will not only help his cut his costs, but also reduce the environmental impact of his vehicle.

loans.use: to make his vehicle op[erate more smoothly and efficiently

loans.name: Leonora

texts.en:
Leonora lives in the town of Mukachevo, where she makes a living selling footwear for women and children in a local marketplace. She is committed to run her business in a stable way, avoiding risks and expanding sales steadily and consistently. She has been in business for 10 years and makes about 12,000 Grivnyas a month. 

Leonora is applying for a loan of 10,000 Grivnyas to buy seasonal items and her stay competitive with other vendors. She is very diligent and runs her business with great integrity, which explains why it has grown and become such a success.

loans.use: to buy seasonal merchandise to sell to her customers

loans.name: Aida

texts.es: Aida, D. 56 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en e su casa propia, junto a su esposo Augusto D. 63 años y su querida hija menor Alison D. 19 años, a quienes dese brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. DesD. muy pequeña Aida aprendió ha trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra arveja y papa, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 36 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plagas que pueden ser afectadas. Su deseo es comprar nuevas tierras, con las cuales pueda incrementar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuata D. humor en el grupo. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus tierras, ya que desea que sus nuevas siembras le den buenos frutos.
texts.en:
Aida, 56-years-old, is a simple, hardworking woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Augusto, 63-years-old, and their beloved younger daughter Alison, 19-years old. She wants to proviD. them with a better quality of life. Since she was very young Aida has worked on the farm with her parents, who taught her everything that had to be done to achieve a good cultivation. She now has her own land, which she cultivates and cares for with love and patience. She plants peas and potatoes, which she sells at the wholesale market in Tarma. What she likes most about her work is harvesting her crops because at that point she sees that her hard work is coming to fruition. She's performed this activity for 36 years and says that the most difficult thing is protecting her crops from plagues. She hopes to buy new lands with which she will expand her production. This is her eighth loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make her payments punctually and she's willing to do that. She's a happy member of her communal bank, where she always brings humor to the group. With the money she's requesting she will buy fertilizer for her land so that her latest crops will give good fruit.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Richardson, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana, de 48 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pepe de 53  años y sus 2 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Trabajando arduamente, Ana ha logrado que sus chacras le brinden los productos necesarios, para mantener a su familia. Antes que el sol deje ver sus primeros rayos, sale de su casa y camina cerca de una hora y media para llegar a sus tierras, donde tiene sembrado papa y arveja, productos que posteriormente lleva a vender hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cultivar sus tierras, ya que siente que les da un buen uso, lleva 27 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los costales que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Con el tiempo, desea poner una tienda de abarrotes, de esa manera pueda mejorar su economía. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, está muy feliz de poder acceder a este crédito y quiere agradecer a todas las personas que harán posible que obtenga el dinero que necesita. En su banco comunal es una socia muy respetada por el orden que pone en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Ana, 48, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband, Pepe, 53, and their two beloved children for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life. Working hard, Ana has gotten her fields to produce the necessary products to support her family. Before the sun even shows its first rays she is out of the house to walk the nearly hour and a half to reach her fields where she grows potatoes and peas, products which she later takes to sell in Tarma’s wholesale market. What she likes best about her work is tilling the soil because she feels she uses them well. She has been a farmer for 27 years and considers the most difficult part of it transporting the products to Tarma because the sacks are very heavy and they tire her out a lot. In time she’d like to install a grocery store to improve her economy. This is her 8th loan with MFP and she is happy to be able to access it. She wants to thank all the people that will fund it making it possible for her to get the money she needs. She is respected in her communal bank because she imposes order at the meetings. She will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy new pea seed and sacks of manure.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure and pea seeds.

loans.name: Marcial  Juan

texts.es: El Sr. Marcial se dedica a la elaboración de salteñas y otros en su domicilio con la ayuda de su esposa quien las vende en la avenida principal de la zona, la actividad que realiza la pareja les ayuda a sustentar a su familia ya que es el único ingreso que tienen para los gastos de la alimentación y pagar los estudios de los hijos que están en colegio, podemos indicar también que los clientes son bastantes trabajadores y responsables ya que se esfuerzan para cancelar sus obligaciones, por lo que se vio por conveniente darles la tasa kiva, con el dinero del crédito compraran harina, ají picante, papa por cantidad para la elaboración de las riquísimas salteñas que elabora el Sr. Marcial.
texts.en:
Marcial makes salteñas (savory baked turnovers) from his home, helping his wife who also makes and sells them along the main road of the region. The business that this couple carries out helps them support the family, this being their only source of income. This income covers their food and the tuition for the kids who attend school. They are hard working and responsible people that invest their energy in covering their expenses and obligations. With the loan they will purchase flour, garlic, chili powder and potatoes to make their exquisite salteñas.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: Rosalia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Destino de Crédito: Construcción de muro perimetral.

La señorita Rosalía vive en casa de sus parientes en la zona de Milluni en la ciudad de El Alto, es soltera y es de profesión maestra, actualmente trabaja en una unidad educativa de la misma ciudad.  Los ingresos que obtiene ayudan a su subsistencia  y ayuda a sus padres, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Loan Use: To build a perimeter wall. Rosalía is single and is a teacher. She currently is employed in a school in El Alto which is where she lives in her relatives’ house in the Milluni neighborhood. Her salary helps her to subsist and help her parents. This is her first loan request from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a perimeter wall.

loans.name: Natty Jesusa

texts.es: La señora Natty vive en casa propia en la zona de Pasankeri, ladera oeste de la ciudad de La Paz, esta casada, sus hijos están en edad escolar. La señora tiene un almacén de abarrotes y su esposo trabaja en el transporte publico, con los ingresos que obtienen mantienen a su familia. El crédito que solicta será utilizado para la construcción de un cuarto de baño. Natty es cliente de Impro con un historial de 8 créditos.
texts.en:
Natty lives in her own house in the Pasankeri area, on the eastern slopes of the city of La Paz. She's married with school-aged children. She has a grocery warehouse and her husband works in public transit. They use their income to support the family. Natty plans to use her loan to construct a bathroom. She is an Impro client who has had eight loans.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build a bathroom.

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio, de 58 años, es un hombre que siempre ha luchado por sobresalir en la vida, vive solo en su casa propia y lo que más desea es tener una vejez tranquila. Los años le han enseñado a Artemio, que tiene que trabajar muy duro si quiere que sus cultivos sean los mejores de su poblado y es así que con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus sembríos de papa, arveja, espinaca y zanahoria, sean muy solicitados en los mercados de la ciudad de Tarma. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cosechar sus productos, lleva 45 años realizando esta actividad y para él siempre le fue difícil tener que cuidar sus campos de la plaga de insectos. Con el tiempo, desea sembrar todas sus tierras, ya que así podrá mejorar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, siempre ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria con el resto de sus compañeras. Con los ochocientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que actualmente es lo que mejor se esta vendiendo.
texts.en:
Artemio is 58 years old. He is someone who has always worked hard to advance in life. He lives alone in his own home and his greatest wish is to have a peaceful old age. Time has taught Artemio that one has to work very hard if the harvest is going to be the best in the village so it is with a great deal of effort that he has cared for his potato, sweet pea, spinach, and carrot plantations. His products are very sought out in the markets of the city of Tarma. What he most enjoys about the work is the harvest. For the past 45 years he has worked in the business and it has always been very difficult to ward his fields from insects and pests. In time he hopes to cultivate all of his land to improve his yield. This is the eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He has always been on time with his payments and he plans on keeping his record. In his community bank he is a very engaged member. With the eight hundred nuevos soles he requests he will purchase pea seeds, this being the harvest that sells the best.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Pea seeds.

loans.name: María Eugenia

texts.es: La señora María vive en casa propia en la zona de Villa Exaltación de la ciudad de El Alto, vive con su esposo y su hijo de un año, la señora es empleada en una pensión y su esposo trabaja en mantenimiento de ascensores, con los ingresos que obtienen  mantienen a su familia, esta es la primera vez que solicita un crédito. El crédito será para la refacción de muros exteriores.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her own home in the Villa Exaltacion area of the city of El Alto. She lives with her husband and one-year-old child. She is employed at a boarding house and her husband works in elevator maintenance. With their income, they support their family. This is the first time that Maria has requested a loan. The loan will be used for repairing exterior walls.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: restoration of walls

loans.name: Veronica

texts.es: La Señora  Verónica se dedica a distintas actividades como  a la venta de distintos productos como ser ropa, tenis pero su actividad principal es la venta de comida  cerca a un  colegio de Colcapirhua, vende  salchipapas y hamburguesas, actualmente vive en casa de su suegra y  la señora no paga alquiler, esta muy agradecida con Emprender y con Kiva por darle la oportunidad de trabajar y crecer junto a nosotros, vive actualmente en el barrio  kami de la zona de Colcapirhua y también la señora es muy sacrificada ya que se dedica a la venta de todo a veces por la época de navidad vende juguetes y en la época de invierno vende chompas y en la época de clases vende salchipapas y otros, con el dinero del crédito desea comprar Papa, garrafa, platos desechables para la venta de sus productos , trabaja duro para poder así mejorar la calidad de vida de toda su familia.
texts.en:
Veronica carries out various business activities such as the sale clothing and sports shoes but her primary business is the sale of prepared foods near the school in Colcapirhua. She sells salchipapas (a traditional dish of chicken, sausages and potatoes) and hamburgers. She currently lives with her mother-in-law, not having to pay rent. She is very grateful to Emprender (Kiva Field Partner) to have imparted the opportunity to work together and become a member of the group. She lives in the Kami district of the Colcapirhua region. Veronica also sells all kinds of things depending on the season. For Christmas she sells toys and for the winter season she sells jackets and during the school year she sells foods in the schools. With the loan she will purchase potatoes, a carafe, and disposable plates. She works hard to improve the quality of life for her family.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients.

loans.name: La Gata Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Gata está conformado por tres mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas es Agustina Ángela Fornos O. de 36 años  quien inicio vendiendo tortillas actualmente tiene una pequeña venta donde oferta maíz, queso, huevo, chicharron, cuajadas, leche agria etc. 

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Sandi Salomé S. Gómez de 20 años  quien tiene una pequeña tortillería y Helsel Raquel S. Alegría comercializa productos Avon.
texts.en:
The group's name is La Gata. It is made up of three hard working women. One of the members is Agustina Angela Fornos O., 36 years old. She started selling tortillas and now she has a small store from where she sells corn, cheese, eggs, pork rinds, desserts etc. The other members of the group are Sandi Salome S. G., 20 years old. She has a small tortilla making business. Helsel Raquel S. A. sells Avon brand products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase corn, dairy products, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia, 40 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa de su esposo junto a su menor hijo Bryan de 13 años, quien es el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El cultivo de zanahoria y gladiolo es la actividad que realiza diariamente Delia. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que sus tierras sean muy productivas, lo cual ha generado que sus cultivos sean de muy buena calidad y muy bien apreciados en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 15 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados. Espera en adelante tener un puesto en el mercado mayorista, para así mejorar sus ingresos. Este es el sétimo crédito con MFP y espera ser muy puntual en sus cuotas, puesto que no quiere darle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual se siente muy contenta. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja, ya que esta planta leguminosa se esta vendiendo muy bien en estos meses.
texts.en:
Delia is 40 years old. She is a very happy and hard working woman. She lives together with her husband and their youngest son Bryan, 13 years old. They are the reason for all of her efforts. She harvests carrots and gladiola flowers. This is Delia's daily work. With a great deal of effort she has managed to make her fields to be very productive, generating excellent quality harvests and very sought out by the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her favorite part of her work is caring of the plantations. She has had 15 years in the field. The most difficult part of the work is having to transport her products all the way to the city of Tarma. The sacks are very heavy. IN the future she hopes to have a stand in the wholesale market to improve her earnings. This is her seventh loan with MFP (Kiva Field Partner) and she will endeavor to be on time with her payments, not wanting to cause any troubles with her community bank, where she feels very content. With the thousand five hundred nuevos soles she requests, she will purchase pea seeds. This product is selling very well these months.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase pea seeds.

loans.name: Coco Victor

texts.es: El Señor coco dedicado al servicio de taxi, diariamente desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana el Sr. Sale al  trabajo,  el señor Coco  tiene una particularidad  especial ya que el señor no cuenta con una pierna pero esto no le impide realizar esta actividad consiente de que es duro para el pero sigue adelante con mas fuerza, el dinero que el gana lo utiliza para el tratamiento que requiere para su pierna, y también para mantener  su hogar, el crédito que el requiere es para comprar repuestos para su automóvil. Y así poder brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Coco is a taxi driver. Every day, from the very early morning hours, he goes to work. He has a unique circumstance in that he is an amputee but this has never prevented him from working every day. He knows that it is hard to advance but that's why he works even harder. His earnings are used to cover the medical expenses to treat his leg and to support his family. The loan he requests will be used to purchase spare parts for his car, to provide better service to his clients. He is very grateful for the support he is given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Harold

texts.es: Harold, de 24 años, es un joven muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en una casa alquilada junto a su esposa Lisbeth de 21 años y su único hijo Junior de 10 meses, quienes son el principal motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. En la comodidad de su hogar Harold tiene su horno, desde entonces todos los días se levanta muy temprano para cumplir con los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes. Él trabaja con su esposa Lisbeth y juntos realizan pan, ya que el horno les pertenece a ambos. Disfruta mucho de su labor, como hornear pasteles, es así que tiene 15 años trabajando en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es elaborar los panes, ya que tiene que tener mucho cuidado para que no se quemen. Para el futuro de su negocio, espera poner una tienda donde pueda vender él mismo sus panes. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que si lo paga a tiempo, podrá acceder a otro con mayor tranquilidad y sin traerle complicaciones a su banco comunal, donde es muy querido por el resto de sus socias. Los mil nuevos soles que solicita, los invertirá en comprar ingredientes, para preparar sus deliciosos panes.
texts.en:
Harold is 24 years old. He is a very unpretentious and hard working young man. He lives in a rented house together with his wife Lisbeth, 21 years old, and their only son, Junior who is 10 months old. They are the reason for all of his efforts. In the comfort of his home Harold has an oven. He starts baking very early in the morning to fill all the orders he has received from his clients. He works together with his wife Lisbeth and together they bake breads. The oven belongs to them both. He very much enjoys his work, especially baking cakes. He has 15 years' experience in the field. The most difficult part of the work is baking breads because he always has to give special care to not over bake them. In the future he hopes to set up a store from where they can sell their baked goods themselves. This is the first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). He knows that if he pays his loan back on time he will have access to future loans and not bring any difficulties to his community bank. He is very well liked by the other members of the group. The one thousand nuevos soles that he requests will be invested in the purchase of ingredients to bake more delicious breads.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients for his bakery.

loans.name: Salustino

texts.es:
El señor Salustino vive en casa propia en la zona de Las Lomas, de la ciudad de La Paz, es soltero, es policía y además realiza trabajos varios como electricista, con los ingresos que obtiene se mantiene y ayuda a su familia. El crédito es para la construcción de una sala, el señor es cliente de Impro con un historial de 4 créditos. 
Por su antecedente histórico califica para obtener un nuevo crédito.
texts.en:
Salustino lives in his own home in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. He is single and a police officer. He also works in other areas, for example as an electrician. With his income, he supports and helps his family. The loan is for the construction of a room. He is a client of Impro and has a 4 previous loans. His prior history qualifies him for a new loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: construction

loans.name: Eleuterio

texts.es:
El señor ELEUTERIO P. R., es una persona de 46 años, es soltero sin hijos, que se dedica a la actividad de cría de ganado lechero y asimismo es albañil.  No tiene estudios, sólo cursó el primero y segundo curso, ha vivido desde su infancia en el lugar llamado Pilancho, está a 25 kilómetros de la ciudad de Cochabamba hacia el Trópico, ha heredado el terreno de sus padres, quiere mejorar sus condiciones de vida construyendo dos habitaciones, lo que tiene está en muy mal estado.  Asimismo en el lugar tiene una arboleda de eucaliptos para preservar el entorno medioambiental.  Su trabajo de albañil lo realiza en diferentes lugares de Cochabamba con regularidad.  

El crédito será utilizado en la construcción y mejoramiento de los establos donde se encuentra el ganado, asi de ese modo podra realizar mejor su trabajo, optimizandolo, y con el tiempo mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Eleuterio P. R. is a 46 year old man. He is single and he has no children. He raises milk cows and he also a construction worker. He has a grade 2 education. Since his infancy he has lived in the same place, a village named Pilancho, located 25 kilometers from the city of Cochabamba. He inherited the land from his parents. He wishes to improve his living conditions, so he is building two bedrooms. The one he currently has is in very poor state. In his house he also has a tree orchard of eucalyptus trees, preserved to conserve the environment. He works as a construction worker in various locales in Cochabamba. The loan will be invested in the construction and improvement of the farm stables where the dairy cows are raised. He will be able to carry out his work in better conditions, optimizing it, and in time see an improvement in his earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make a stable for his dairy cows.

loans.name: Isidora

texts.es: Isidora, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en una casa alquilada junto a sus 4 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Con mucho esfuerzo Isidora ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, zanahoria y arveja, las cuales los lleva a vender al por mayor en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lleva 20 años realizando esta actividad y aún sigue disfrutando trabajar en el campo, cuidar sus cultivos. En adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para ampliar su producción. Este es el octavo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto de los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono, con lo cual espera mejorar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Isidora is 45 years old. She is a very unpretentious and hard working woman. She lives in a rented home together with her 4 beloved children, to whom she wishes to provide a better quality of life. With a great deal of work Isidora has managed her fields to make them very productive. She cultivates potatoes, carrots, and peas. She sells her harvest in wholesale in the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her harvests have granted her an income, enough to support her family, reason for which she expends all of her energy in the business. She has 20 years' experience in the field and even after all this time she still enjoys working the fields, and caring for her plantations. In the future she hopes to purchase more land to expand production. This is her eighth loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She has been on time with her loans in the past and she hopes to keep up her record. In her community bank she is a very involved member, always on top of the business and agreements of the group. With the two thousand soles she requests she will purchase fertilizer to improve her harvests.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
La señora María vive en casa de sus padres en la zona de las Lomas, de la ciudad de La Paz, es  soltera y tiene un hijo de 8 años, la señora es profesora y trabaja en una unidad educativa de su zona, con los ingresos que obtienen  mantienen a su familia. El crédito será destinado para la construcción de un cuarto de baño  
Esta es la octava vez que solicita un crédito.
texts.en:
María lives in her parents' home in the Las Lomas area of the city of La Paz. She is single and has an 8-year-old child. She is a teacher and works in a local school. With her income, she supports her family. This loan will be used to construct a bathroom. This is her eighth loan.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the construction of a bathroom

loans.name: Ruth Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT) is very pleased to present to you members of the Ruth Group from Makeni. They are microentrepreneurs residing in Makeni, a city in Northern Sierra Leone. They are seeking a loan of 1,200,000 leones each to enable them to further expand their businesses. Consequently, they will make more profit and improve their standard of living. 

The leader of this group is Halima S., standing on the left in the photo. Halima is age 42 and was born in Binkolo village about 7 miles from Makeni city. She is married to a health worker and they have four children:  one in primary school and three in secondary school. Halima runs a little clinic and at the same time she also sells market foodstuffs such as groundnuts (peanuts), palm oil (the country’s most favorite cooking oil), etc. With the help of this loan, Halima will improve her clinic and also buy more palm oil and groundnuts to add to her business.

loans.use: To improve a clinic and also buy more palm oil and groundnuts

loans.name: Marcela

texts.es: Marcela, D. 60 años, es una madre muy amorosa y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Fortunato D. 64 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad D. vida. Trabajando arduamente Marcela ha logrado sacar adelante sus sembríos, todas las mañanas se levanta muy temprano para regar y brindarle el cuidado respectivo a sus cultivos D. papa, espinaca y arveja, productos que llevará a comercializarlas en la ciudad D. Tarma, ya que es ahí donD. obtiene los mejores precios por sus productos. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es que pueD. disfrutar D. la libertad D. laborar en sus campos, lleva 37 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es tener que trabajar la tierra. Con el tiempo, espera poder adecuar la mayoría D. sus tierras para el sembrado D. arveja, ya que por estas fechas es lo que mejor se venD.. Este es el primer crédito con MFP, sabe que este préstamo le ayudará bastante en el progreso y desarrollo D. su negocio, es por eso que esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, en su banco comunal es una socia muy responsable, motivo por el cual es muy querida. Con los mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la calidad D. sus tierras.
texts.en:
Marcela is 60 years old. She is a very loving mother and a hard working woman. She lives in her own house together with her husband Fortunato, 64 years old, and their 3 beloved children. She hopes to proviD. them all with a better quality of life. Working arduously Marcela has managed her plantations. Every morning she starts her work very early, providing the needed care to her fields of potatoes, spinach, and peas. She takes her products to sell in the city of Tarma, location where she gets the best prices. Her favorite part of her work is the freedom she enjoys when she works in her fields. She has 37 years' experience in the business. The most difficult part of her work is preparing the fields for seeding. In time she hopes to prepare most of her fields to cultivate peas, during this time of year it is the harvest that sells the best. This is her first loan through MFP (Kiva Field Partner). She sees this loan as a great help in the advancement and development of her business. She is committed to the responsibilities of the loan. In the community bank she is known as a very responsible and much liked member. The one thousand nuevos soles requested will be invested in the purchase of fertilizers to improve the quality of her fields.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Masuba Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Masuba” group. They are small-scale businesswomen residing in Makeni city.  They are requesting a loan of SLL 1,200,000 for each to enable them to improve the size and quality of their respective businesses.

Pictured on the left is Fatmata F. who is the leader of this group. Fatmata was born in Makeni and she is 37 years old. She is married to a teacher and the couple has two children who are attending secondary school.

Fatmata sells cloth (fabric). She has had 10 years of experience in the cloth business. With her share of the loan, Fatmata will buy cloth to add to her current stock. 

(Attached to this photo is a snapshot of a borrower who was not able to be present for the group photo).

loans.use: To buy cloth to add to her current stock

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan es casado vive con su esposa  en casa  de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri de la ciudad de La Paz. El señor Juan es costurero y se dedica a la confección de chamarras junto con la ayuda de su esposa, de esta manera obtienen sus ingresos para su hogar. El crédito solicitado es para la compra de una maquina industrial overlok y así mejorar la calidad de su producto. Este es el segundo crédito que solicita el  señor Juan con IMPRO.
texts.en:
Juan is married. He lives with his wife in his parents' home in the Pasankeri area of the city of La Paz. Juan is a tailor, and makes jackets with the help of his wife. This is how they obtain an income for their household. The requested loan is for the purchase of an Overlok industrial machine to improve the quality of his product. This is his second loan from IMPRO.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy Overlock sewing machine

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es: Maria Lourdes tiene 47 años, su actividad es una pulpería. Ella tiene más de 12 años de tener este negocio comenzó con muy pocos productos, un negocio en el cual le está dando buenos resultados económicos, Hoy con su propio negocio, le está yendo de la mejor manera y ese éxito mesurado lo agradece eternamente a sus padres, además sus clientes más exigentes se sienten satisfechos su planes para el futuro son que el negocio siga creciendo y obtener más ingresos. Siempre se ha caracterizado por ser una mujer que lucha y que disfruta de su actividad. Este financiamiento es para la compra de golosinas, refrescos, leche, jugos, pan y detergentes. Sueña con mantener siempre satisfecho a sus clientes.
texts.en:
María Lourdes, 47, has had a grocery store for over 12 years. She started out with just a few products but it’s a business that is producing good economic results. Today, with her own business, she is doing better and she is eternally grateful to her parents for this success. In addition, her most demanding customers are satisfied. She plans for her business to continue growing in the future in order to earn more income. She has always been noted for being a woman who works hard and enjoys her work. The financing will be used to buy sweets, beverages, milk, juices, bread and detergents. She dreams with always having satisfied customers.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Sandra Felisa

texts.es:
La  señora Sandra Felisa Q. A. tiene 33 años y vive en casa de su tia en el barrio IV Centenario de esta ciudad de Tarija. Sandra no es casada pero tiene un hijo. Sandra se dedica a trabajar como costurera desde hace más de 10 años.                                                                                                             

Sandra quiere tener mejores ingresos para brindarles una mejor vida a su familia pero ella nos cuenta que tiene un trabajo grande por hacer y tiene la necesidad de comprar material de trabajo. Es por eso que el crédito será destinado para la compra de dicho material para de ese modo poder incrementar sus ingresos.                                                                                                         

Sandra  nos cuenta que quiere darle a su hijo toda la comodidad que pueda, por eso nos dice que el próximo crédito que solicite será para mejorar las condiciones de la casa donde vive.
texts.en:
Sandra Felisa Q. A. is thirty-three and lives in her aunt's house in the Centenario Neighborhood IV in Tarija. She is not married but she has one son. She has been working as a seamstress for more than ten years. Sandra would like to have more income to provide her family with a better life, but she tells us that she needs to buy supplies for a big job she has to do. That's why she plans to use her loan buy the supplies, so she can increase her earnings. Sandra tells us that she would like to give her son every possible comfort, so she plans to use her next loan to improve the condition of their house.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies, including thread and fabric, and for operating expenses.

loans.name: Ma-Finoh Group

texts.en:
Ramatu B. is the leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Born 28 years ago in Makeni city, Ramatu is married and has two children. Ramatu has been selling palm oil, rice, etc. for countless years. She will use her share of the loan (SLL 800,000) to expand her business. She will buy palm oil, rice, etc. in large quantity to add to her business. 

This is the second loan that Ramatu and her group member have applied for from SMT, a partner of Kiva.org. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their businesses, make more sales and consequently improve their living conditions.

loans.use: Buy palm oil, rice, etc. in large quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Maximiliana

texts.es: Maximiliana, de 53 años, es una madre de familia muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en la casa que le heredó su madre junto a su hijo Maycon y lo que más desea es mejorar su calidad de vida. Los productos que con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación ha logrado cultivar Maximiliana, le han ayudado mucho en el progreso de su vida. Todas las mañanas empieza a trabajar en sus tierras, ya que sabe que del cuidado que le brinde a sus sembríos de papa y arveja, dependerá la calidad de los productos que obtenga. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos y se siente muy feliz cuado los ve grandes y abundantes, lleva 23 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es llevar lo cosechado hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es el lugar donde lo vende, ya que los sacos en donde lleva los productos son muy pesados. En adelante, espera mejorar sus productos, para así poder obtener mejores precios. Este es el segundo crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy solidaria y responsable. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará semillas de arveja y sacos de abono.
texts.en:
Maximiliano, age 53, is a very happy and hard-working mother. She lives with her son, Maycon, in the house that she inherited from her mother. What she wishes for most is to improve her quality of life. The products that Maximiliana has managed to cultivate, with much effort and dedication, have helped her a lot to make progress in her life. Every morning she starts to work in her fields. She knows that the quality of the products that she will get depends upon the care she gives her potato and pea crops. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She is very happy when they are large and abundant. She has been doing this for 23 years, and the most difficult is taking the harvest to the Tarma market where she sells her crops. The bags she uses to take her harvest are very heavy. Later, she hopes to improve her products in order to be able to get better prices. This is her second loan with MFP. She knows that she has to make all of her payments punctually, and she is prepared to do so. She is a very supportive and responsible member of her communal bank. She will use the requested 1,500 soles to buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy pea seeds and sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: José Antonio

texts.es:
El señor Jose A. T. Z. es casado vive con su esposa y su hija de 7 años de edad en la casa de sus suegros en la zona de Achachicala de la ciudad de La Paz.
El señor José  trabaja como programador de computadoras en una entidad privada y su esposa es administradora de un edificio, ambos  tienen un negocio donde venden material de escritorio, de esta forma  obtienen ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar capital de trabajo para su negocio y asÍ mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
Es su primer crédito en IMPRO y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califica favorablemente.
texts.en:
Mr. José A. T. Z. is married and lives with his wife and 7-year-old daughter in his in-laws’ house in La Paz’s Achachicala neighborhood. José works as a Computer Programmer in a private firm and his wife is a building supervisor. Both own a business where they sell office supplies thereby earning extra income for the home. The loan will be used to increase working capital for their business in order to improve income and quality of life. It’s his first loan with IMPRO; the socio-economic evaluation undertaken indicates that he qualifies for the loan.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy paper goods.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.es: La Sra. Lucila vive en la ciudad de la Paz,  en la zona denominada Alto Tacagua   cuenta con dos hijos ya mayores de edad, es viuda, cuenta que fue un golpe para ella el quedarse sola sin su compañero, pero supo reponerse y salir adelante, su actividad es la venta de comida  cuenta con 10 años de experiencia en el rubro y menciona que invertirá el dinero en la compra de un terreno  que esta de ocasión, ella cuenta con parte de lo que cuesta el terreno y le hizo falta los un mil dólares americanos que actualmente solicita, es una persona muy trabajadora y muy responsable siempre pensando en el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en:
Lucila lives in the city of La Paz in an area called Alto Tacagua. She has two grown children, and she is a widow. She says that it was a blow for her to be left alone without her life partner. But, she knew how to recover and get ahead. She sells food, and she has ten years of experience in this field. She says that she will use the money to buy a piece of land that is a bargain. She has part of the price of the land, but she still needs $1,000 American dollars. She is requesting that amount now. She is a very hard-working and responsible person. She is always thinking of her family’s well-being.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a piece of land

loans.name: Sintya

texts.es:
La señora Sintya es separada, actualmente vive con su hijo de 9 años de edad en alquiler en el Barrio Ferroviario de la zona de Pura Pura de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Sintya es comerciante independiente y trabaja vendiendo joyas, es así como obtiene ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumento de capital para vender ampliar su mercadería.
Es su primer crédito con IMPRO y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente para acceder a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Sintya is separated. She currently lives with her 9-year-old child in a rented home in the Ferroviario neighbourhood of the Pura Pura zone of the city of La Paz. Sintya is an independent merchant and works selling jewellery; this is how she obtains an income for her household. The requested loan is for an increase of working capital to expand her merchandise. This is her first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis for obtaining a loan graded her favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Florentina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco”; El banco  está ubicado en el distrito de Wanchaq, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Florentina; ella tiene 43 años de edad y es madre soltera y  tiene 2 Hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de  tienda de abarrotes, ella vende desde las 6:00 a.m hasta las 10:00 p.m, ella saca sola adelante a sus hijos, la socia quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes mas grande. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar  mercadería  como arroz, azúcar, leche y galletas.

La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
Florentina, age 43, is a member of the “Virgen del Rosario del Cusco” Communal Bank. The bank is located in the Wanchaq district, Cusco province, Cusco department. Florentina is a single mother, and she has two children. She alternates between her daily activities and her business, which is a grocery store. She sells from 6:00 a.m. until 10:00 p.m. She alone gets her children ahead. She wants to have a larger grocery store. She is requesting the loan to buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. She is grateful to those people, who through these means, are part of her dream. She pledges to make her payments on time.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise like rice, sugar, milk, and cookies

loans.name: Luis Antonio

texts.es: Luis Antonio tiene 41 años de dedicarse al comercio, su actividad principal es la venta de ropa para  caballeros, niños y damas y también una gran variedad  de ropa interior. Su negocio es de manera ambulante, por lo que así tiene la probabilidad de vender. El crecimiento de su negocio es notable gracias a la buena administración, la excelente atención a los clientes. Junto a su esposa tienen 2 hijos de los cuales dependen de ellos pues siempre se preocupan por mejorar su negocio. El crédito lo utilizara para comprar más mercadería y así surtir su negocio. Las ganancias las necesita para cubrir los gastos del hogar.
texts.en:
Luis Antonio is 41 years old, and he sells clothing for men, women, and children. He also sells a great variety of underwear. He sells in an itinerant manner because that is they way that he will most likely make sales. The growth of his business is notable thanks to his good administration and the excellent service he gives his customers. He and his wife have two dependent children. They are always thinking about improving his business. He will use the loan to buy more merchandise to stock his business. He needs the income to cover the household expenses.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working Capital

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania, D. 53 años es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Héctor D. 51 años y su hijo menor Bryan D. 16 años, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Con mucho esfuerzo Melania ha logrado trabajar sus tierras y volverlas muy productivas, ella cultiva, papas, arvejas, zanahorias y habas, productos que son llevados a vender al por mayor en el mercado mayorista D. la ciudad D. Tarma. Sus cultivos le han dado los ingresos necesarios para mantener a su familia, es por eso que desea poner todas sus ganas en sacar adelante este negocio. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta Tarma, ya que los sacos que lleva son muy pesados y la cansan mucho. Para más adelante, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en sus anteriores créditos y espera serlo también ahora. En su banco comunal es una socia muy participativa y siempre esta al tanto D. los acuerdos a los que llegan en su grupo. Con los mil trescientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus tierras.
texts.en:
Melanie, age 53, is a very unassuming and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her 51 year old husband, Héctor, and her 16 year old son, Bryan. She wants to give them a better future. With a great deal of effort Melania has managed to work her fields and have them be productive again. She grows potatoes, peas, carrots, and beans. These products are taken to sell at the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. Her crops have given her the necessary income to support her family. Therefore, she wants to put all of her efforts into getting this business ahead. What she likes most about her work is taking care of her crops. She has been doing this for 30 years. The most difficult part is transporting her products to Tarma. The sacks that she takes there are very heavy and make her very tired. In the future she wishes to buy new fields to increase her production. This is her fourth loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her previous loans, and she plans being punctual with this loan as well. She is a very active participant in her communal bank, and she is up on all of the agreements the group has come to. She will use the requested 1,300 soles to buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ginny Kalish, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy sacks of fertilizer

loans.name: José

texts.es:
El señor Jose es casado vive con su esposa y sus hijos de 1 y 3 años de edad en casa  de sus padres en la zona Pasankeri sur de la ciudad de La Paz
El señor Jose trabaja como empleado de limpieza en una entidad privada y su esposa trabaja como vendedora de perfumes, de está manera obtiene ingresos para su hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para la compra de un lote de terreno en la ciudad de EL Alto y así tener un lugar donde vivir.
Es su primer crédito con IMPRO y el análisis socioeconómico realizado le califica favorablemente para acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Jose is married and lives with his wife and children, ages 1 and 3, in his parents' home in the Pasankeri zone, south of the city of La Paz. Jose works as a member of the cleaning staff of a private company and his wife works as a perfume salesperson. This is how they obtain an income for their household. The requested loan is for the purchase of a plot of land in the city of El Alto, which will provide them with a place to live. This is his first loan with IMPRO and the socioeconomic analysis for receiving a loan graded him favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of land

loans.name: Martha

texts.es:
La señora Martha es separada, vive con su hermana en alquiler en la zona de Sopocachi Alto de la ciudad de La Paz.
La señora Martha es comerciante independiente de ropa para damas con lo que obtiene sus ingresos para el hogar.
El crédito solicitado es para aumentar capital y obtener mayor mercadería. Es su tercer crédito y el análisis socioeconómico realizado la califica favorablemente para acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Martha is separated and lives with her sister in a rented home in the Sopocachi Alto zone in the city of La Paz. Martha works as an independent seller of women's clothing to obtain her income for her household. The requested loan is to increase her working capital and obtain better merchandise. This is her third loan and the socioeconomic analysis for accessing a loan graded her favourably.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy stock items for her store.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es: Nelly, de 45 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Pedro de 50 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor vida. Todos los días muy temprano por la mañana, Nelly sale a trabajar sus campos, para ella no existen los días de descanso, ya que tiene que trabajar continuamente su chacra, para tener una buena producción. Sus principales productos de siembra son la papa, espinaca y la arveja, los cuales vende al por mayor en la ciudad de Tarma. Lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y aún sigue disfrutando trabajar en el campo y cuidar sus cultivos, sin embargo debe estar atenta para que la plaga de insectos no perjudique su siembra. Para el futuro, desea comprar nuevas tierras, para incrementar su producción. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, ha sido muy puntual en el pago de sus cuotas y espera serlo ahora también. En su banco comunal es una persona muy querida por el resto de sus compañeras, ya es muy alegre. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelly is 45 years years old. She is a very simple and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Pedro, who is 50 years old, and their 3 children to whom she wishes to give a better life. Every day, very early in the morning, Nelly leaves to go to work in the fields. For her, there are no rest days as she has to continually work her farm in order for it to be productive. Her main crops are potatoes, spinach and peas which she sells wholesale in the city of Tarma. She has been doing this work for 30 years and she still enjoys working in the fields and caring for her crops, however, she has to be vigilant so that the insects don't destroy her crops. In the future, she wants to buy more land to increase her production. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She has been very punctual with her payments and hopes to do the same with this loan. In her communal bank she is very well-liked by her fellow members since she is very cheerful. With the two thousand nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting she will buy more fertilizer for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Voice Of Women Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is very pleased to present to you members of the “Voice Of Women” group. These are small-scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to seek a loan of SLL 800,000 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Adama F. is the leader of this group. Adama is 48 years old and a widow with six children. Three of the children are attending secondary school. 

Adama sells cooking oil, magi cubes (used to give sauce a sweet taste), etc. and has been running this business for a very long time. With the help of this loan, Adama will buy the above-mentioned items in large quantity to add to her business.

loans.use: To buy cooking oil, margi, etc in large quantity

loans.name: El Buen Pastor Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario El Buen Pastor lo integran Ana María R. Méndez, Sabrina de los Ángeles P. y Xiomara M. E., tres mujeres que se encuentran en distintas etapas de sus vidas pero que comparten el placer de ser solidarias en una actividad que las beneficia a todas.

Ana María de 56 años se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y perfumería en general, los cuales compra al por mayor para luego vender por menudeo, ella es la coordinadora del grupo; Sabrina vende verduras y tamales en un pequeño tramo en el  mercado municipal, a sus 69 años es ella misma quien fabrica dichos tamales para vender; finalmente Xiomara vende cosméticos, ropa, tintes y accesorios en su comunidad y los sectores cercanos a su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The united group “El Buen Pastor” (The Good Shepherd) is made up of Ana María R. Méndez, Sabrina de los Ángeles P., and Xiomara M. E.; three women who find themselves at different stages of their lives, but who contribute and are united in an activity that benefits them all. Ana María is 56 years old and sells cosmetics and perfumes, which she buys in bulk and then resells at retail. She is the group’s coordinator. Sabrina sells vegetables and tamales from spot in the city marketplace. At 69, she makes the tamales herself. Finally, Xiomara sells cosmetics, clothing, hair coloring, and accessories in her community and sectors near her home.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Braulio Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Braulio lo conforma Norma del Socorro Dávila M. de 38 años, Martha Lorena López García y María Evalia Martínez C.; la primera es coordinadora del grupo y su labor es la compra/venta de cosechas, principalmente de frutas, actividad la cual realiza desde hace 4 años; dado que su esposo es agricultor ocasionalmente son las cosechas de él las que vende lo cual le deja mayores márgenes de ganancia.

Martha vende verduras en el mercado y María Evelia tiene una pulpería la cual surgió hace cuatro años y poco a poco ha venido creciendo. El sueño de estas mujeres es seguir prosperando con sus actividades y poder hacer mejoras en sus hogares.
texts.en:
The “Braulio” communal bank’s members are: Norma del Socorro Dávila M., 38, Martha Lorena López García and María Evalia Martínez C.. Norma is the group Coordinator and she buys and sells crops, mostly fruits; she’s been in this line of work for 4 years since her husband’s a farmer. Sometimes it’s his crops that she sells which means higher profit margins. Martha sells vegetables in the market and María Evelia has a grocery store that she started four years ago and has been growing gradually ever since. The dream of these women is to continue prospering with their activities and to be able to make some improvements to their homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy crops.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves, D. 63 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su hija menor Liz D. 26 años, quien es el motivo D. todos sus esfuerzos. DesD. muy pequeña Nieves aprendió a trabajar en la chacra junto a sus padres, quienes le enseñaron todo lo que se tiene que hacer, para lograr un buen cultivo, ahora tiene sus propias tierras, las cuales cultiva y cuida con mucho amor y paciencia. Ella siembra alverja, espinaca y zanahoria, las cuales lleva a vender al mercado mayorista D. Tarma. Lo que más le gusta D. su trabajo es cosechar sus cultivos, ya que siente que su arduo trabajo esta dando sus frutos, lleva 40 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es cuidar sus cultivos D. las plagas que pueden afectarlos. Con el tiempo espera, comprar nuevas tierras para ampliar su producción. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar sus cuotas puntualmente y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. En su banco comunal es una socia muy alegre y siempre está poniendo la cuota D. humor en el grupo. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nieves, 63, is a cheerful, hard working woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest daughter, Liz, 26, who is the object of all her efforts. Since a very young age Nieves learned how to work the fields with her parents who taught her everything you need to know to have a good crop. Now she owns her own lands which she cultivates and cares for with love and patience. She plants peas, spinach and carrots which she then sells in Tarma’s market. What she most enjoys about the work is harvesting the crops because that’s when she enjoys the fruits of her hard work. She has been in this line of work for 40 years. She considers the most difficult part of it protecting the plants from infestations that can damage them. In time she hopes to buy new fields in order to increase production. This is her 5th loan with MFP. She knows that she has to repay on time and is willing to do so. She is a cheerful member of her communal group and can always be counted on to inject humor into the group. She will use the requested 1500 new soles to buy sacks of manure for her crops.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Harold Enrique

texts.es: El Señor Harold Enrique tiene 40 años. Su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi, hace más de 15 años que se dedica a este negocio. Este negocio comenzó por su Padre que le enseño a manejar con el paso del tiempo este negocio le gusto a Harold ya que además tenía que mantener a su familia. El financiamiento es para capital de trabajo para la compra de repuestos, llantas, focos entre otras cosas. Sus deseos son de conseguir otro taxi y así proporcionarle a su familia esta fuente de ingresos.
texts.en:
Harold Enrique, 40, is a taxi driver. He has been in this business for over 15 years. His father started the business and taught him how to drive. In time, Harold liked this type of work. Besides, he had to support his family. The financing will be used to buy replacement parts: tires and headlamps among others. His wish is to acquire a second taxi so that he can provide his family with this source of income.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy replacement parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Asociasion Sin Fronteras Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Asociación sin Fronteras lo conforman tres mujeres de edad madura que luchan todos los días por llevar el alimento a sus hogares, Felipa Lorena J. E. es una de ellas y se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras como plátano, tomate, repollo, lechuga y cebollas, entre otros; siendo ayudada por sus dos hijos mayores pues su esposo se encuentra enfermo posterior a un accidente que tuvo en el pasado. Su meta es poder seguir trabajando y llegar a ver a sus nietos como profesionales.

Elidia de los Ángeles P. S. se dedica a la venta de artesanías, cosméticos y sandalias, este negocio era anteriormente de su mamá y ella retomo los pasos. Socorro Benita Rodríguez López es una de las principales proveedoras de papel en las comiderías de Masaya.
texts.en:
The “Asociación sin Fronteras” (Association without Borders) is made up of three mature women who struggle daily to provide nourishment for their families. Felipa Lorena José E. is one of them. She sells fruits and vegetables like: bananas, tomatoes, cabbage, lettuce and onions, among others. Her two older children help her because her husband is currently ill due to a past accident he suffered. Her goal is to continue working until her grandchildren become professionals. Elidia de los Ángeles P. S. sells crafts, cosmetics and sandals. This business used to belong to her mother but she took it over. Socorro Benita Rodríguez López is one of the main paper suppliers to eateries in Masaya.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es: Priscila, de 53 años, es una mujer muy alegre y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Walter de 52 años y su querida hija Pamela de 16 años, quienes son el motivo de todos sus esfuerzos. El trabajo que realiza Priscila es el cultivo de arvejas, espinacas y zanahoria, esta labor la realiza junto a su esposo, quien también trabaja arduamente para obtener ingresos para su familia. Ella ha visto por conveniente llevar sus productos hasta el mercado mayorista de la ciudad de Tarma, ya que según manifiesta, es ahí donde mejores ganancias obtiene. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden amenazar su productividad, lleva 30 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos, ya que el camino es muy largo y agotador. Con el tiempo, espera comprar nuevas tierras para incrementar sus cultivos y con su venta pueda mejorar sus ingresos económicos. Este es el séptimo crédito con MFP, se siente en la obligación de pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que no quiere causarle problemas a las socias de su banco comunal, en donde es muy querida. Con los mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más abono para mejorar la productividad de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Priscila is 53 years old. She is a very cheerful and hard-working woman. She lives in her own house with her husband Walter, who is 52 years old, and her dear daughter Pamela, 16. They are the reason for all her efforts. Priscila grows peas, spinach and carrots for a living. This she does with her husband who also works very hard to earn an income for their family. For convenience sake she brings her products to the wholesale market in the city of Tarma. It is here that she can obtain the best price. What she likes most about her job is protecting her crops from the pests that can threaten her production. She has been doing this for 30 years and considers transporting her products the most difficult since the trip is long and exhausting. In time, she hopes to buy mO. land to increase her crop production and increase her income with the sales. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is committed to making her payments on time since she does not want to cause problems for the other members of her communal bank where she is well-liked. With the 1500 nuevos soles (Peruvian currency) that she is requesting, she will buy mO. fertilizer to increase her crop production.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase bags of fertilizer

loans.name: Gerardo Ramon

texts.es: Gerardo Ramón S. R. es un hombre de 65 años cuyo oficio aprendió desde su adolescencia y en más de 47 años de la realización del mismo sigue sintiéndose con fuerzas para “echarle ganar aún más tiempo”. Él es agricultor, además se dedica a la compra-venta de leña y siembras. En su labor diaria recibe ayuda de sus hijos y sus nietos, pero siente la pena de la enfermedad de su conyugue, quien por su avanzada edad no puede ayudarle como en los años de su juventud.
texts.en:
Gerardo Ramón S. R. is a 65 year old man who learned his craft as an adolescent and after 47 years of working still feels strong enough to “hang in there a bit longer.” He is a farmer and also buys and sells firewood and his crops. His children and grandchildren help him in his daily tasks. But he is sad about his spouse’s illness who, because of advanced age, can’t help him like in his younger years.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Soledad

texts.es: Soledad, de 52 años, es una mujer muy trabajadora y sincera, vive en su casa propia junto a su hijo menor Alan de 23 años, quien siempre la ayuda en el trabajo. La actividad a la que Soledad se dedica es la venta de leña y es muy solicitada por sus clientes. Con 30 años en este negocio desea para el futuro de su trabajo, incrementar la cantidad de leña que tiene para vender y así tener plata para pagar los estudios superiores de su hijo, a quien cuida con mucho amor y siempre se ha preocupado por que no le falte nada. Ella disfruta de conversar con sus clientes y siempre suelta una broma para llevarse mejor con ellos, ya que su principal estrategia de venta es la alegría que le pone a todo lo que hace, lo que menos le gusta es estar molesta y más aun si lo esta cuando vende, ya que no quiere alejar los clientes que ya tiene ganados. Es el octavo crédito con MFP, se siente muy feliz por haberlo obtenido y se ha comprometido a pagarlo con todas las socias de su banco comunal. Con los dos mil quinientos nuevos soles que solicita, comprará más madera para tener una buena reserva en su negocio.
texts.en:
Soledad, 52, is a very hard working, sincere woman. She lives in her own house with her youngest son, Alan, 23, who always helps her with the work. Soledad’s activity is firewood sales; she is highly sought after by her customers. She has been in this business for 30 years and wants for the future to increase the amount of firewood that she has on hand to sell in order to have enough money to pay for her son’s higher education. She has always cared for him lovingly and been concerned that he always has everything he needs. She enjoys chatting with her customers and always has a joke ready to get along with them better since her main sales strategy is the joy she puts into everything she does. What she most dislikes is being upset and more so when she is selling because she doesn’t want to scare her customers away. This is her 8th loan with MFP. She is happy to have gotten it and pledges to repay along with all the members of her communal bank. She will use the requested 2500 new soles to buy more wood in order to have a good reserve supply for her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more firewood.

loans.name: Luisa Amanda

texts.es: Luisa Amanda tiene 48 años de edad, su actividad económica es brindar el servicio de taxi, con la ayuda de su esposo es que han logrado salir adelante, por lo que no es la primera vez que realiza financiamiento pues ha sido de muy buena ayuda. Ella está buscando la manera de mejorar sus ingresos para mantener su hogar, ya que inicio con fondos propios. Este crédito será invertido en cambio de llantas, pintura entre otras cosas. El desea obtener otro taxi y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Luisa Amanda is 48 years old and provides taxi services. With the help of her husband, they have manages to get ahead. The loans have been of great help; this will not be her first one. She is looking for a way to increase her income to support her household. She started her business with her own funds and will use the money from this loan to buy new tires, paint, and other things. She would like to buy another taxi and fix up her house.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle maintenance

loans.name: Faustino Gregorio

texts.es: El señor Faustino Gregorio C. G., tiene la edad de 42 años habita en el barrio Pablo C., es casado y su esposa realiza las tareas del hogar y le apoya en los trabajos de la finca, ellos tiene 4 hijos menores de edad, que se dedican a estudiar la escuela secundaria, desde hace mas de 20 años que se dedican  a la agricultura, gracias al apoyo de la Reforma  Agraria que lograron adquirir unos terrenos, ellos habitan en las faldas de un  volcán, pero los gases han afectado de sobremanera su producción, es por esta razón que solicita un  préstamo para la compra de fertilizantes, fungicidas, e insumos vegetativos que permitan un mantenimiento mas optimo, con el objetivo de aumentar la producción de sus cosechas para mejorar los volúmenes de venta que le aseguren mejores condiciones económicas para el buen desarrollo de sus hijos sobretodo los estudios del mayor que pronto entrara a la universidad y esperan tener los recursos necesarios para poyarlo en sus estudios profesionales.
texts.en:
Mr. Faustino Gregorio C. G., 42, lives in the Pablo C. neighborhood. He’s married and his wife’s a housewife but she also helps him with the farm work. They have four minor children who go to secondary school. They have been in farming for over 20 years. They were able to acquire farmland thanks to the Agrarian Reform. They live on the slopes of a volcano and gases from it have greatly affected production. For this reason he is asking for funding to buy fertilizers, fungicides and farming supplies that will make it possible for him to give optimal maintenance to the soil hoping to increase production for better sales insuring higher income for his children’s development, especially his eldest’s educational expenses since he is soon to start university and they hope to have necessary funds to support his professional studies.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To provide optimal care to his fields.

loans.name: Ynocente

texts.es: Ynocente, de 47 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Mila de 45 años y su único hijo Renzo de 16 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La siembra de papa, espinaca y alverja es la actividad a la que se dedica Ynocente, todas las mañanas trabaja sus tierras para poderlas hacer más fértiles y productivas. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro, ya que saben que tiene que trabajar en todo lo que puedan, ya que la educación de su hijo les demanda muchos gastos. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus cultivos de las plagas que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 32 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar sus productos hasta el mercado de Tarma, que es donde vende sus cultivos. Dentro de unos días, espera cosechar sus productos y venderlos a buen precio en el mercado. Este es el quinto crédito con MFP, sabe que tiene que pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, si no desea causarle problemas a su banco comunal, en el cual es un socio muy responsable y puntual. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará nuevas semillas de arveja, espinacas y papa, también comprará abono para cuidar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Ynocente is 47 years old and is a simple hard working man who lives in his own home with his wife, 45 year old Mila, and his only son, 16 year old Renzo. He wants to give them a better quality of life. He raises potatoes, spinach, and peas. Every morning, Ynocente works his land to make it more fertile and productive and he and his wife work together very hard. They know that they must work all they can because their son’s education is expensive. What he enjoys most about his work is caring for his crops and preventing them from getting disease. He’s been doing this for 32 years and he considers the most difficult part to be transporting his goods to the market in Tarma, where he sells his harvest. Within a few days he expects to harvest his current crops and sell them for a good price in the market. This will be his fifth loan through MFP and he knows that he must make all of his payments on time, so as not to cause problems for his communal bank. There his is a very responsible member. He will use the 2,000 PEN ($725) from this loan to buy new seed for peas, spinach, and potatoes. He will also buy fertilizer to care for his crops.

Translated from Spanish by Hugo Reyes, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Seed and fertilizer

loans.name: Julio Cesar
