texts.es: El señor Julio Cesar E. de 66 años se ha dedicado desde su juventud a la elaboración de zapatos y es esta materia la que le ha servido para salir adelante y mantener a su familia, a pesar de su avanzada edad, nos cuenta que aún tiene las fortalezas para preparar un encargo semanal o quincenal de zapatos y entregarlos en los departamentos del norte del país que es donde principalmente comercializa sus productos.
texts.en:
Julio Cesar E., 66, has worked since he was young making shoes. This work has allowed him to get ahead and support his family. In spite of his advanced age, he tells us that he still has the strength to fill his weekly or bi-weekly orders for shoes and deliver them in departments (administrative regions) in the northern part of the country, which is where he sells most of his products.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy materials to make shoes

loans.name: Yulver

texts.es: Yulver, de 36 años, es un hombre muy sencillo y trabajador, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposa Roselin de 30 años y sus dos queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Los extensos campos de sembrado que posee Yulver, son el fruto de una vida de arduo trabajo y una firme convicción de sobresalir en la vida, sus productos son muy solicitados en el mercado mayorista de Tarma, ya que su fama de cosechar cultivos de calidad le ayuda a vender sus productos a muy buenos precios. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cuidar sus sembríos de la plaga que pueden aquejarlos, lleva 24 años realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los sacos de papa y arveja, ya que son muy pesados y le cansan mucho. En adelante, espera comprarse un carro, con el cual pueda hacer más fácil el traslado de sus productos. Este es el tercer crédito con MFP, sabe que el dinero del crédito le será muy beneficioso para el desarrollo de su trabajo. En su banco comunal es un socio muy alegre y siempre pone orden en las reuniones. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que solicita, comprará abono para sus sembríos, ya que desea que sus cultivos sean más productivos.
texts.en:
Yulver, 36, is an unassuming, hard working man. He lives in his own house with his wife, Roselin, 30, and their two beloved children for whom he wants to provide a better quality of life. Yulver’s extensive planted fields are the result of a lifetime of hard work and firm conviction to get ahead in life. His products are highly sought after in Tarma’s wholesale market because he’s famous for producing high quality crops and this helps him sell for very good prices. What he most enjoys about his work is protecting his crops from infestations that can damage them. He has been a farmer for 24 years and considers the most difficult part to be transporting the sack of potatoes and peas, which are very heavy and tire him out. In the future he’d like to buy a car so that product transport will be easier. This is his 3rd loan with MFP. He knows that the money from the loan will be very beneficial for his work’s development. He is a cheerful member of his communal bank and he always imposes order during the meetings. He will use the requested 2000 new soles to buy manure for his plantings so that his crops will be more productive.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure.

loans.name: Charlott Jeanethe

texts.es: Charlott Jeanethe M. R. de 30 años se dedica desde hace tiempo ya a la venta de frijoles y leña en su casa de habitación. No es la primera vez que esta mujer abnegada realiza alguna actividad económica para poder llevar un sustento a su casa, antes se dedicaba a la venta de refrescos y gaseosas pero después de un tiempo no pudo seguir y luego de una pausa inició con el que ahora es su negocio.
texts.en:
Charlott Jeanethe M. R., 30, has sold beans and firewood from home for a long time. This isn’t the first time this selfless woman has undertaken economic activity in order to bring sustenance to her home. She used to sell soft drinks and beverages but after a time was unable to continue. After a break she started her current business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Los Naranjos lo integran Abimal Arsenio M., Francisca Teodora V. y Lino Nemecio M.. Abimal, quien es el coordinador del grupo se dedica desde hace 10 años a la profesión de sastre en su casa de habitación, el utilizará el crédito en la compra de tela y materiales para la elaboración de uniformes y demás productos. Fancisca y Lino se dedican a la venta de frutas y verduras en el M. municipal de Masaya.
texts.en:
Abimal Arsenio M., Francisca Teodora Velásquez and Lino Nemecio M. are the members of the “Los Naranjos” (The Orange Trees) communal bank. Abimal, who is group Coordinator, has been a tailor for the last 10 years. His shop is in his house. He will use the loan to buy fabric and supplies to make uniforms and other products. Francisca and Lino are fruit and vegetable merchants in Masaya’s Municipal Market.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabric.

loans.name: Antonela Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Antonela lo conforman Lea Judith F. V., Ana de los Milagros F. B. y Claudia María A. B., tres mujeres con distintas actividades económicas que comparten la solidaridad y el empeño de seguir trabajando juntas.

Lea, quien es la coordinadora del grupo se dedica a la venta de prendas de lujo como pulseras, anillos y cadenas de oro y plata; Ana en cambio vende ropa de manera ambulante en la comunidad de Nindirí y finalmente Claudia vende cosméticos y productos de las compañías AVON y ZERMAT a sus familiares, conocidos y recomendados.
texts.en:
The Antonela solidarity group is made up of Lea Judith F. V., Ana de los Milagros F. Beharano, and Claudia Maria A. B.. They are three women with distinct jobs who share in solidarity and determination to continue working together. Lea, the group coordinator, sells luxury items such as gold and silver bracelets, rings and chains. Ana sells clothing as a street vendor in the Nindiri community. Finally, Claudia sells cosmetics and Avon and Zermat products to her relatives, acquaintances and referrals.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Maria Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario María se encuentra conformado por María de Jesús R. T. de 40 años, María Auxiliadora A. M.  de 33 y Sonia del Carmen Hernández de 27 años, tres féminas luchadoras del departamento de Masaya.

María de Jesús es la coordinadora y se dedica a la venta de ropa bordada para niñas de manera ambulante en Nindirí y Masaya, ella misma realiza los bordados y fabrica la ropa, dado que ya hace tiempo atrás que aprendió este oficio y decidió sacarle provecho.

María Auxiliadora es fotógrafa, tiene un estudio en su casa de habitación donde cualquiera puede llegar y solicitar sus servicios ya sea en el mismo local o a domicilio; finalmente Sonia, quien es la más joven está incursionando en el comercio de la venta de ropa, pero recibe buenos consejos de sus compañeras de grupo.
texts.en:
The María solidarity group is made up of María de Jesús R. T., age 40; María Auxiliadora A. M., age 33; and Sonia del Carmen Hernández, age 27. They are three hard-working women from the Masaya department. María de Jesús is the group coordinator, and she sells embroidered children's clothing in the street markets of Nindiri and Masaya. She does the embroidery herself and makes the clothing, since she learned the trade long ago and decided to take advantage of it. María Auxiliadora is a photographer. She has a studio in her home, where anyone can go and request her services, either in her location or in their homes. Finally, Sonia, who is the youngest member, is just entering into clothing sales, but she gets good advice from her group members.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of material

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace dos años, pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo,  departamento de Puno, tiene 19 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, tiene estudios de secundaria completa.  Julia tiene un hijo de año y siete meses.
Ella trabaja junto a su esposo en la elaboración de antenas para televisión, las lleva a vender a La Paz - Bolivia, así mismo vende abarrotes en su tienda. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital en compra de abarrotes.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 2500.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar su mercadería y una parte en comprar alambres para elaboración de antenas.
Su visión es comprar máquinas de coser para confeccionar ropas en La Paz - Bolivia. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son las reuniones y las conversaciones que se dan.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the community bank named Chojchoni for the past 2 years. She lives in the district of Copani located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 19 years old and she lives with her boyfriend. She graduated high school. Julia has a 19-month old son. She works together with her boyfriend, making antennas for television. She sells them in La Paz, Bolivia. She also sells groceries from her store. With her first loan from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) in the amount of 500 nuevos soles she purchased grocery store items for her store. She requests a new loan in the amount of 2500 neuvos soles and it will be used to increase her merchandise and to purchase wire to make antennas. Her dream is to purchase sewing machines to make clothing in La Paz. What she most likes about the community bank is the meetings and the talks that are given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase grocery store items and wire to make tv antennas.

loans.name: Hermelinda

texts.es: Hermelinda tiene 52 años, es una madre de familia con mucho coraje, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo, sus 6 hijos y sus 9 nietos, por quienes se esfuerza a diario. Durante toda su vida vendía comida  y siempre estuvo al pendiente de las obras de construcción, como: el proyecto de alcantarillado, reparación de pistas y demás obras públicas,, para que pueda ofrecer su platillos a los trabajadores e ingenieros de dichas obras, siendo al final el pago cada fin de semana. Actualmente y con el apoyo de su esposo y sus hijos, lograron instalar cabinas para ofrecer el servicio de Internet, en donde sus nietos la ayudan en la atención de sus clientes, controlando el tiempo que tiene utilizando el servicio. Como si fuera, esa emprendedora mujer, trabaja también los sábados y domingo, vendiendo parrillas y polladas, ya que es el negocio que más le apasiona hacer. Su mayor anhelo es ampliar el segundo piso de su casa y poder trasladarse toda su familia para su comodidad propia. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas como lo estuvo haciendo con los demás prestamos, puesto que sabe que le es de mucha utilidad. Con este crédito que solicita, colocará rejas para cercar los perímetros de la puerta de su casa, para proteger su negocio.
texts.en:
Hermelinda is a 52-year-old mother who has a lot of courage. She lives in her own home with her husband and their 6 children and 9 grandchildren, for whom she strives daily. She has sold food all her life, and she has always kept on the lookout for construction sites, such as sewer projects, road repairs and public works, so that she can offer her dishes to the workers and engineers. Currently, with the help of her husband and children, they have been able to build stalls to offer an internet service. Her grandchildren help attend to these customers, monitoring the time that customers use this service. This enterprising woman also works on Saturdays and Sundays, selling grilled food and barbecued chicken, since this is the business that she is most passionate about. Her greatest wish is to expand the second floor of her house and be able to spread out her family for everyone's personal comfort. This is her tenth loan with MFP, and she promises to repay all of the quotas as she has repaid the previous loans, since she knows that this is very useful. With the requested loan, she will install bars around the perimeter of her home, to protect her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installing bars to protect her house and business

loans.name: Monte Verde Group

texts.es: El grupo solidario Monte Verde es coordinado por Juana Mercedes M. N. de 23 años, ella vende frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de la ciudad de Masaya desde hace más de 2 años, su giro principal es comprar cosechas completas para revender al por mayor y al menudeo. Las otras integrantes del grupo son, Lizett Marbelly López y Rogelio José Abulto P., ellos al igual que su coordinadora venden frutas y verduras en el mercado de Masaya.
texts.en:
The Monte Verde solidarity group is coordinated by Juana Mercedes M. N., age 23. She has sold fruits and vegetables in the municipal market of the city of Masaya for over 2 years. She mainly buys whole harvests to resell at wholesale and retail prices. The other group members are Lizett Marbelly López and Rogelio José Abulto P.. They, like their coordinator, sell fruits and vegetables in the Masaya market.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: for the purchase of merchandise for her clothing sales business

loans.name: Sidey

texts.es: Sidey Q. R., tiene la edad de 28 años, es casada, y tiene 2 hijos que son su mayor prioridad. Ella quiere comprar almacigo de café  para sembrarlo y aumentar la cantidad de café en producción a su beneficio y de terreno en uso. Además, su finca ya tiene una parte de café la cual quiere resembrar para mejorarla y a su vez sembrar una parte del terreno que se perdió por falta de mantenimiento en años atrás. Tiene varios años que se dedica a su finca y quiere crecer. Es el primer préstamo que ha recibido de FUDECOSUR. Ella no tenía problemas en su propiedad, pero si tiene el deseo de sea una finca productiva. También, ella no  ha realizados otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le brindó el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de interés es mucho más baja. Ella también tiene el deseo de brindarles a sus hijos la educación necesaria  para que sean en el futuro una persona preparada y pueda enfrentar de manera más fácil la vida.
texts.en:
Sidey Q. R., age 28, is married and has 2 children who are her highest priority. She wants to purchase coffee seeds to plant and increase her coffee production. On her farm, there is already an area seeded with coffee, which she wants to re-seed in order to improve it. She also wants to sow an area of land that she lost for lack of maintenance a few years ago. She has been a farmer for several years and she wants to expand. This is her first loan from FUDECOSUR. She has not had problems with her property, but she wants to have a productive farm. Also, she has not received any loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR offered her a loan with better terms and a much lower interest rate. She also wants to offer her children the necessary education so that in the future they will be prepared and more able to handle life.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: coffee planting

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desD. hace ocho años, pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 42 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, con grado D. instrucción primaria incompleta, tiene dos hijos que son independientes.
Julia se dedica a la compra - venta D. sacos D. yute (tela) al por mayor y menor en las ferias D.: Yunguyo, Desaguadero y Chaca chaca. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela R., que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó su capital D. trabajo.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para comprar sacos D. yute.
Su visión es tener una tienda D. abarrotes. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los préstamos y los ahorros.
texts.en:
Julia has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past two years. She lives in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 42 years old and she is married. She did not finish graD. school. She has two children who are grown and independent. Julia buys and sells jute burlap sacks in wholesale and retail at different fairs in Yunguyo, Desaguadero and in Chaca Chaca. Her first loan requested from Manuela R. (Kiva Field Partner) was used as working capital. This new loan requested is in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase more burlap sacks. Her dream is to have a grocery store. What she most likes about her community bank are the loans and savings programs.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase burlap to make sacks.

loans.name: Ildika

texts.en:
Ildika is an entrepreneur who makes a living selling socks, lingerie, tops, shirts and other items at the Albion Market in her home town of Uzhgorod. She has been in business for 15 years, and has many loyal customers who come to buy from her because they trust the quality of her merchandise and enjoy her friendly and respectful service. She earns about 5,000 Grivnas in profit each month.

Ildika has used micro-loans in the past and found them to be a very useful way to expand her business. She is applying for a loan for 20,000 Grivnas to increase the size and scope of the items she has to sell. She would like to buy clothing for the fall season so that she can increase her sales and make additional income.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Rey De Reyes Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Rey de Reyes lo integran Mirna María López M. de 29 años, Virginia del Carmen Rodríguez Martínez de 41 y Ayda Lea González González de 35. Mirna, la coordinadora del grupo, se dedica a la venta de frituras y platanitos de manera ambulante en su comunidad y en los colegios aledaños. Virginia, vende leña y carbón en su casa de habitación; y Ayda se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catalogo y además vende hielo y helados en su casa.

Estas mujeres desean aumentar su capital de trabajo e invertirán el monto prestado en la compra de más materia prima para seguir laborando.
texts.en:
Mirna María López M., 29, Virginia del Carmen Rodríguez Martínez, 41,and Ayda Lea González González, 35, make up the “Rey de Reyes” (King of Kings) communal bank. Mirna is group Coordinator. She sells fried snacks and fried banana chips throughout her community and nearby schools. Virginia sells firewood and charcoal from home and Ayda sells catalogue cosmetics and also sells ice and ice cream in her home. These women aim to increase their working capital and will invest the total loan in the purchase of more ingredients and raw materials to continue working.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ingredients.

loans.name: Mil Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mil se encuentra conformado por María Esther Pérez B., Lesbia Marina Pérez B. y Karla Patricia Pérez, tres mujeres emprendedoras y con deseos de superación. María Esther, quien es la coordinadora se dedica a la venta ambulante de ropa nueva y venta de cosméticos los cuales compra en el mercado al por mayor para revender al menudeo. Ella inició hace tres años cuando le encargaron una ropa y ella la compro y vendió, posteriormente decidió dedicarse a esta actividad.

Lesbia, es docente de artes y ha laborado por más de 20 años en esta actividad en distintas instituciones ONG´s; y Karla diseña, elabora y vende bisutería, al igual que la venta de perfumería, cosméticos y demás productos de las compañías AVON y ZERMAT.
texts.en:
María Esther Pérez B., Lesbia Marina Pérez B. and Karla Patricia Pérez, three enterprising women with a desire for self-improvement, make up the Mil (Thousand) communal bank. María Esther, group Coordinator, sells clothes and cosmetics that she buys at wholesale in the market for subsequent resale at retail. She started three years ago when she got orders for clothes and she bought them and sold them. Later on she decided to go into this business. Lesbia is an arts teacher and has worked for over 20 years in this activity for various NGOs. Karla designs, makes and sells costume jewelry. She also sells AVON and ZERMAT brand cosmetics and perfumes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Desididas Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Desididas lo conforman Yolanda del Carmen S., Claudia Leticia Gómez M. y Elizabeth del Carmen O. C., tres mujeres con actividades económicas distintas pero con la meta de seguir siempre progresando en sus vidas y en sus negocios.

Yolanda, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica desde su casa de habitación a la venta de carne de res y hueso, ella desea incursionar en la venta de carne porcina y es éste el propósito del préstamo otorgado. Claudia, se dedica a la fabricación y venta de nacatamales los días jueves, viernes y fines de semana; y finalmente Elizabeth, se dedica a la venta de cosméticos y ropa nueva de manera ambulante en las cercanías de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Yolanda del Carmen S., Claudia Leticia Gómez M. and Elizabeth del Carmen O. C., three women with distinct economic activities but with the common goal to continue progressing both in life and in business, make up the “Desididas” (Decided Ones) communal bank. Yolanda is the group Coordinator and sells beef and soup bones from home. She wants to start selling pork and this is the purpose of the granted loan. Claudia makes nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) for sale on Thursdays, Fridays and weekends. And finally, Elizabeth sells cosmetic and new clothing around her neighborhood.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Barrio Loco Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Barrio Loco se encuentra integrado por Clara Isabel García Z. de 32 años, Claudia Verónica E. R. de 34 años y Carlos Antonio Hernández F. de 27 años. Clara, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica a la venta de productos AVON y de ropa nueva y usada 3 días a la semana, ella vende ambulante pero ya tiene una ruta marcada la cual recorre en cada ocasión con pequeños cambios de una o dos cuadras para captar nuevos clientes. Ella inició hace apenas medio año a dedicarse a esto; antes era ama de casa pero por la situación económica decidió buscar trabajo en la zona franca y estuvo ahí por casi un año. Esta joven mujer de 32 años recibe ayuda de su hija mayor de 15 años en sus actividades comerciales y su meta es ver triunfadores a sus 5 hijos.

Claudia, vende productos ESKIMO en su casa de habitación, así mismo vende perfumes los cuales muchas veces son encargados. Carlos, es albañil y también vende productos ESKIMO en su casa, así mismo en su hogar vende carnes. Este es el ejemplo de tres personas luchadoras que buscan distintas actividades económicas para lograr llevar una mejor calidad de vida a sus respectivos hogares.
texts.en:
Clara Isabel García Z., 32, Claudia Verónica E. R., 34, and Carlos Antonio Hernández F., 27, are the members of “Barrio Loco” (Crazy Neighborhood) communal bank. Clara, group Coordinator, sells AVON products and new and used clothing three days a week. She has a set route that she covers each time with small, one or two block detours, to get new customers. She just started half a year ago; she used to be a housewife but due to the economic situation she decided to find work in the free zone and was there for almost a year. This young 32-year-old gets help with her activities from her 15-year-old daughter. Her goal is to see her five children succeed. Claudia sells ESKIMO products from home; she also sells perfumes that are sometimes ordered from her. Carlos is a bricklayer and also sells ESKIMO products from home where he also sells meats. These are three examples of tenacious people who seek different economic activities to attain a better quality of life for their respective homes.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Geraldin Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Geraldin lo conforman Reina Patricia Mátuz García de 47 años, Maclovia del Carmen Hernández López de 36 años y Blanca Rosa Hernández Álvarez de 36 años, tres mujeres emprendedoras que se dedican a trabajar para darle una vida mejor a sus familias.

Reina, la coordinadora del grupo elabora tortillas desde que tenía 15 años de edad cuando le ayudaba a su mamá y a esa edad ella inició su camino a la independencia económica; ya con 32 años de experiencia ella desea poner en su casa de habitación, que es donde fabrica las tortillas, una especie de cafetín donde pueda vender café, refrescos y bocadillos.

Maclovia, junto a su conyugue, se dedica a la compra/venta de chatarra, inicio hace 12 cuando su esposo, que trabajaba en un chatarrería, decidió iniciar el giro de negocio que más conocía por cuenta propia. En cambio Blanca, posee una pulpería la cual inició hace 10 años como una pequeña ventecita de granos básicos.
texts.en:
The support group Geraldin is made up of Reina Patricia Mátuz García who is 47 years old, Maclovia del Carmen Hernández López who is 36 years old and Blanca Rosa Hernández Álvarez who is also 36 years old. The three enterprising woman are dedicated to working to give their families better lives. Reina, the coordinator of the group has been making tortillas since she was 15 when she helped her mother. It was at that age that she began her journey to economic independence. Now, with 32 years of experience, she wants to build a small cafe in her house, where she makes the tortillas, so she can sell coffee, sodas and sandwiches. Maclovia, together with her spouse, works buying and selling junk food. She and her husband began doing this 12 years ago and they work in a junk food shop. Maclovia decided to begin this line of business that is very well known on its own. On the other hand, Blanca owns a local store which she began 10 years ago as a small shop that sold basic grains.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy consumables

loans.name: Alfarero Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Alfarero lo integran Irene Auxiliadora T. U. de 39 años, Heydi Natalia R. U. de 22 años y Fabiola del Carmen B. M. de 27 años; tres mujeres que han sabido hacerle frente a la vida a pesar de afrontarla a temprana edad.

Irene, quien es la coordinadora, se dedica desde hace 3 años a la compra/venta de oro y plata, inició con poco capital propio invirtiendo en algunas prendas y revendiéndolas a un precio mayor y en esta ocasión utilizará el crédito que le brinda la institución para la compra de prendas de mayor valor. Heydi es estilista en su hogar y a domicilio, además vende ropa en su casa de habitación; por otro lado Fabiola tiene en su hogar una venta de gaseosas, cervezas y productos ESKIMO.
texts.en:
The communal bank Alfarero is composed of Irene Auxiliadora T. U., 39 years old, Heydi Natalia R. U., 22 years old, and Fabiola del Carmen B. M., 27 years old, three women who have learned to manage in life despite being young. Irene, who is the coordinator, has been buying and selling gold and silver for a living for 3 years. She started, with a little of her own capital, by buying jewelry and reselling it for a higher price. She will use this loan to buy higher value jewelry. Heydi works at home as a stylist in addition to selling clothing out of her home. Fabiola sells soda, beer and Eskimo products out of her home.

Translated from Spanish by Ann Achilli, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase merchandise for their businesses

loans.name: La Esquinita Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Esquinita está integrado por Mirna Lorena L. Elías, Arianne Liceth Gudiel Sánchez y Rosario del Socorro R.. Mirna, quien es coordinadora, posee en su casa de habitación una pulpería que inició hace 8 años vendiendo pan y algunas verduras. Su sueño es verse a sí misma y a sus hijos en prosperidad.

Arianne, vende por catálogo ropa íntima y productos ZERMAT; en cambio Rosario, se dedica a la venta de ropa de segunda mano y productos de AVON, a la vez tiene una mini venta de verduras en su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
The La Esquinita solidarity group is made up of Mirna Lorena L. Elías, Arianne Liceth Gudiel Sánchez and Rosario del Socorro R.. Mirna, who is the coordinator, has a general store in her home, which she started 8 years ago selling bread and some vegetables. Her dream is to see herself and her children in prosperity. Arianne sells lingerie and ZERMAT products through a catalogue. Rosario sells second-hand clothing and AVON products. She also has a small vegetable sales business in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

loans.name: Mi Banquito Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario Mi Banquito lo conforman 5 mujeres luchadoras y emprendedoras que se esfuerzan día a día por seguir adelante en sus distintas actividades económicas. Maria Luisa López Morán, de 35 años de edad, es la coordinadora del grupo y se dedica a la venta de productos AVON y ZERMAT, así como a la venta de otros cosméticos y accesoR. de uso personal que compra en el mercado al por mayor. Su sueño es reparar su casa de habitación y que sus hijos sean unos profesionales.

Maria Auxiliadora R. M., realiza todo tipo de trabajos de corte y confección en su hogar, además tiene 4 años de vender productos AVON; Rosa Emilia López Morán tiene un trabajo fijo como doméstica y también vende por encargo electrodomésticos, ropa interior y zapatos; Vilma Esther Cerna Bonilla vende en su casa de habitación helados y chocobananos además es distribuidora de hielo para algunas comiderías del sector; finalmente Engracia de la Concepción Morán vende cosméticos por catálogo y accesoR. de uso personal que compra en el mercado.
texts.en:
The Mi Banquito solidarity group is made up of 5 hard-working and enterprising women who strive day to day to get ahead in their different businesses. Maria Luisa L. M., age 35, is the group coordinator and sells AVON and ZERMAT products. She also sells other cosmetics and personal accessories which she buys wholesale in the market. Her dream is to repair her house, and for her children to be professionals. Maria Auxiliadora R. M. does all types of sewing and tailoring work in her home, and she has been selling AVON products for 4 years. Rosa Emilia López Morán has a steady job as a maid and also sells home appliances on order, and underwear and shoes. Vilma Esther Cerna Bonilla sells ice cream and chocolate bananas in her home, and she also distributes ice for some local eateries. Finally, Engracia de la Concepción Morán sells cosmetics through a catalogue, and personal accessories that she purchases in the market.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of products

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eloisa Jazmin

texts.es: Doña Eloísa Jazmín Chávez Sánchez de 47 años de edad tiene en su casa de habitación una pequeña tienda de ropa usada donde también vende bisuterías, ella inició comprando una paca de ropa hace 6 años y vendiéndole a conocidos y vecinos. En la tienda ella recibe ayuda de su hija menor de 28 años; su objetivo es poseer el capital suficiente para alquilar otro local que tenga buena ubicación y poner otra tienda ahí, siendo atendida una de las tiendas por ella y otra por su hija. El único problema económico que tiene es que hay temporadas bajas pero en ellas se auxilia con la clientela fija.
texts.en:
Eloísa Jazmín Chávez Sánchez, age 47, has a small used clothing store in her home where she also sells costume jewelery. She started her business 6 years ago, buying a package of clothing and selling it to acquaintances and neighbours. Her youngest daughter, age 28, helps her in the store. Her goal is to have enough capital to rent another venue in a good location and open another store in it, with one of the stores attended by her and the other by her daughter. Her only economic problem is the low season, but during this she is sustained by her steady customers.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of household goods

loans.name: Rosario De Fatima

texts.es: Doña Rosario de Fátima R. B. de 53 años fue trabajadora de una importante institución bancaria del país, por problemas de salud fue jubilada antes de tiempo y desde ese entonces se dedica a la venta de productos de las marcas AVON, ZERMAT, ORIFLAME, pero sobre todo LOVABLE; sus principales clientes son ex compañeras y ex compañeros de trabajo. Ella además de los ingresos por venta de estos productos también recibe su pensión. Su objetivo es poder seguir trabajando mientras Dios le de las fuerzas para hacerlo.
texts.en:
Rosario de Fátima R. B., age 53, worked in an important banking institution of Nicaragua, but due to health problems she retired. Since then she has sold AVON, ZERMAT and ORIFLAME products; but mostly LOVABLE brand products. Her main customers are her former co-workers. She receives a pension on top of the income from these products. Her goal is to keep working as long as God gives her the strength to do so.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: the purchase of consumables

loans.name: Petrona Del Carmen

texts.es:
Doña Petrona del Carmen Pérez Sánchez de 53 años de edad vende ropa de segunda mano en su comunidad, ella sale a vender de manera ambulante día de por medio, además vende nacatamales los días viernes, sábados y domingos. Ella antes de dedicarse a esta actividad realizaba viajes al norte del país y compraba queso para revenderlo acá en Managua; sin embargo ésta actividad económica no le resultaba en ciertas temporadas, principalmente lluviosas así que decidió cambiar de giro de negocio.

Doña Petrona con el crédito otorgado piensa cambiar nuevamente su actividad económica, dedicándose ahora a la venta de granos básicos. Su sueño es que Dios le ayude a realizarse en sus planes de negocio y que pueda seguir adelante.
texts.en:
Petrona del Carmen Pérez Sánchez, 53, sells used clothes in her community. She goes out on her selling runs every other day. She also sells nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) on Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays. Before going into this business she would travel to the north of the country to buy cheese to resell in Managua. However, this activity didn’t have positive results in some seasons, especially during the rainy season, so she decided to change lines of work. She will use the loan to once again change jobs. Now she will sell basic grains. She dreams that God will help her bring her business plans to fruition so that she can continue forward.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Irma Del Socorro

texts.es: Irma del Socorro M. posee en su hogar una pulpería desde hace 6 años, en su juventud ella trabajó de doméstica y de casi cualquier actividad u oportunidad económica que se le presentase, luego de dedicarse a la venta de nacatamales decidió probar suerte vendiendo meneítos, cigarros y chiverías; sin embargo se mantuvo así por mucho tiempo y fue con el primer crédito que adquirió que ella logró que su negocio empezara a crecer. Su meta para el futuro es que su negocio se haga aún más grande.
texts.en:
Irma del Socorro M. has had a grocery store in her home for the last 6 years. In her youth she was a domestic employee and worked at whatever activity or economic opportunity came her way. After selling nacatamales (Nicaraguan tamales popular as weekend fare) she decided to try her luck selling meneitos (cheese puffs), cigarettes and yoghurt snacks. For a long time this is how she remained but with the first loan she got her business started to grow. Her goal for the future is that her store be even larger.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy merchandise.

loans.name: Mariana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Mariana del Carmen García A. de 51 años de edad es dueña de un bar cafetín, inició dicho negocio hace aproximadamente 6 años vendiendo fritanga, luego con ayuda de su yerno y de los créditos que le habían otorgados logro comprar activos fijos como mesas, sillas e incluso entechó y embaldosó una parte del local, ahora con el nuevo préstamo piensa terminar de embaldosar e invertir en más productos.
texts.en:
Mariana del Carmen García A., 51, owns a snack bar. She started the business about 6 years ago selling fried snacks. Then, with help from her son-in-law and loans she had gotten, she bought fixed assets like tables and chairs. She even roofed and tiled part of the locale. She plans to use the new loan to finish tiling and to buy more products.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Carlos Manuel

texts.es: Carlos Manuel B. Díaz es dueño y conductor de una moto taxi en Ciudad Sandino, el inició hace 6 años cuando decidió comprar su propio medio de transporte después de trabajar vendiendo repuestos de vehículos por 12 años. El piensa utilizar el crédito otorgado para darle mantenimiento al que hoy es su principal fuente de trabajo.
texts.en:
Carlos Manuel B. Díaz is the owner and driver of a moto taxi in Ciudad Sandino. He began this business 6 years ago when he decided to buy his own form of transportation after he worked selling spare parts for vehicles for 12 years. He wants to use the loan granted to him to maintain his vehicle, which today is his main form of work.

Translated from Spanish by Alison Fanning, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Vehicle repairs

loans.name: Karla Vanesa

texts.es: Karla Vanesa R. M. es una mujer joven, quien es dueña de una miscelánea y venta de licor la cual adquirió desde hace 2 años gracias a la inversión que hicieron sus padres. Esta mujer ahora puede sentirse realizada gracias a que puede ocupar su tiempo en cosas productivas y que lleven ingresos a su hogar. Ella utilizará el crédito otorgado en la compra de distintos productos de mucho movimiento en su negocio.
texts.en:
Karla Vanesa R. M. is a young woman who owns a general store; she also sells liquor. She got it two years ago thanks to an investment her parents made. She can now feel fulfilled because she can use her time in productive activities that produce income for her home. She will use the loan to buy various types of products that sell well in her store.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy products.

loans.name: Esperanza En Ti 1 Group

texts.en:
Altagracia is the coordinator of her group Esperanza en ti 1 (Hope on you). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenges are to buy a computer for my children and to finish studying. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work. She started very young and she likes it a lot.

Altagracia is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for nine years. She started selling in her Mom's business. After some years, she become the owner and had some loans which she used to pay daily. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying pork meats and seasonings. Then she will produce sausage to sell. She will use the profits to build a wall for her house and in a short time, wants to finish building her house.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she had a first one and liked the facilities and learned a little more about business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy pork meat

loans.name: Mery

texts.es: La Señora Mery es una persona  muy joven, tiene un pequeño hijo de tres meses, su esposo trabaja en un restaurante, ella trabaja con el comercio vendiendo poleras juveniles de marcas conocidas, ella reparte su mercadería en los mercados conocidos y populosos de nuestra ciudad y esta feliz ya que con el crédito podrá incrementar su capital ya que quiere comprar mercadería de temporada, es muy trabajadora a su corta edad pero el hecho de ser Madre apresuro su madurez.
texts.en:
Mery is a young person who has a baby son who is 3 months old. Her husband works in a restaurant and she works as a merchant selling brand-name children's shirts. She distributes her merchandise in the busy and well-known markets in her city. She is happy that with this loan she will be able to increase her capital, since she wants to buy seasonal merchandise. She is very hardworking for such a young person, but becoming a mother made her mature more quickly.

Translated from Spanish by Lisa Grobar, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing and jewelry

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana, de 46 años, es una madre de familia muy tierna y amorosa, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y sus 4 hijos a quienes los adora. Hace muchos años atrás se dedicaba en la venta de productos comestibles y a falta de variedad en productos fue perdiendo clientes. Desde entonces hace 2 años, se dedica en la preparación y venta de salchipapas y hamburguesas (papas y pollo frito), en la puerta de su casa. Sus clientes son sus vecinos que gustan de su sazón, casi siempre suelen comprarle muy seguido a su establecimiento, ya que los precios que ofrece son muy asequibles. Esta muy contenta con su actividad, ya que por las mañana se dedica a labores domesticas, más que los fines de semana  sus ventas se duplican más de lo habitual. En adelante piensa instalar su bodega en su misma casa, para diversificar su negocio, con la venta de gaseosas, galletas y demás productos comestibles. Este es su treceavo crédito con MFP, y sabe que el crédito le será muy beneficioso  para aumentar su capital de trabajo, por lo que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Juana piensa invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de madera y listones de maderas, para dividir su casa, asimismo desea comprarse un balón de gas adicional.
texts.en:
Juana, 46, is a tender and loving mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and four children whom she adores. Many years ago she used to sell foodstuffs but due to poor variety of available items gradually lost customers. Since two years ago she has prepared Salchipapas (fried potatoes and fried chicken) and hamburgers to sell in her front yard. Her customers are neighbors that enjoy her seasoning; they tend to come often to consume from her establishment because prices are accessible. She is very happy with her work because she can tend to her domestic chores in the morning and even more because on weekends her sales are double the usual. In the future she plans to install a grocery store in her home in order to diversify her business selling soft drinks, cookies and other food items. This is her 13th loan with MFP. She knows that the loan will be very beneficial to increase working capital so she pledges to repay on time. Juana plans to use the requested loan to buy lumber and wood slats to make room divisions in her house; she also wants to buy an additional container of gas.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy lumber to make room divisions in her house as well as to buy a container of gas.

loans.name: Adolfo

texts.es:
El señor Adolfo tiene 37 años de edad, esta en pareja con la Sra. Adriana de profesión comerciante.
Tienen 2 hijos, ambos menores, uno de ellos cursa la educación primaria y el otro cuenta con dos años de vida.
El señor Adolfo junto con su esposa se dedican a la venta de golosinas y artículos comestibles en los diferentes negocios como: despensas, copetines, casillas, cantinas de colegios entre otros.
A esta actividad se dedican hace 10 años aproximadamente, se iniciaron con la venta ambulante en bolsos, luego adquirieron su primer móvil y así empezaron a cubrir como mínimo a tres ciudades cercanas. 
Actualmente tiene una clientela formada que gracias a la comodidad y los buenos precios de sus productos se mantiene en este rubro tan competitivo.
Solicita el préstamo para la compra de mercaderías tales como: galletitas, golosinas, papas fritas, jugos en polvo, caramelos, chicles, pilas, gomas y aumentar su inventario de mercaderías de electrodomésticos.
texts.en:
Adolfo is 37 years old and he is married with Adriana, a merchant. They have 2 small children and one if going to primary school. The other is only 2 years old. Adolfo together with his wife sell snacks and grocery items to various businesses such as grocery stores, stands, cafeterias, and canteens in schools. He has had this business for about 10 years, having started out by selling in door to door. They soon acquired their first car and started to visit the three closest cities. He has a steady client base now thanks to the convenience and good prices offered, helping maintain his position in the competitive market. He requests a loan to purchase merchandise, including: cookies, candies, chips, juice powders, caramels, gum, batteries, erasers and to supplement his stock of household products.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase cookies, chips, drink powders, caramels, gum, batteries, and erasers.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es:
La Señora Juliana es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en el distrito D. Santiago D. Pupuja,  provincia D. Azángaro y departamento D. Puno, tiene 49 años D. edad, está casada y tiene 05 hijos (04 dependientes y 01 independiente),  la señora solo tiene estudios D. primaria incompleto(5to).

La señora Juliana esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desD. hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos que fue D. S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital D.  su negocio D. compra y  venta D. animales menores.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo  crédito S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar  mas animales para luego engordarlas y poder venderlas en las ferias, también nos cuenta que se ayuda con la chacra.

Su sueño para el futuro  es aumentar el capital D. su negocio y mejorar sus ingresos.
 
Lo que más le gusta D. su Banco Comunal son las reuniones y las capacitaciones.
texts.en:
Juliana is a member of the community bank "Mataro Chico" located in the district of Santiago D. Pupuja in the province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 49 years old and she is married and has 5 children (4 are dependent and 1 is independent). She has a graD. 5 education. Juliana has worked with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 months. She says that with the first loan that Manuela Ramos granted her was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and she supplemented her working capital with those funds. Her business is buying and selling small farm animals. She requests a new loan in the amount of 500 neuvos soles, funds that will be invested in the purchase of more livestock to raise and resell later in fairs. She also has a plantation. Her dreams for the future are to increase her working capital and improve her earnings. What she most enjoys about the community bank are the meetings and the talks given.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase livestock.

loans.name: Marianna

texts.en:
Marianna is divorced with a six-year-old son. She owns a small business selling food at the local market in Uzhgorod town. Marianna started this business several years ago. She decided to choose a food business because the demand does not depend much on the season or other factors. The store she rents is located in a good spot at the market, brining many clients who buy food from her. 

Marianna is a very open person. She is able to provide excellent client service. People love to buy from her and come back again. Recently Marianna was able to increase the space at her store. She needs a loan to purchase more inventories to put on her new shelves. Also, she is going to use part of the loan to purchase a refrigerator.

loans.use: To purchase a refrigerator and additional inventory

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra. Angélica tiene 56 años y su actividad es alquileres de piezas y también de casas, ella es viuda y tiene tres hijas dos ellas ya son casadas y una es la que se quedo a su cargo y está estudiando.
Como tiene todo el tiempo libre una ves una de sus inquilinas le recomendó que haga comidas para la venta los fines de semana especialmente, empezó un sábado y domingo luego los clientes le pedían que haga para todos los días el cual tuvo mucho éxito y el crédito solicitado fue destinado a la compra de un congelador para poder tener en mayor cantidad las cosas.
Agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo y la realización de dicho emprendimiento.
texts.en:
Angelica is 56 years old and she engages in renting rooms and houses; she is a widow and has three daughters: two are married and one is a student and is still economically dependent on her. She has a lot of free time, and one of her tenants recommended to her to prepare and sell food especially during the week-ends: she did so one Saturday and one Sunday, and her customers asked her to prepare and sell food every day, and the activity was a great success. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy a freezer in order to be able to store a wider variety of items. She is thankful to Fundación Paraguaya for their support in the realization of this activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a freezer.

loans.name: Candida Cruz

texts.es: La señora Candida desde sus inicios, dice que le gusta su actividad, ella está a cargo del negocio como es una carpintería. Ella tiene 3 hijos pero solamente 1 está a su cargo, pues los otros le ayudan con el negocio, nos cuenta que ha pasado por muchos problemas como fue la enfermedad de su esposo y fue por medio él que establecen este negocio, que mas tarde es ella quien administra, pues ha luchado para mantenerlo, porque necesita ingresos para el hogar.  Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar madera, pega, junco, barniz, clavos y otros  ya que tiene muchos pedidos. Su deseo es ampliar su negocio para obtener ganancias y generar empleos.
texts.en:
Candida says that she likes her work. She is a carpenter and is in charge of the business. She has 3 children, but only 1 is under her care; the others help her with the business. She tells us that she has had many problems, such as the illness of her husband. He established the business and later she became the manager. She has fought to maintain it, because she needs income for her home. She will use this loan to buy wood, glue, reeds, varnish, nails and other items, as she has many orders. She wants to expand her business to make profits and create jobs.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: working capital

loans.name: Mujeres Con Suenos Y Metas 2 Group

texts.en:
Paulina is the coordinator of her group, Mujeres con suenos y metas 2 (Women with Dreams and goals). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her long-term partner and three children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to build her house with a concrete block structure. It is still wood and she needs a stronger structure. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to work.

Paulina is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year and a half, starting because her husband built a stand to sell goods and she heard about Esperanza loans. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying soda, cookies, fruits, vegetables, snacks and candies, etc. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wants to improve her business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy goods for her food stall

loans.name: Lelia

texts.es:
Lelia  es socia del Banco comunal “Las Retamas” desde hace seis años atrás, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 40 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene estudios superior incompleto.
Lelia tiene tres hijos.

Actualmente se dedica a la artesanía, elabora todo tipo de prendas de vestir, vende a los turistas nacionales e internacionales en el Hotel “TAYPI HUASI”. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/.300.00 nuevos soles,  invirtió en su negocio de comida rápida que vendía en ese entonces.

Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1000.00 nuevos soles, el cual utilizará para comprar  lana de alpaca.
Su sueño para el futuro es tener una tienda de artesanía. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.

Notese en la foto junto a sus hijas.
texts.en:
Lelia has been a member of the Banco Comunal “Las Retamas” ("Broom flowers" Communal Bank) for six years; she lives in the Puno district (located in a province and region bearing the same name), she is 40 years old, she is married and has attended high school but did not complete her studies. Lelia has three children. She is currently engaged in craftsmanship, preparing every type of items of clothing that she then sells to national and international tourist at the Taypi Huasi Hotel. The first loan she requested to Movimiento Manuela Ramos, amounting to 300.00 PEN, was used to invest in her fast food shop, activity she was running at that time. She will request a new loan of 1000.00 PEN that she will use to buy Alpaca wool. In the future she desires to own a craftsmanship shop; the savings are what she likes the most about her Communal Bank. In the picture she is portrayed together with her daughters.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy Alpaca wool

loans.name: Mauricia

texts.es: Mauricia, de 64 años, es divorciada, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia en compañía de sus 2 hijos y sus nietas. Por algunos años vendía dulces en los paraderos de buses, pero lo tuvo que dejar debido a los obstáculos generados por sus competidores, entonces han transcurrido 4 años para dedicarse a la preparación de salchipapas (frituras de pollo y papas), platillos que los vende por las tardes y que gustan a la gente. El punto de su negocio es en la puerta de su casa, en la que con mucha paciencia atiende desde las 6:00pm  hasta 11:00 de la noche a sus vecinos, quienes son asiduos clientes, que gustan de la higiene y su buena sazón. Se siente feliz con su negocio; ya que no tiene  mucha competencia cercana,  y eso le favorece mucho en las ganancias. En adelante anhela instalar un restaurante en su casa. Este es su doceavo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, ya que desea contar con posteriores ayudas. Con el crédito que solicita, podrá comprarse una vitrina y sillas para implementar mejor su negocio.
texts.en:
Mauricia, age 64, is divorced. She is a hard-working mother and lives in her own home with her 2 children and her grandchildren. For some years she sold candies at bus stops, but she had to stop because of the obstacles generated by her competition. Now, for 4 years she has prepared salchipapas (fried chicken and potatoes), a dish that she sells in the afternoons and that people like. She sells from the door of her home, which she does with great patience from 6:00 pm to 11:00 pm. She sells to her neighbours, who are regular customers and like her cleanliness and the flavour of her food. She is happy with her business; since there is not much competition nearby, her earnings are good. In the future she wants to open up a restaurant in her home. This is her twelfth loan with MFP, and she promises to repay all of her quotas on time, since she wants to have future help. With the loan that she is requesting, she will be able to purchase a display cabinet and chairs to better set up her business.

Translated from Spanish by Christine Cooper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy display cabinets and chairs to set up her business

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
La Sra. Liliana tiene tiene 31 años y tiene una despensa con panadería, pero el tema D. la despensa esta dejando porque la panadería esta teniendo mas éxito,su marido trabaja con ella en el reparto y para ello cuenta con una motocarro.
El cliente está solicitando el crédito para la compra D. harinas en bolsas. 
Y agradece a la Fundación por darle la oportunidad D. acceder con el crédito y poder mantener su comercio.
texts.en:
Liliana is 31 years old. She runs a warehouse with a bakery, but she is abandoning the warehouse activity because the bakery is being more successful. Her husband, who works with her, takes care of the deliveries, thanks to a three-wheeler van. The loan she is requesting will be used to buy bags of flour, and she is thankful to our institution for having granted her a loan that allows her to continue her activity.

Translated from Spanish by Emanuela Villa, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To  buy bags of flour

loans.name: Minerva Mirabal 2 Group

texts.en:
Enriketa is the coordinator of her group, 'Minerva Mirabal 2' (named after one of the famed trio of sisters who stood up to Dictator Rafael Trujillo and paid the ultimate price for doing so). She makes her home here in a simple structure with her four children. She says that her most difficult challenge is to study. She needs to finish her studies. In the meantime, she plans to continue enjoying to sew.

Enriketa is excited to be taking her third loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She has had her business for a year, starting when she received her first loan. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business by buying goods for her little colmado where she sell rice, beans, sugar and vegetables and she want to build a wall for her business locale. She will use the profits to reinvest in her business and finish building her home.

This Esperanza associate began with us because she wanted to have a business. Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients (many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti) generally. Her group is located in the urban slums surrounding Santo Domingo. This area, like nearly all impoverished areas of the Dominican Republic, suffers from unreliable running water (none of which is potable) and electricity.

loans.use: To buy goods for her store and build a wall

loans.name: Lorenza

texts.es:
Lorenza es socia del Banco comunal “Chojchoni” desde hace tres años atrás, que pertenece al distrito de Copani, provincia Yunguyo, departamento de Puno, tiene 48 años de edad, de estado civil casada, con grado de instrucción primaria (incompleta), tiene cinco hijos, de los cuales tres son independientes.
Lorenza se dedica a la venta de llicllas que lleva a Bolivia, de mismo modo trae animales menores a lado Peruano, para comercializarlo. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar su capital.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito de S/. 1700.00 nuevos soles, para aumentar  mercadería de llicllas.
Su visión es llevar llicllas a Bolivia al por mayor. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros.
texts.en:
Lorenza has been a member of the community bank named Chojchoni for the past 3 years. she lives in the district of Copani in Yunguyo, Puno. She is 48 years old and she is married. She did not complete primary school. She has five children and of them, three are independent. Lorenza sells sarong wraps in Bolivia. The same way she brings small animals form the Peruvian side of the country for resale. The first loan requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and she used it to supplement her capital funds. She requests a new loan in the amount of 1700 nuevos soles to purchase more sarong wraps. Her dream is to sells wraps in wholesale in Bolivia. What she most enjoys about her community bank is the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase sarong wraps.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es: Nancy tiene 21 años, es una joven soltera, es hija mayor, vive en casa de su padres en compañía de sus dos hermanas. En vista que es la hija mayor, se siente en la responsabilidad de ayudar a sus hermanas y encargarse de la casa. Es por ello que tiene dos empleos: por las mañanas dicta clases de ingles a niños de 5  a 8 años y por las tardes trabaja en un casino durante la noche. Su mayor preocupación, son las comodidades básicas de su casa, es por ello que Nancy se ha propuesto en realizar las instalaciones del lavatorio de su cocina, de ese modo espera contribuir en la mejora de su hogar. Se siente muy feliz por lo que esta realizando, ya que su mayor anhelo, es terminar de construir su casa con todos sus servicios básicos, para brindar una mejor calidad de vida a sus hermanas menores y a su padre. Este es su primer crédito con MFP, y sabe que este dinero le será de mucha utilidad para invertir en su casa, es por ello que se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo. Con el crédito que solicita, va comprar mayólicas para enchapar las paredes de su cocina.
texts.en:
Nancy, 21, is single. She’s the eldest daughter and lives with her parents and two sisters. Because she’s the oldest, she feels responsible to help her sisters and be in charge of the house. Because of this, she has two jobs: in the morning she teaches English to children between the ages of 5 and 8 and in the evenings she works in a casino. Her greatest concerns are the home’s basic comforts. Nancy has, therefore, proposed for herself to install the sink in the kitchen thereby contributing to a home improvement. She feels very happy with what she is accomplishing because her greatest wish is to finish building the house with all the basic utilities so that her younger sisters and father can have a better quality of life. This is her first loan with MFP and she knows that the money will be of great use for her to invest in the house so she pledges to repay on time. She will use the funds to buy tile for the kitchen walls.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ceramic tile to cover the kitchen walls.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
La Señora María Elena es socia del Banco Comunal “Mataro Chico”  ubicado en la provincia de Azángaro y departamento de Puno, tiene 24 años de edad, de estado civil  conviviente y tiene 01 hijo,  la señora estudió educación secundaria (completo).

La señora María Elena esta trabajando con Movimiento Manuela Ramos desde hace 4 meses,  nos cuenta que con el préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue de S/. 500.00 nuevos soles, pudo incrementar el capital de  su negocio de venta de productos lácteos.

En la actualidad la señora solicitará un nuevo  crédito S/. 800.00 nuevos soles, dinero que le servirá para comprar insumos para la elaboración de sus productos.

Su sueño para el futuro  es mejorar su negocio y ser mayorista.
 
Lo que más le gusta de su Banco Comunal son las reuniones, la puntualidad y la facilidad de los préstamos.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a member of the community bank named "Mataro Chico", located in the province of Azangaro in Puno. She is 24 years old and she lives with her boyfriend and together they have a son. She graduated high school. Maria Elena has been with the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) for the past 4 months. The first loan was in the amount of 500 nuevos soles and she used it to supplement the working capital for her dairy business. She requests a new loan in the amount of 800 nuevos soles, funds that will be used to purchase ingredients to make her products. In the future she hopes to improve her business and become a wholesaler. What she most enjoys about the community bank meetings is the meetings, the scheduling and the loan conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase ingredients to make dairy products.

loans.name: Marlene Del Socorro

texts.es: Marlene de 24 años está casada y tiene dos hijos a su cargo. Desde muy joven le gustó trabajar lo hizo durante su adolescencia, con la enseñanza que le brindaron su padres Marlene decide iniciar el negocio de venta y elaboración de comida, se arriesgó en establecer su propio lugar por la necesidad de proporcionar los ingresos para el hogar, debido al precio y a la buena atención que ofrecía a sus clientes su negocio fue creciendo. Este es su primer crédito por el cual asegura cumplir fielmente con sus cuotas de pagos, ya que es principalmente para la compra materia prima necesaria. Por lo que sueña con construir su propia casa y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Marlene, 24, is married and has two children in her care. She’s enjoyed working from a very early age; she started during her adolescence. With the teachings she got from her parents Marlene decided to go into the preparation and sale of food. She ventured to establish her own place motivated by the need to generate household income. Due to the good prices and service she offers her customers the business began to grow. This is her first loan and she assures that she will repay her installments faithfully since it will be used primarily to purchase ingredients. She dreams with building her own house and expanding her business.

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Working capital.

loans.name: Nuevo Renacer 7 Group

texts.en:
Fani is the coordinator of her group, Nuevo Renacer 7 (Rebirth). Her story is representative of her group and of Esperanza's Haitian and Dominican clients, many of whom recently emigrated to the DR from Haiti, generally. Her group is located in the slums north of Santo Domingo, where crime is rampant and where running water (none of which is potable) and electricity are unreliable. She makes her home here in a simple structure with her three children.

Fani is excited to be taking her sixth loan with Esperanza after having successfully repaid her previous loan and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business selling miscellaneous products, like beauty aids and cosmetics. She also wants to buy a hair dryer and hair washer. She has a beauty salon, a little boutique and she is a professional masseuse. She will use the profits to invest in saving toward the future to have a massage school. She enjoys doing her favorites activities like writing, acting and singing. Her most difficult challenge is to print a book she wrote called Change your life.

loans.use: To buy beauty and cosmetics products and miscellaneous items

loans.name: Agripina

texts.es: Agripina tiene 60 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, en compañía de su esposo y sus dos hijas, quienes la apoyan en su trabajo. Hace más de 10 años, se dedica a la preparación y elaboración de panqueques (masa compuesta de harina, zapallo y camote) y café. Su puesto queda a media hora de su casa, lugar muy concurrido, por ser el paradero final de los buses. Es así que a partir de las 3:00 de la tarde hay mucha concurrencia de gente, que gustan de sus platillos. En un inicio solía trabajar sola, por lo que terminaba agotada, conforme pasó el tiempo pudo contar con el apoyo de su sobrina y en ocasiones de su hija. Esta muy contenta con su labor, por lo que sus ganancias son muy buenas y no descuida las labores de su casa. Su mayor anhelo en el futuro es tener un local y poner un restaurante, ya que la cocina le apasiona mucho. Este es su décimo crédito con MFP, y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo como lo viene haciendo hasta hoy en día. Agripina  tiene planeado invertir el crédito solicitado en la compra de un toldo para cubrirse de la lluvia, ya que se encuentra en temporada de invierno, asimismo le ayudará protegerse del sol en verano.
texts.en:
Agripina, 60, is a hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and two daughters who help her with the work. For over 10 years she has worked preparing and making “panqueques” (dough made from flour, pumpkin and sweet potatoes) and coffee. Her stand is half an hour from home in a very crowded spot because it’s the last stop on a bus route. From 3pm on there are a lot of people there that like her dishes. When she started out she used to work by herself but she would finish exhausted. As time went by she was able to count on her niece’s help and occasionally on help from her daughter. She is very happy with her work because her profits are good and she does not neglect her household chores. Her greatest wish is to have a fixed locale to install a restaurant because cooking is a passion of hers. This is her 10th loan with MFP and she pledges to repay all her installments on time like she’s been doing to date. Agripina plans to use the requested funds to buy a tarp to cover herself because it’s the winter rainy season. The tarp will equally protect her from the sun during the summer

Translated from Spanish by Michael Bujazan, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a tarp to protect her food stand from the rain.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
María es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desD. hace diez años, que pertenece al distrito, provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 65 años D. edad, estado civil casada, es analfabeta y tiene cuatro hijos que son independientes.
María se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para pagar al Banco Comunal debe vender 2 unidades cada tres meses. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó en su capital para su negocio D. venta D. ganado vacuno.
Ella solicitará un crédito D. S/.3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar dos toros.
Su visión es seguir adelante con el negocio del engorD. D. toros. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son intereses que gana sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Maria has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past 10 years. it is located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 65 years old and she is married. She is illiterate and she has 4 grown children. Maria is a cattle farmer. In order to make her payments to the community bank she must make 2 sales every three months. The first loan requested from the Manuela Ramos Movement (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and it was used to supplement her working capital. She requests a new loan amounting to 3000 nuevos soles to purchase two bulls. her dreams are to keep her cattle farming business prosperous. What she most enjoys about the community bank meetings is the interest earned through the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls.

loans.name: Maxima

texts.es:
Máxima es socia del Banco comunal “Virgen del Rosario” desD. hace diez años, pertenece al distrito y provincia Yunguyo, departamento D. Puno, tiene 67 años D. edad, D. estado civil casada, cursó hasta primero D. primaria, tiene seis hijos, todos independientes.
Se dedica al engorD. D. ganado vacuno, para pagar al Banquito Comunal debe vender 02 unidades cada cuatro meses. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos, que fue D. S/.300.00 nuevos soles, aumentó su capital D. trabajo.
Ella solicitará un nuevo crédito D. S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles, para comprar dos toros.
Su visión es seguir adelante con el negocio del engorD. D. ganado vacuno. Lo que más le gusta D. su Banquito Comunal son los intereses que ganan sus ahorros.
texts.en:
Maxima has been a member of the community bank named "Virgin of the Rosary" for the past 10 years. It is located in the province of Yunguyo in Puno. She is 67 years old and she is married. She has a graD. 1 education. She has six grown children. She is a cattle farmer and to make her payments she must make 2 sales every four months. The first loan requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was for 300 nuevos soles and it was use as working capital. She requests a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles and it will be used to purchase two bulls. Her dream is to keep her cattle farming business prosperous. What she most enjoys about the community bank is the interest earned from the savings program.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase 2 bulls.

loans.name: Marie Therese

texts.fr:
Madame Marie Thérèse N. est une femme de 42 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est membre du Banc Villageois de NGASCOP 13 ans. Elle a 25 fois de suite reçu de crédit et a toujours remboursé régulièrement. 

Elle fait de l'embouche porcine. Elle mène cette activité depuis plus d'une décennie

Son nouveau crédit lui permettra d'acheter 20 porcs qu'elle embouchera pendant 5 mois au moins avant de les vendre aux bouchers ou bien qu'elle ne les abatte pour vendre la viande.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des condition de vie de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marie Thérèse N. is a 42-year old woman, married and the mother of three children. She has been a member of the Banc Villageois of Ngascop for 13 years. She obtained loans 25 times and always repaid them on time. She raises pigs. She has been in this business for more than ten years. Her new loan will allow her to purchase 20 pigs to fatten them for at least 5 months before reselling them to butchers or slaughtering them and selling the meat herself. Her goal is to help improve the life conditions of her family.

Translated from French by Ekaterina Sukhanova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 20 pigs

loans.name: Mujeres Unidas Group

texts.es:
El comité “KUÑA ATY” está dentro del octavo
 Ciclo del Programa en la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.

 Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes, como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas y otros.
 Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo.
 La Señora Lourdes es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica  a la Venta de productos de primera necesidad. 
En fin realiza varias actividades, como también la venta tortas, minutas es una señora muy creativa en su actividad. 
Ella tiene una familia muy unida con 3 (tres) hijos y su marido quien trabaja como constructor de obra. 

La señora Lourdes solicita el crédito para la compra de mercaderías para el negocio y un freezer.
texts.en:
The group named Kuna Aty is on their eighth loan cycle. They are located in the city of Mariano Roque Alonso. All of the members of the group are very close and they are capable of working together, a unity that reinforces their team. Lourdes is one of the members of the group. she sells basic needs products. But she carries out different activities; she also sells hamburgers and snacks. She is a very creative person in her business. She has a very close knit family made up of her 3 children and her husband. Her husband works as a construction worker. Lourdes requests a loan to purchase merchandise for her business and a freezer.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Compra de mercaderias fideos, azucar, arroz, harina, y freezers

loans.name: Paula Maura

texts.es:
Paula Maura es socia del Banco Comunal “Víctor Echave” desde hace seis  años, pertenece al distrito, provincia y departamento de Puno, tiene 60 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con  grado de instrucción primaria (incompleta), tiene cinco hijos,  solo uno depende de ella.
Paula Maura tiene una empresa de transporte de servicio urbano, que viene  trabajando desde hace muchos años. Con el primer préstamo solicitado al Movimiento Manuela Ramos,  que fue de S/. 300.00 nuevos soles compró  repuestos para un carro.
Ella solicitará  un nuevo crédito de S/. 3000.00 nuevos soles para comprar llantas y repuestos.    
Su visión es aumentar más carros  para servicio público y carga. Lo que más le gusta de su Banquito Comunal son los ahorros y la solidaridad.
texts.en:
Paula Maura has been a member of the community bank named Victor Echave for the past six years. She lives together with her boyfriend and she did not complete primary school. She has five children and only one of them still lives at home. Paula Maura has a public transport company. She has had the business for many years now. The first loan she requested from Manuela Ramos (Kiva Field Partner) was in the amount of 300 nuevos soles and with it she purchased spare parts for her cab. She requests a new loan in the amount of 3000 nuevos soles to purchase tires and spare parts. Her dream is to expand her fleet of taxi cabs and moving trucks. She most enjoys the savings programs and support system in the community bank.

Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase tire and spare parts for her taxi.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora tiene 62 años, es una madre de familia muy trabajadora, vive en su casa propia, junto a su esposo y su hija estudiante. Anteriormente se dedicaba en la venta de comida en los paraderos de buses, sin embargo tuvo que renunciar a ello debido a problemas graves de salud, es así que han transcurrido 5 años por lo que ha decidido vender productos comestibles y bebidas gasificadas en general. Es así que tiene una bodega, para ello tuvo que acondicionar en el interior de su casa, donde atiende calidamente a sus clientes. Se siente muy feliz con su negocio, ya que lo realiza con la ayuda de su esposo, además puede trabajar de manera más tranquila sin descuidar su salud. Lo que más anhela es tener cervezas y ampliar mucho más su negocio. Es su cuarto crédito con MFP y se compromete en pagar todas sus cuotas puntualmente, ya que con este  dinero le ayuda a fortalecer su capital de trabajo. Con el crédito que solicita, piensa incrementar con mercaderías comestibles, para abastecer su bodega.
texts.en:
Nora, 62, is a very hard working mother. She lives in her own house with her husband and her student daughter.
